original: sgra yis ni dbyibs las tha dad pa dang mi gsal bar snang ba'i chos nyid kyis mthong ba 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra yis ni dbyibs las tha dad pa dang mi gsal bar snang ba'i chos nyid kyis mthong ba 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Sound is apprehended by the eye through the nature of appearing as different from shape and unclear.

original: de smras pa /
analyzed: de smras pa /
translated: He says:

original: mngon sum dang sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa dag gi ngo bo nyid gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i bye brag tha dad pa yin pa /
analyzed: mngon sum dang sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa dag gi ngo bo nyid gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i bye brag tha dad pa yin pa /
translated: The nature of the two, direct perception and the cognition arisen from sound, is different, being clear and unclear.

original: sgra las skyes pa'i blo dbang po'i yul la 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra las skyes pa'i blo dbang po'i yul la 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: The cognition arisen from sound does not engage the object of the sense faculty.

original: gal te don gcig can yin yang //
analyzed: gal te don gcig can yin yang //
translated: Even if they have the same object,

original: blo rnams sna tshogs rten can nyid //
analyzed: blo rnams sna tshogs rten can nyid //
translated: the cognitions are based on various things.

original: da ni rna ba la sogs sems //
analyzed: da ni rna ba la sogs sems //
translated: Now, the cognitions of ear and so on

original: tha dad don can de dag las //
analyzed: tha dad don can de dag las //
translated: have different objects from those.

original: zhes bya ba ni /üîΩmngon sum dang lhan cig pa can yin na'ang /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni / mngon sum dang lhan cig pa can yin na'ang /
translated: This is saying:

original: sgras bskyed pa'i blo rnams rgyu du ma can nyid de de snang ba tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: sgras bskyed pa'i blo rnams rgyu du ma can nyid de de snang ba tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Even though they are simultaneous with direct perception, the cognitions produced by sound have many causes, and they appear differently.

original: 'di ltar mig ser gyis khebs pa'i shes pas dkar po yang ser por rten tha dad pas mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar mig ser gyis khebs pa'i shes pas dkar po yang ser por rten tha dad pas mthong ba yin la /
translated: Thus, a cognition covered by jaundice sees white as yellow.

original: rab rib kyis bsgribs pa'i mig gis kyang mi gsal bar mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: rab rib kyis bsgribs pa'i mig gis kyang mi gsal bar mthong ba yin no //
translated: Even the eye obscured by cataracts sees unclearly.

original: de bzhin du 'dir yang mig gi nye bar len pa las skyes pa'i shes pas gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid yongs su gcod la sgra'i rjes su 'brang ba'i shes pa skyes pas ni mi gsal bar 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir yang mig gi nye bar len pa las skyes pa'i shes pas gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid yongs su gcod la sgra'i rjes su 'brang ba'i shes pa skyes pas ni mi gsal bar 'dzin pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In the same way, here also, the consciousness arisen from the eye‚Äôs appropriator determines the clear nature, but the consciousness arisen from the sound‚Äôs appropriator apprehends unclearly.

original: de lta na 'o na da ni rten tha dad pas snang ba tha dad par khas len na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na da ni rten tha dad pas snang ba tha dad par khas len na /
translated: If that is so, then now, since the appearance is accepted as different due to the different supports,

original: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i yul can yin no zhes bya ba ji ltar shes /
analyzed: rna ba'i rnam par shes pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i yul can yin no zhes bya ba ji ltar shes /
translated: how is it known that the object of the different ear consciousnesses and so on is different?

original: de bas na tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bas na tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa nyams par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore the presentation of difference would be undermined.

original: 'di ltar sgra la sogs pa la yang rten tha dad pa nyid yis snang ba tha dad par brjod par nus la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra la sogs pa la yang rten tha dad pa nyid yis snang ba tha dad par brjod par nus la /
translated: In the same way, it is possible to say that the appearance is different due to the different supports even in the case of sound and so on.

original: dung la ser pos snang ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: dung la ser pos snang ba ni yang dag pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: The appearance of yellow in a conch is not real.

original: de bzhin du sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa yang gzhan gyi rnam pa can yin pas 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sgra las skyes pa'i shes pa yang gzhan gyi rnam pa can yin pas 'khrul par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, the consciousness that arises from sound would be mistaken because it has the aspect of another.üîΩMoreover,

original: gzhan yang / sems kyi rten ni gzhan dang gzhan //
analyzed: gzhan yang / sems kyi rten ni gzhan dang gzhan //
translated: If the basis of the mind is different,

original: skye ba yin na dngos gcig po //
analyzed: skye ba yin na dngos gcig po //
translated: Then the single entity

original: de nyid kyi gzugs de tha dad //üîΩrnam pa snang ba can gang las //
analyzed: de nyid kyi gzugs de tha dad // rnam pa snang ba can gang las //
translated: Would have different forms.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: From what would the appearance of aspects arise?

original: mngon sum gyi sems dang sgra'i sems kyi rten de rgyu gzhan dang gzhan las skye ba yin mod kyi /üîΩmig la sogs @98a * //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi sems dang sgra'i sems kyi rten de rgyu gzhan dang gzhan las skye ba yin mod kyi / mig la sogs @98a * //
translated: The basis of the mind of direct perception and the mind of sound is different because it arises from different causes.

original: pa 'ga' zhig tu yin la /
analyzed: pa 'ga' zhig tu yin la /
translated: In some cases, such as the eye,üîΩand in other cases, such as sound and effort, the single entity is ascertained individually.

original: gzhan du sgra dang rtsol ba la sogs pa de so sor nges pa'i dngos po gcig nyid rnam pa du ma ru snang ba gang la yod pa'i rang bzhin de gang las yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du sgra dang rtsol ba la sogs pa de so sor nges pa'i dngos po gcig nyid rnam pa du ma ru snang ba gang la yod pa'i rang bzhin de gang las yin te /
translated: From what does the nature of the appearance of many aspects exist?

original: rgyu tha dad pas shes pa tha dad par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rgyu tha dad pas shes pa tha dad par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Because the causes are different, the consciousnesses are different.

original: don tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don tha dad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the objects are not different.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i don ni gcig kho na yin la /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i don ni gcig kho na yin la /
translated: The object such as blue is only one.

original: de ni sgra shes pas gcig gi tshul du 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: de ni sgra shes pas gcig gi tshul du 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: The sound is apprehended in the manner of one,

original: don la mi gsal ba'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir snang bar rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: don la mi gsal ba'i rnam pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir snang bar rigs pa yin no //
translated: because the object does not have an unclear aspect. It is reasonable that it appears.

original: de bas na dbang po'i shes pa'i yul rang gi mtshan nyid bstan du med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na dbang po'i shes pa'i yul rang gi mtshan nyid bstan du med pa nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because the object of the sense consciousness is the particular that is not indicated,

original: mngon sum rtog pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum rtog pa med pa yin no //
translated: direct perception is nonconceptual.

original: rtog pa med pa'i mngon sum las kun rdzob tu chos dang chos can dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i mngon sum las kun rdzob tu chos dang chos can dang 'brel pa 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the conceptual engages the conventional connection between the phenomenon and the subject through the nonconceptual direct perception,

original: rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa yin no zhes sngar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa 'jug pa yin no zhes sngar bstan pa yin no //
translated: it was previously explained that inference engages.

original: 'o na gal te dbang po'i yul gsal bar snang ba yin la /
analyzed: 'o na gal te dbang po'i yul gsal bar snang ba yin la /
translated: If the object of the sense consciousness appears clearly,

original: sgra'i yul ni mi gsal bar snang ba yin yang mthong ba'i rjes thogs su de nyid 'di yin no zhes ngo shes pas gcig pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: sgra'i yul ni mi gsal bar snang ba yin yang mthong ba'i rjes thogs su de nyid 'di yin no zhes ngo shes pas gcig pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: and the object of sound appears unclearly, it is the same because it is recognized that ‚Äúthat is this‚Äù after seeing it.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩmthong ba rtogs pa med par ni //
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / mthong ba rtogs pa med par ni //
translated: Here, someone says:üîΩBecause the expression, which is conceptual, engages

original: brjod pa rnam rtog dag 'jug phyir //
analyzed: brjod pa rnam rtog dag 'jug phyir //
translated: after seeing, which is nonconceptual,üîΩthe object of sound is not the particular.

original: ba lang la sogs ngo shes pa //
analyzed: ba lang la sogs ngo shes pa //
translated: The recognition of a cow and so on

original: mthong ba las ni bzlog pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mthong ba las ni bzlog pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is the opposite of seeing.

original: ba lang la sogs pa mthong ba'i rjes la ngo shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de yang bzlog pa yin te /
analyzed: ba lang la sogs pa mthong ba'i rjes la ngo shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de yang bzlog pa yin te /
translated: Here, the arising of recognition after seeing a cow and so on is the opposite.

original: ci ltar zhe na /üîΩbrjod pa dang rtog pa dag mthong ba'i don la rtog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: ci ltar zhe na / brjod pa dang rtog pa dag mthong ba'i don la rtog pa med pa ste /
translated: How is that?üîΩIt is explained right now that the expression and the conception do not exist for the object of seeing,

original: 'dzin pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes da lta nyid du de dag bstan to //
analyzed: 'dzin pa med par 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes da lta nyid du de dag bstan to //
translated: because they engage without grasping.

original: de bas na ngo shes pa dngos po 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na ngo shes pa dngos po 'dzin par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, how could recognition be the apprehension of an entity?

original: 'on te sgra dang shes pa rjes su 'gro ba mthong bas rigs rjes su dpag par bya'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sgra dang shes pa rjes su 'gro ba mthong bas rigs rjes su dpag par bya'o zhe na /
translated: But if you think that the inference of a universal is to be inferred from seeing the concomitance of sound and cognition,üîΩthen in response to that, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: de'i phyir / ba lang la sogs mthong la rigs //
analyzed: de'i phyir / ba lang la sogs mthong la rigs //
translated: The universal of a cow and so on

original: brjod dang rnam par rtog pa dag / rjes su 'gro las rjes dpog gang //
analyzed: brjod dang rnam par rtog pa dag / rjes su 'gro las rjes dpog gang //
translated: is inferred from the concomitance of expression and conception.

original: de yang des ni sun 'byin to //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de yang des ni sun 'byin to //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
translated: That also is refuted by that.

original: brjod pa dang rnam par rtog pa de dag rjes su 'gro ba las mthong ba'i ba lang la sogs pa'i gong bu la rigs dang yon tan la sogs pa gang yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa de yang /
analyzed: brjod pa dang rnam par rtog pa de dag rjes su 'gro ba las mthong ba'i ba lang la sogs pa'i gong bu la rigs dang yon tan la sogs pa gang yin pa'i rjes su dpag pa de yang /
translated: The inference of the class, qualities, etc. of the cow, etc. that are seen, from the fact that they are the same as the words and concepts,

original: des ni ste brjod pa dang rtog pa dag mthong ba 'dzin pa med par 'jug pa zhes bya ba 'dis sun phyung ba yin no //
analyzed: des ni ste brjod pa dang rtog pa dag mthong ba 'dzin pa med par 'jug pa zhes bya ba 'dis sun phyung ba yin no //
translated: is refuted by the statement ‚Äúthat is not the case, because words and concepts do not engage without apprehending what is seen.‚Äù

original: brjod pa dang rtog pa dag dngos po 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa dang rtog pa dag dngos po 'dzin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Words and concepts do not apprehend things,

original: snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are different from the appearance.

original: de bas na brjod @98b pa tsam rjes su 'gro ba yang des don grub pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na brjod @98b pa tsam rjes su 'gro ba yang des don grub pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mere presence of words does not establish the object.üîΩBut if the class does not exist, how can it be said that ‚Äúthis is the same cow‚Äù?

original: 'o na gal te rigs yod pa ma yin na ba lang de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba 'di dag ji ltar yod par 'gyur zhe na 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rigs yod pa ma yin na ba lang de nyid 'di yin no zhes bya ba 'di dag ji ltar yod par 'gyur zhe na 'dir smras pa /
translated: In response to this, it is said:

original: mthong ba nyid ni tha dad kyang //
analyzed: mthong ba nyid ni tha dad kyang //
translated: Although the seeing is different,

original: ngo shes pa zhes bya ba yi //
analyzed: ngo shes pa zhes bya ba yi //
translated: the thought ‚ÄúI recognize it‚Äù

original: rtog pa gcig ni rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: rtog pa gcig ni rang bzhin gyis //
translated: arises naturally as one.

original: byed pa yin zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: byed pa yin zhes bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained.üîΩüîΩ

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: This has already been explained.

original: pan tshun tha dad par 'dzin pa'i shes pa tha dad pa yin yang ngo shes pa zhes bya ba'i rtog pa gcig tu byed pa bzhin du rang bzhin gyis te rigs dang ldan pas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pan tshun tha dad par 'dzin pa'i shes pa tha dad pa yin yang ngo shes pa zhes bya ba'i rtog pa gcig tu byed pa bzhin du rang bzhin gyis te rigs dang ldan pas ni ma yin no //
translated: Here, although the consciousnesses that apprehend the mutual differences are different, just as there is a single thought called ‚Äúrecognition,‚Äù there is no such thing as a single nature, i.e., a single class.

original: 'di ni sngar /
analyzed: 'di ni sngar /
translated: This has been taught earlier:

original: de ltar shes pa tha dad kyang //
analyzed: de ltar shes pa tha dad kyang //
translated: Thus, although the consciousnesses are different,

original: tha dad med pa'i rtog pa skyed //
analyzed: tha dad med pa'i rtog pa skyed //
translated: A nondifferent thought is produced.

original: ces bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: ces bya ba bstan to //
translated: This is what has been taught.

original: de'i phyir rtog pa'i bag chags sad pa las skyes pa can gyi rigs la sogs pa ston pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog pa'i bag chags sad pa las skyes pa can gyi rigs la sogs pa ston pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the teaching of class and so on is produced from the awakening of the latent potentialities of thought.

original: mngon sum ni brjod du med pa'i yul can yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: mngon sum ni brjod du med pa'i yul can yin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: But direct perception has an inexpressible object.

original: yid kyang don dang 'dod chags sogs //
analyzed: yid kyang don dang 'dod chags sogs //
translated: The mind also is the awareness of objects and attachment and so on,

original: rig pa rtog pa med pa nyid //
analyzed: rig pa rtog pa med pa nyid //
translated: But it is not a conceptual awareness.

original: ces bya ba'i mdo de'i rnam par bshad pa ni //
analyzed: ces bya ba'i mdo de'i rnam par bshad pa ni //
translated: The explanation of this sutra is as follows:

original: yid kyang don dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo rig pa ste rtog pa med pa'i mngon sum yin te /
analyzed: yid kyang don dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo rig pa ste rtog pa med pa'i mngon sum yin te /
translated: The mind also is the awareness of objects and the nature of attachment and so on. It is direct perception, but it is not a conceptual awareness.

original: nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: because it is engaged in the aspect of experience.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: yid kyi mngon sum yang dbang po'i shes pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi /üîΩdon sngon po la sogs pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid rig pa ni yid yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi mngon sum yang dbang po'i shes pa 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi / don sngon po la sogs pa dang 'dod chags la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid rig pa ni yid yin te /
translated: Mental perception is not just a sense consciousness alone.

original: nyams su myong ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i rnam pas 'jug pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: The mind that knows the entity of an object such as blue or attachment and so on is mental perception because it is engaged in the aspect of experience.

original: rtog pa med pa'i phyir mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa'i phyir mngon sum yin no //
translated: It is nonconceptual because it is free of conceptuality.üîΩIt is direct perception because it is free of conceptuality.üîΩThe scriptures state that there is mental direct perception.

original: gsung rab las ni yid kyi mngon sum gsungs te /üîΩ'di ltar gzugs ni rnam par shes pa na gnyis kyis shes par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gsung rab las ni yid kyi mngon sum gsungs te / 'di ltar gzugs ni rnam par shes pa na gnyis kyis shes par bya ba ste /
translated: The scriptures state:

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa dang des drangs pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pas so zhes gsungs so //
translated: Form is cognized by two, by eye consciousness and by mental consciousness induced by that.

original: de la 'dir rtsod par byed de /
analyzed: de la 'dir rtsod par byed de /
translated: Here there is an objection:

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid nyams su myong ba'i rnam par 'jug pas shes par bya ba ni /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa nyid nyams su myong ba'i rnam par 'jug pas shes par bya ba ni /
translated: The consciousnesses of the eye and so on are engaged in the aspect of experience.

original: gang mig la sogs pas byas pa de thams cad dbang po'i shes pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang mig la sogs pas byas pa de thams cad dbang po'i shes pa kho na yin no //
translated: Whatever is done by the eye and so on is all just the sense consciousness.

original: 'on te dbang po'i shes pa nyid las yid skyes na ni /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po'i shes pa nyid las yid skyes na ni /
translated: But if the mental consciousness arises from the sense consciousness,

original: de lta mod kyi yid kyis sngar mthong ba'i don 'dzin par 'gyur ro //üîΩde'i phyir / sngar myong ba ni 'dzin pa na //üîΩyid ni tshad ma nyid ma yin //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi yid kyis sngar mthong ba'i don 'dzin par 'gyur ro // de'i phyir / sngar myong ba ni 'dzin pa na // yid ni tshad ma nyid ma yin //
translated: then the mental consciousness would apprehend the object seen by the eye previously.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore it is said:üîΩThe mental consciousness that apprehends

original: sngar dbang po'i shes pas nyams su myong ba'i don 'dzin pa'i @99a * //
analyzed: sngar dbang po'i shes pas nyams su myong ba'i don 'dzin pa'i @99a * //
translated: An object previously experienced

original: yid kyi mngon sum ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid de /
analyzed: yid kyi mngon sum ni tshad ma ma yin pa nyid de /
translated: Is not a valid cognition.üîΩThe mental direct perception that apprehends an object previously experienced by a sense consciousness is not a valid cognition.

original: gzung ba 'dzin pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzung ba 'dzin pa tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because the apprehension of an object that has been apprehended is not a valid cognition.

original: dran pa dang 'dod pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dran pa dang 'dod pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like memory, desire, and so on.

original: 'on te mthong ba'i shes pas ma mthong ba'i don yid kyis 'dzin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te mthong ba'i shes pas ma mthong ba'i don yid kyis 'dzin na ni /
translated: But if the mental consciousness apprehends an object not seen by the seeing consciousness,

original: de la yang /üîΩma mthong 'dzin na'ang long ba las //
analyzed: de la yang / ma mthong 'dzin na'ang long ba las //
translated: then in that case it is said:üîΩEven if it apprehends what is not seen,

original: sogs pas kyang don mthong bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sogs pas kyang don mthong bar 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
translated: The blind would also see objects.

original: dbang po'i shes pa des ma mthong ba'i don yid kyis 'dzin na /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa des ma mthong ba'i don yid kyis 'dzin na /
translated: If the mind apprehends an object not seen by the sense consciousness,

original: 'on pa dang long ba la sogs pas kyang grangs bzhin du sgra dang gzugs kyi don mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on pa dang long ba la sogs pas kyang grangs bzhin du sgra dang gzugs kyi don mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: then the deaf and the blind, etc. would see and hear sounds and forms, respectively, as they wish.

original: de'i phyir 'on pa dang long ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'on pa dang long ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the deaf and the blind would not exist.

original: gzung ba 'dzin par khas blangs na ni yid tshad ma nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzung ba 'dzin par khas blangs na ni yid tshad ma nyid ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one accepts that the mind apprehends the object, then the mind would not be a valid cognition.üîΩNow, in order to demonstrate that the mind does not apprehend the object,

original: da ni gzung ba 'dzin pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni gzung ba 'dzin pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: it is said:

original: skad cig nyid phyir 'das pa yin //
analyzed: skad cig nyid phyir 'das pa yin //
translated: Because of momentariness, it is past.

original: mthong ba yod pa ma yin zhing //
analyzed: mthong ba yod pa ma yin zhing //
translated: It does not exist at the time of seeing.

original: skad cig min na mtshan nyid ni //üîΩkhyad par dang bcas brjod byar 'gyur //
analyzed: skad cig min na mtshan nyid ni // khyad par dang bcas brjod byar 'gyur //
translated: If it is not momentary,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: it would be expressed as having a distinguishing characteristic.

original: dbang po'i shes pas mdzod ba'i don skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pas mdzod ba'i don skad cig ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the object apprehended by the sense consciousness is momentary,

original: 'das pa yin pas yid kyis mthong ba'i dus na yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa yin pas yid kyis mthong ba'i dus na yod pa ma yin no //
translated: it is past at the time of being seen by the mind.

original: gang gi gzung zin pa nyid mthong bar byed pas de ji ltar 'dzin pa yin //
analyzed: gang gi gzung zin pa nyid mthong bar byed pas de ji ltar 'dzin pa yin //
translated: Since it is that which causes the apprehension of what has already been apprehended, how could it be the apprehender?

original: 'on te skad cig ma ma yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te skad cig ma ma yin par 'dod na /
translated: But if you assert that it is not momentary,üîΩthen even if it is not momentary, since it apprehends what is seen, it would not be valid knowledge.

original: 'o na ni skad cig ma nyid ma yin na yang mthong bas yongs su bcad pa 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad mar mi 'gyur ro snyam nas khyad par dang bcas par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'o na ni skad cig ma nyid ma yin na yang mthong bas yongs su bcad pa 'dzin pa'i phyir tshad mar mi 'gyur ro snyam nas khyad par dang bcas par 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the defining characteristic of engagement that is qualified should be stated.

original: gang gi khyad par dang bcas pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi khyad par dang bcas pa'i dngos po 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since it apprehends a thing that is qualified,

original: yid tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: yid tshad ma yin te /
translated: the mental faculty is valid knowledge,

original: rjes su dpag pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa bzhin no //
translated: like inference.

original: gzhan yang / bya ba grub can las la ni //
analyzed: gzhan yang / bya ba grub can las la ni //
translated: Moreover:

original: khyad par cung zad mi byed pa'i ;
analyzed: khyad par cung zad mi byed pa'i ;
translated: It does not perform the slightest function

original: / dbang po can nam gzhan dag gi //üîΩsgrub par byed par ci phyir 'dod //
analyzed: / dbang po can nam gzhan dag gi // sgrub par byed par ci phyir 'dod //
translated: for the possessor of sense faculties or others.

original: ces bya ba la /üîΩrtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gang la yod pa'i bya ba grub pa'i las de la cung zad snga na med pa 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid dbang po can sgrub par byed pa'am /
analyzed: ces bya ba la / rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bya ba gang la yod pa'i bya ba grub pa'i las de la cung zad snga na med pa 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid dbang po can sgrub par byed pa'am /
translated: Why do you assert that it is a means of valid knowledge?üîΩIn this verse, the function that is the characteristic of realization is the object of activity of the function that is accomplished.

original: gzhan zhig 'dzin par 'dod pa yin /
analyzed: gzhan zhig 'dzin par 'dod pa yin /
translated: Why do you assert that it is a means of valid knowledge that apprehends a nature that does not exist in the slightest prior to it, or that it is a means of valid knowledge that apprehends something else?

original: 'on te sngar yongs su bcad pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na tshad ma phyi mas yongs su gcod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sngar yongs su bcad pa'i ngo bo nyid kho na tshad ma phyi mas yongs su gcod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the later valid cognition determines the entity that was previously determined,

original: 'o na yongs su bcad pa'i dngos po ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na yongs su bcad pa'i dngos po ma yin nam /
translated: then is it not the case that the entity is already determined?

original: yang gcod ces bya ba'i don ci zhig yin /
analyzed: yang gcod ces bya ba'i don ci zhig yin /
translated: What is the meaning of the expression ‚Äúdetermines again‚Äù?

original: 'o na khyed kyi yang ma mthong ba'i dngos po la mthong zhes bya ba'i don gcig yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na khyed kyi yang ma mthong ba'i dngos po la mthong zhes bya ba'i don gcig yin zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the meaning of ‚Äúseeing‚Äù is the same as the meaning of ‚Äúnot seeing,‚Äù

original: rang gi ngo bor snang bas mthong ba @99b yin no ;
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor snang bas mthong ba @99b yin no ;
translated: then it is seeing because it appears as its own entity.

original: /'o na mthong ba'i dngos po yang slar snang ba na mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: /'o na mthong ba'i dngos po yang slar snang ba na mthong bar 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that when the entity that was seen appears again, it is seen again,

original: ji ltar dngos po de mthong bar gyur pa de bzhin du de mthong ba yang ma yin nam /
analyzed: ji ltar dngos po de mthong bar gyur pa de bzhin du de mthong ba yang ma yin nam /
translated: then is it not the case that just as that entity is seen, it is seen again?

original: da ni gzhan 'dzin pas ci zhig bya //
analyzed: da ni gzhan 'dzin pas ci zhig bya //
translated: What is the point of apprehending it again?

original: 'on te sngar mthong ba 'das pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sngar mthong ba 'das pa'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say that what was seen previously is past,

original: 'o na ji ltar sngar mthong ba ma gtogs par des bzung ba'i dngos po yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar sngar mthong ba ma gtogs par des bzung ba'i dngos po yod pa yin te /
translated: then how is it that the entity that was apprehended by that previous consciousness exists apart from the previous seeing?

original: gang gis na gzung ba 'dzin par shes pa gzhan gyis 'gyur ba yin /
analyzed: gang gis na gzung ba 'dzin par shes pa gzhan gyis 'gyur ba yin /
translated: By what other consciousness would the object be apprehended?

original: 'on te sngar mthong ba nyid dus gzhan du yod par shes so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sngar mthong ba nyid dus gzhan du yod par shes so zhe na /
translated: But if it is said that the object that was previously seen is known to exist at another time,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: mthong ba'i dus su ba cad pa'i don nyid 'dzi pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba'i dus su ba cad pa'i don nyid 'dzi pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the object that was experienced at the time of seeing is the very same object that is apprehended.

original: shes pa gang gi dus ji srid pa can gyis don de tsam nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: shes pa gang gi dus ji srid pa can gyis don de tsam nyams su myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: For how long does the consciousness that experiences the object last?

original: mthong ba 'gags na ni don yod ces sgrub pa'i tshad ma med do //
analyzed: mthong ba 'gags na ni don yod ces sgrub pa'i tshad ma med do //
translated: If seeing has ceased, there is no valid cognition to establish that the object exists.

original: dngos de las skyes can blo ni //
analyzed: dngos de las skyes can blo ni //
translated: The cognition that arises from that entity

original: thams cad cig car 'byung bar 'gyur //
analyzed: thams cad cig car 'byung bar 'gyur //
translated: would occur all at once.

original: gzhan gyi 'bras min khyad par can //üîΩde la ltos pa 'gal phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi 'bras min khyad par can // de la ltos pa 'gal phyir ro //
translated: It would not be the result of another, because it is special,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: because it would be contradictory to depend on that.

original: gal te dngos po rtag pa yin ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gal te dngos po rtag pa yin ba de'i tshe /
translated: In this regard, if the entity is permanent,

original: don de las skyes pa'i blo gang yin pa de rnams thams cad cig car 'byung zhing skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don de las skyes pa'i blo gang yin pa de rnams thams cad cig car 'byung zhing skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the cognitions that arise from that object would all occur and arise at once.

original: de'i phyir rtag pa la 'jug pa'i shes pa'i dngos po dus mtshungs pa can dus tha dad pa nyid du rtag pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtag pa la 'jug pa'i shes pa'i dngos po dus mtshungs pa can dus tha dad pa nyid du rtag pa 'dzin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the object of a consciousness that engages a permanent thing would not be apprehended as different times.

original: de bas na ji srid du dngos po yod pa de srid du de nyid mthong ba 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na ji srid du dngos po yod pa de srid du de nyid mthong ba 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, as long as the thing exists, the seeing of it would continue to engage.

original: gzhan gyis 'dzin pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'dzin pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would be meaningless for another consciousness to apprehend it.

original: 'on te dngos po'i dus na blo skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te dngos po'i dus na blo skye ba ma yin te /
translated: But if the mind does not arise at the time of the thing,

original: rgyu gzhan las skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu gzhan las skye ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: it would not arise from another cause.

original: de ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: de ni mi rigs te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: grogs byed pa gzhan gyis 'bras bu ma yin pa'i khyad par te gang la phul du ma byung ba yod pa de ni /
analyzed: grogs byed pa gzhan gyis 'bras bu ma yin pa'i khyad par te gang la phul du ma byung ba yod pa de ni /
translated: The difference of a non-result that is assisted by another is that which has no excellence.

original: de la ltos par 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: de la ltos par 'gal ba ste /
translated: It is contradictory for it to rely on another.

original: de'i phyir phan 'dogs pa gzhan gyis rtag pa'i don las rim gyis shes pa skye ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phan 'dogs pa gzhan gyis rtag pa'i don las rim gyis shes pa skye ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, a consciousness that gradually arises from the object of a permanent thing is not assisted by another.

original: nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa can mthong ba las tha dad pa'i yid snang bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa can mthong ba las tha dad pa'i yid snang bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: The mind that has the aspect of experience would not appear different from seeing.

original: des na mi dmigs pas yid kyi mthong sum med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: des na mi dmigs pas yid kyi mthong sum med pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since it is not perceived, is not the mental perception of the eye?

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: We reply:

original: yid ni mthong sum las tha dad par gsung rab las brjod pa ma yin zhing //
analyzed: yid ni mthong sum las tha dad par gsung rab las brjod pa ma yin zhing //
translated: The mental faculty is not described in the scriptures as being different from the eye‚Äôs perception.

original: tha mi dad par yang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha mi dad par yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it not different.

original: 'di ltar gzugs ni shes pa gnyis po dag gis shes pa'o shes gsungs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar gzugs ni shes pa gnyis po dag gis shes pa'o shes gsungs pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is said that form is known by two kinds of consciousness.

original: der yid log par bstan pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: der yid log par bstan pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the mental faculty is taught to be absent there.

original: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tu bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: mngon sum dang rjes su dpag pa dag tu bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is taught to be direct perception and inference.

original: yang na mthong ba dang dran pa dag tu @100a * //üîΩde bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na mthong ba dang dran pa dag tu @100a * // de bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or it is taught to be seeing and memory.

original: res 'ga' dbang po'i shes pas gzugs shes la res 'ga' myong ba las skyes pa'i dran pas gzugs shes pa yin te /
analyzed: res 'ga' dbang po'i shes pas gzugs shes la res 'ga' myong ba las skyes pa'i dran pas gzugs shes pa yin te /
translated: Because sometimes form is known by a sense consciousness and sometimes form is known by memory that arises from experience.

original: mngon sum du byed pa dang mthong sum du mi byed pa'i rig pa'i ma gtogs par gzugs rtogs pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa dang mthong sum du mi byed pa'i rig pa'i ma gtogs par gzugs rtogs pa khyad par med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: There is no difference in the understanding of form except for the distinction between direct perception and nondirect perception.

original: / de bas na yid ni mngon sum las log par mdo las 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / de bas na yid ni mngon sum las log par mdo las 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the mind is not accepted in the s≈´tra as being the opposite of direct perception.

original: yid kyi mngon sum yin mong /
analyzed: yid kyi mngon sum yin mong /
translated: The mind is direct perception.üîΩEven so, there is room for debate by others.

original: de lta na yang gzhan gyis brtsad pa'i skabs yod do zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / de'i phyir dbang po'i rnam par shes //
analyzed: de lta na yang gzhan gyis brtsad pa'i skabs yod do zhe na / smras pa / de'i phyir dbang po'i rnam par shes //
translated: It is said:üîΩTherefore, the mind arises

original: de ma thag rkyen las byung can //
analyzed: de ma thag rkyen las byung can //
translated: from the sense consciousness, which is the immediately preceding condition.

original: yid ni yul gzhan nyid 'dzin byed //
analyzed: yid ni yul gzhan nyid 'dzin byed //
translated: The mind apprehends a different object.

original: de phyir long bas mthong ba min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de phyir long bas mthong ba min // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, the blind do not see.

original: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa nyid de ma thag pa'i rkyen te /
analyzed: dbang po'i rnam par shes pa nyid de ma thag pa'i rkyen te /
translated: The sense consciousness is the immediately preceding condition.

original: nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin pa de las skye ba gang la yod pa'i yid de ni gzhan nyid de dbang po'i shes pa'i yul las tha dad pa nyid de /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rgyu yin pa de las skye ba gang la yod pa'i yid de ni gzhan nyid de dbang po'i shes pa'i yul las tha dad pa nyid de /
translated: The mind that arises from that, which is the appropriating cause, is different, that is, it is different from the object of the sense consciousness.

original: rang gi yul gyi skad cig ma gnyis pa 'dzin par byed do //
analyzed: rang gi yul gyi skad cig ma gnyis pa 'dzin par byed do //
translated: It apprehends the second moment of its own object.

original: gang gi phyir dbang po'i shes pa las skyes pa'i yid yin pa de'i phyir long ba la sogs pas mthong bas te rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dbang po'i shes pa las skyes pa'i yid yin pa de'i phyir long ba la sogs pas mthong bas te rtogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because it is the mental faculty that arises from a sense consciousness, therefore the blind and so on do not see, that is, do not cognize, form.

original: 'o na gal te dbang po'i shes pa las tha dad pa'i yul yid kyis 'dzin pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: 'o na gal te dbang po'i shes pa las tha dad pa'i yul yid kyis 'dzin pa de lta na ni /
translated: If the object that is different from the sense consciousness is apprehended by the mental faculty,

original: gzugs mthong ba'i de ma thag pa'i yid sgra la sogs pa yongs su gcod par 'gyur ro zhen ;üîΩsmras pa / rang don rjes 'gro don ltos can //
analyzed: gzugs mthong ba'i de ma thag pa'i yid sgra la sogs pa yongs su gcod par 'gyur ro zhen ; smras pa / rang don rjes 'gro don ltos can //
translated: then the mental faculty that immediately follows the seeing of form would also ascertain sound and so on.

original: dbang skyes blo ni rgyu yin no //
analyzed: dbang skyes blo ni rgyu yin no //
translated: Reply: The mental faculty is the cause of the sense consciousnesses, which are concomitant with it and depend on it.

original: de phyir gzhan 'dzin yin yang de //üîΩnges par 'dzin par 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: de phyir gzhan 'dzin yin yang de // nges par 'dzin par 'dod pa yin //
translated: Therefore, even though it apprehends other objects,

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩrang gi don ni dbang po'i shes pa'i gzung ba skad cig dang po ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / rang gi don ni dbang po'i shes pa'i gzung ba skad cig dang po ste /
translated: it is asserted that it definitely apprehends its own object.üîΩIn this regard, the object of the sense consciousnesses is the first moment of the object of the sense consciousnesses.

original: de nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i rgyu gang la yod pa de'i don de la ltos pa can gyi dbang po las skyes pa'i blo ni yid kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i rgyu gang la yod pa de'i don de la ltos pa can gyi dbang po las skyes pa'i blo ni yid kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: The mental faculty is the cause of the sense consciousnesses that are concomitant with it and depend on it.

original: de'i phyir rang gi don gyi rjes su 'gro ba can gyi don la ltos pa'i dbang po'i shes pas bskyed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi don gyi rjes su 'gro ba can gyi don la ltos pa'i dbang po'i shes pas bskyed pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is generated by a sense consciousness that depends on an object that is concomitant with its own object,

original: yid de dbang po'i gzung las gzhan pa'i don 'dzin yang nges par 'dzin pa gang la yod pa de'i dngos por de 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: yid de dbang po'i gzung las gzhan pa'i don 'dzin yang nges par 'dzin pa gang la yod pa de'i dngos por de 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: the mental consciousness is the apprehender of an object that is different from the object apprehended by the sense consciousness.

original: skad cig snga ma'i rjes thogs pa'i skad cig gnyis pa 'dzin pa ni yid kyi rna par shes pa yin gyi /
analyzed: skad cig snga ma'i rjes thogs pa'i skad cig gnyis pa 'dzin pa ni yid kyi rna par shes pa yin gyi /
translated: The mental consciousness that apprehends the second moment immediately after the first moment is the mental consciousness.üîΩIt does not apprehend a different object.

original: yul gzhan 'dzin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yul gzhan 'dzin pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the passage.

original: 'di la rtsod par byed de //
analyzed: 'di la rtsod par byed de //
translated: Here there is an objection:

original: gal te dbang po'i sems nyid ni //
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i sems nyid ni //
translated: If the mental consciousness

original: de dang dus mtshungs byed med can //üîΩrang shes dus can don dag na //
analyzed: de dang dus mtshungs byed med can // rang shes dus can don dag na //
translated: does not have a simultaneous agent,üîΩhow can the object that is the object of that consciousness

original: @100b lhan cig byed par ji ltar 'gyur //
analyzed: @100b lhan cig byed par ji ltar 'gyur //
translated: be a simultaneous cause?

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: The answer to that is:

original: gal te dbang po'i shes pa de yid gang gi yul dang dus mi mtshungs pa gang la yod pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzung ba'i don de ji ltar dbang po'i sems kyi shan cig byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te dbang po'i shes pa de yid gang gi yul dang dus mi mtshungs pa gang la yod pa'i yid kyi rnam par shes pa bzung ba'i don de ji ltar dbang po'i sems kyi shan cig byed par 'gyur te /
translated: If the object of the mental consciousness that exists at a time not simultaneous with the sense consciousness is the object of the sense consciousness, how could it be the object of the mental consciousness?

original: yid skyed pa la don gcig byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: yid skyed pa la don gcig byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: The object that generates the mental consciousness is the object of the sense consciousness.

original: dbang po'i sems dang dus mtshungs pa med pa can gyi don lhan cig byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i sems dang dus mtshungs pa med pa can gyi don lhan cig byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the object that is not simultaneous with the sense consciousness is not the object of the mental consciousness.

original: ji ltar dus mtshungs pa med par byed ba byed pa'i dus can gyi don yin /üîΩgang gi phyir rang gi shes pa yin gyi rnam par shes pa'i dus de gang la yod pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar dus mtshungs pa med par byed ba byed pa'i dus can gyi don yin / gang gi phyir rang gi shes pa yin gyi rnam par shes pa'i dus de gang la yod pa ste /
translated: How can the object that is not simultaneous with the sense consciousness be the object of the sense consciousness?üîΩBecause it is the object of its own consciousness, it is the object of the mental consciousness that exists at the time of the sense consciousness.

original: yid kyi rna par shes pa'i yul gyi don rang gi shes pa dang dus mtshungs pa can /
analyzed: yid kyi rna par shes pa'i yul gyi don rang gi shes pa dang dus mtshungs pa can /
translated: The object of the mental consciousness is the object of the sense consciousness.

original: sngar mthong ba'i tshe yod pa myin na ji ltar shes pa lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin zhe na /
analyzed: sngar mthong ba'i tshe yod pa myin na ji ltar shes pa lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen yin zhe na /
translated: If it did not exist at the time of the prior seeing, how could it be the object of the mental consciousness?

original: 'di la lan 'debs pas /
analyzed: 'di la lan 'debs pas /
translated: In response to this,

original: sngar med nus pa med phyir dang // phyis ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: sngar med nus pa med phyir dang // phyis ni dgos pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because there is no potential that did not exist previously, and because there is no purpose for it later.

original: de phyir rgyu kun sngar yod pas //
analyzed: de phyir rgyu kun sngar yod pas //
translated: Therefore, because all causes exist previously,

original: don dang rang blo lhan cig min //
analyzed: don dang rang blo lhan cig min //
translated: the object and the mental consciousness do not exist simultaneously.

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This is what is said.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la dus mtshungs pa can gyi don yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa la dus mtshungs pa can gyi don yod pa ma yin te /
translated: An object that exists simultaneously with mental consciousness does not exist.

original: don ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa las dus snga ma can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa las dus snga ma can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object is antecedent to mental consciousness.

original: yid kyi shes pa'i rgyu yul yin la /
analyzed: yid kyi shes pa'i rgyu yul yin la /
translated: The object is the cause of mental consciousness.

original: rgyur gyur pa'i yul shes pa dang dus mtshungs pa can ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'i yul shes pa dang dus mtshungs pa can ni ma yin te /
translated: An object that is a cause does not exist simultaneously with consciousness,

original: dus mtshungs na ni sngar med par 'gyur la //
analyzed: dus mtshungs na ni sngar med par 'gyur la //
translated: because if they were simultaneous, the object would not exist previously.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni sngar med pa'i don las skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa ni sngar med pa'i don las skye ba ma yin te /
translated: Mental consciousness does not arise from an object that did not exist previously,

original: nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would lack the potential to do so.

original: phyis yin skyes pa'i dus kyi don yod pa la ni dgos pa med pa'i yul te 'bras bu grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis yin skyes pa'i dus kyi don yod pa la ni dgos pa med pa'i yul te 'bras bu grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no purpose for an object that exists later, because the effect has already been produced.

original: rgyu thams cad ni 'bras bu skye ba las sngar bar yod pa de bas na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i don te /
analyzed: rgyu thams cad ni 'bras bu skye ba las sngar bar yod pa de bas na yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i don te /
translated: All causes exist prior to the arising of the effect. Therefore, the object of mental consciousness is not a cause.üîΩ

original: yul rang gi 'dzin par byed pa'i blo dang lhan cig dus mtshungs pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yul rang gi 'dzin par byed pa'i blo dang lhan cig dus mtshungs pa can du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: All causes exist prior to the arising of the effect. Therefore, the object of mental consciousness does not exist simultaneously with the cognition that apprehends it.

original: tha dad dus can ji ltar na //üîΩgzung bar 'gyur zhe na rgyu nyid //
analyzed: tha dad dus can ji ltar na // gzung bar 'gyur zhe na rgyu nyid //
translated: How can something that exists at a different timeüîΩBe apprehended?

original: shes la rnam par gtod nus pa //üîΩrig pa shes pas gzung bar 'dod //
analyzed: shes la rnam par gtod nus pa // rig pa shes pas gzung bar 'dod //
translated: The cause is said to be able to project its aspect to cognition.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: The wise assert that cognition apprehends it.

original: 'on te yid kyi rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i dus can dbang po'i shes pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i dngos po ni yid kyis gzung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yid kyi rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa'i dus can dbang po'i shes pa'i lhan cig byed pa'i dngos po ni yid kyis gzung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the object of mental consciousness exists at a different time from mental consciousness, how can it be apprehended by mental consciousness?

original: 'di la smras pa /üîΩrigs pa shes pa ste mkhas pas bzung ba ni rgyu nyid du 'dod pa yin te /üîΩshes pa rang gi rnam par gtod par nus pa de la 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa / rigs pa shes pa ste mkhas pas bzung ba ni rgyu nyid du 'dod pa yin te / shes pa rang gi rnam par gtod par nus pa de la 'dod kyi /
translated: In response to this, we say:üîΩThe wise assert that the cause is able to project its aspect to cognition.

original: skam @101a * //
analyzed: skam @101a * //
translated: We assert that cognition apprehends that which is able to project its aspect to cognition.

original: pas lcags gong bzung ba bzhin gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pas lcags gong bzung ba bzhin gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not like the object of apprehension of a piece of iron grasped by a magnet.

original: 'o na rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par shes pa la snang ba gzung ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na rang gi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par shes pa la snang ba gzung ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: But is not the appearance in consciousness of the object of apprehension its own nature?

original: de'i rnam pa can skyed pa ni ma yin na /
analyzed: de'i rnam pa can skyed pa ni ma yin na /
translated: If it is not the cause of the production of its aspect,

original: rang gi shes pa la snang ba ni dus mtshungs pa can yin pa de'i phyir ji ltar rgyu nyid gzung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rang gi shes pa la snang ba ni dus mtshungs pa can yin pa de'i phyir ji ltar rgyu nyid gzung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can the appearance in consciousness, which is simultaneous with it, be the cause of the object of apprehension?

original: 'on te snang ba zhes bya ba 'di ci yin te /
analyzed: 'on te snang ba zhes bya ba 'di ci yin te /
translated: But what is this so-called appearance?

original: ci don gyi ngo bo nyid yin nam /
analyzed: ci don gyi ngo bo nyid yin nam /
translated: Is it the nature of the object?

original: 'on te shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin grang na /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa'i ngo bo nyid yin grang na /
translated: Or is it the nature of consciousness?

original: gal te snang ba dngos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: gal te snang ba dngos kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa de lta na ni /
translated: If the appearance is the nature of the object,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid bzhin nam /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid bzhin nam /
translated: then it is like the nature of blue, etc.

original: yang snang ba yang bral bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang snang ba yang bral bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, the appearance would not be separated from the object,

original: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rtag tu snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir rtag tu snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because it is the nature of the object. It would follow that it is always an appearance.

original: 'on te shes pa rgyun 'jig pas snang ba 'gag go zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa rgyun 'jig pas snang ba 'gag go zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the appearance ceases because the continuum of consciousness is destroyed,

original: shes pas snang ba byas pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: shes pas snang ba byas pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt it that consciousness makes the appearance?

original: de ni snga nas yod pa ste dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni snga nas yod pa ste dngos po'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is not, because it is already existent, being the nature of the thing.

original: de la shes pa ci zhig bya //
analyzed: de la shes pa ci zhig bya //
translated: What does consciousness do to it?

original: 'on te shes pa yod na mthong gi gzhan du ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa yod na mthong gi gzhan du ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that one sees when consciousness exists and not otherwise,

original: 'o na snang ba'i byed pa po shes pa yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na snang ba'i byed pa po shes pa yin nam /
translated: is consciousness the agent of the appearance?

original: de ltar ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: it is not,

original: snang ba ni shes pa dang dus mtshungs pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba ni shes pa dang dus mtshungs pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the appearance is simultaneous with consciousness.

original: 'on te snang ba shes pa yin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: 'on te snang ba shes pa yin pa de lta na yang /
translated: But even if the appearance is consciousness,

original: don gyi ngo bo nyid snang ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo nyid snang ba ma yin gyi /
translated: the nature of the object does not appear.

original: 'on kyang shes pa nyid yul gyi rnam pa can du snang ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang shes pa nyid yul gyi rnam pa can du snang ba yin no //
translated: Rather, consciousness itself appears in the aspect of the object.

original: 'on te mig gi rnam par shes pa mig la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i rgyu'i thun mong can yin na /
analyzed: 'on te mig gi rnam par shes pa mig la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i rgyu'i thun mong can yin na /
translated: But if the eye consciousness has a variety of causes, such as the eye,

original: ji ltar nges pa can du don kho na 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar nges pa can du don kho na 'dzin pa yin zhe na /
translated: how is it that it definitely apprehends only the object?

original: smras pa / rgyu ni du ma yod nyid na'ang //
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu ni du ma yod nyid na'ang //
translated: Objection: Although there are many causes,

original: 'bras bu rjes mthun skyed pa gang //
analyzed: 'bras bu rjes mthun skyed pa gang //
translated: the effect is produced in accordance with them.

original: de ni des gzhan ngo bo can //
analyzed: de ni des gzhan ngo bo can //
translated: It has the nature of that which is other than that.

original: de gzung ba zhes brjod pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gzung ba zhes brjod pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: That is said to be apprehended.üîΩIn response, NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: gang gi phyir 'bras bu zhes pa'i rgyu mig la sogs pa du ma yin yang /üîΩrgyu gang zhig gi rjes su byed pa can du skye ba'i 'bras bu de ni rgyu des bzhag pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'bras bu zhes pa'i rgyu mig la sogs pa du ma yin yang / rgyu gang zhig gi rjes su byed pa can du skye ba'i 'bras bu de ni rgyu des bzhag pa ste /
translated: Although the causes of the effect called ‚Äúeye‚Äù are many,üîΩthe effect that is produced in accordance with a cause is established by that cause.

original: rgyu de'i ngo bo nyid 'bras bu gang la gtod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu de'i ngo bo nyid 'bras bu gang la gtod pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the nature of that cause is imparted to whatever effect it produces,

original: 'bras bu des kyang rgyu rnam pa 'jug nus pa de 'dzin no zhes bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: 'bras bu des kyang rgyu rnam pa 'jug nus pa de 'dzin no zhes bya bar brjod do //
translated: it is said that the effect also apprehends the cause that is capable of engaging in its aspect.

original: dper na bu ni pha'i gzugs 'dzin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bu ni pha'i gzugs 'dzin no zhes tha snyad 'dogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the convention that a son resembles his father.

original: de ltar dbang po'i shes pa las yid kyi mngon sum tha dad par khas len par byed na gzhan gyi skyon gyi skabs med de //
analyzed: de ltar dbang po'i shes pa las yid kyi mngon sum tha dad par khas len par byed na gzhan gyi skyon gyi skabs med de //
translated: If one accepts that mental direct perception is different from sense consciousness, then there is no opportunity for the faults of others.

original: bde ba la sogs pa rang rig pa yang yid kyi mngon sum bzhin mngon sum yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa rang rig pa yang yid kyi mngon sum bzhin mngon sum yin no //
translated: And the self-awareness of pleasure, etc. is also perception, like mental perception.

original: 'o na rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin @101b mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par rtog pa'i rang bzhin @101b mngon sum ma yin par 'gyur ba ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it non-perception, since it is of the nature of conceptualization?

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it isn‚Äôt,

original: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad bdag nyid rig pa'i mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad bdag nyid rig pa'i mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all minds and mental functions are perceptions that are self-aware.

original: bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa'i don du'o //
translated: It is the object of the apprehension of pleasure, etc.

original: 'di la rtsod par byed de /
analyzed: 'di la rtsod par byed de /
translated: Here someone objects:

original: rtog pa la rtog pa dang bral ba nyid med pa'i phyir ji ltar mngon sum nyid du rung ste /
analyzed: rtog pa la rtog pa dang bral ba nyid med pa'i phyir ji ltar mngon sum nyid du rung ste /
translated: How can it be perception, since it is not free from conceptualization, as conceptualization is?

original: rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid rtog pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid rtog pa med pa ma yin pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is not non-conceptual, since it is of the nature of conceptualization.

original: 'on te shes pa don la rtog pa yin gyi /üîΩrang gi ngo bo la ma yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa don la rtog pa yin gyi / rang gi ngo bo la ma yin na ni /
translated: But if the cognition is conceptual with regard to the object,üîΩisn‚Äôt it also conceptual with regard to itself?

original: gal te don la rtog pa rang gi ngo bo la yang rtog par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te don la rtog pa rang gi ngo bo la yang rtog par 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: If it is conceptual with regard to the object, won‚Äôt it also be conceptual with regard to itself?

original: don gyi ngo bo nyid la rtog pa ma gtogs par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo nyid la rtog pa ma gtogs par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the nature of the object is only a conception, and there is no nature of the conception.

original: 'dir lan btab pa /
analyzed: 'dir lan btab pa /
translated: Here is the reply:

original: bde sogs bdag nyid gzhan mi brtan //
analyzed: bde sogs bdag nyid gzhan mi brtan //
translated: Pleasure, etc., are not established as having another nature,

original: brda byed par ni nus med can //
analyzed: brda byed par ni nus med can //
translated: and they are not able to make a sign.

original: de phyir de dag rang rig ste //
analyzed: de phyir de dag rang rig ste //
translated: Therefore, they are self-awareness,

original: brjod dang rjes 'brel can ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brjod dang rjes 'brel can ma yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: and they are not related to expression.

original: bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gang zhig la brda byed par mi nus pa yod pa de ni de'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid gang zhig la brda byed par mi nus pa yod pa de ni de'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: That which is not able to make a sign in regard to a nature of pleasure, etc., is the nature of that.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir gzhan la mi brten pa ste thun mong ma yin pa rang rig pa'i yul yin pas te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan la mi brten pa ste thun mong ma yin pa rang rig pa'i yul yin pas te /
translated: Because it is the object of self-awareness, which is not shared, not dependent on another.

original: bde ba'i ngo bo bor na bde ba rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bde ba'i ngo bo bor na bde ba rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the nature of pleasure is abandoned, pleasure is not cognized.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i bde ba'i bdag nyid de la brjod pa dang 'brel par 'jug pa ga la yod /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i bde ba'i bdag nyid de la brjod pa dang 'brel par 'jug pa ga la yod /
translated: How could that nature of pleasure, which is like that, be related to and engage with expression?

original: 'on te sngar bde ba rig pa yin la /
analyzed: 'on te sngar bde ba rig pa yin la /
translated: Or, if it is said that pleasure is cognized first,üîΩand then it is related to expression,

original: phyis brjod pa dang sbyor bar shes pa gzhan gyis byed do zhe na /üîΩma yin te /
analyzed: phyis brjod pa dang sbyor bar shes pa gzhan gyis byed do zhe na / ma yin te /
translated: But another cognition, one that is subsequent, expresses and applies the name.

original: shes pa gzhan skyes pa'i tshe bde ba la sogs pa rnams med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan skyes pa'i tshe bde ba la sogs pa rnams med pa'i phyir te /
translated: That is not so, because when another cognition arises, pleasure and so on do not exist.

original: sngon gyi dus can nyid du shes pa gzhan gyis bde ba rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi dus can nyid du shes pa gzhan gyis bde ba rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because another cognition cognizes pleasure as having the nature of a past state.

original: de'i tshe bde ba rig pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe bde ba rig pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, it would not cognize pleasure,

original: bde ba la sogs pa sngon gyi ngo bo'i rnam pa can du rig par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa sngon gyi ngo bo'i rnam pa can du rig par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: because it would cognize pleasure as having the aspect of a past entity.

original: gzhan gyi bde ba rig pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi bde ba rig pa bzhin no //
translated: It would be like cognizing another‚Äôs pleasure.

original: 'on te bde ba dang dus mtshungs pa can du 'gyur ba'i shes pa gzhan gyis brjod pa sbyor ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bde ba dang dus mtshungs pa can du 'gyur ba'i shes pa gzhan gyis brjod pa sbyor ba yin no zhe na /
translated: But another cognition, one that is simultaneous with pleasure, expresses and applies the name.

original: de'i tshe skyes pa'i bde ba rang la mngon sum du byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de'i tshe skyes pa'i bde ba rang la mngon sum du byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: At that time, is the arisen pleasure not directly perceived?

original: ci la sgra sbyor ba yin /
analyzed: ci la sgra sbyor ba yin /
translated: What is the use of applying a name?

original: 'on te brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir bde ba rig pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te brjod pa dang 'drer rung ba 'dzin pa'i phyir bde ba rig pa ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the cognition of pleasure is conceptual because it apprehends what is suitable to be associated with a name,

original: bde ba brjod pas dben pa nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: bde ba brjod pas dben pa nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that pleasure is not devoid of expression?

original: ji ltar 'drer rung bar shes pa yin pa bde ba dang sgra'i rnam pa dag ni dus mtshungs par snang bas 'drer rung bar snang ba ma yin na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'drer rung bar shes pa yin pa bde ba dang sgra'i rnam pa dag ni dus mtshungs par snang bas 'drer rung bar snang ba ma yin na /
translated: How is it known that they are suitable to be mixed? The aspects of pleasure and sound do not appear as suitable to be mixed, because they appear at the same time.

original: des na da ltar byung ba'i dus nyid du bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa ni gsal ba nyid kyis @102a * //
analyzed: des na da ltar byung ba'i dus nyid du bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa ni gsal ba nyid kyis @102a * //
translated: Therefore, the present time itself is grasped as pleasure, etc. because of clarity.

original: rtog pa med pa nyid myong ba yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa nyid myong ba yin no //
translated: It is not conceptual, and it is experience.

original: 'on te yid kyi rnam par shes pa rtog pa dang bcas par shes par bya ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te yid kyi rnam par shes pa rtog pa dang bcas par shes par bya ba'o zhe na /
translated: But if it is known that mental consciousness is conceptual,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: it is not so.

original: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang rang rig pa la rtog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i ngo bo nyid kyang rang rig pa la rtog pa med pa ste /
translated: The nature of mental consciousness is also nonconceptual in reflexive awareness.

original: phyi rol gyi rnam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rnam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not an external aspect.

original: de bas na rig pa'i dus su skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na rig pa'i dus su skye ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it arises at the time of cognition,

original: ji ltar rtog pa'i yul du 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar rtog pa'i yul du 'gyur /
translated: how can it be the object of conceptualization?

original: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad rang rig pa rtog pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems dang sems las byung ba thams cad rang rig pa rtog pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all minds and mental factors are reflexive awareness that is nonconceptual.

original: 'o na de lta na don la yang shes pa rtog par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na de lta na don la yang shes pa rtog par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: But if that is so, then how could consciousness be conceptual with respect to its object?

original: rtog pas don mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te yang rtog pa don 'dzin pa can yin pa da lta na yang don gyi ngo bo nyid myong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: rtog pas don mi mthong ba'i phyir ro // gal te yang rtog pa don 'dzin pa can yin pa da lta na yang don gyi ngo bo nyid myong ba'i phyir /
translated: Because conceptual consciousness does not see its object.

original: ji ltar rtog par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar rtog par 'gyur /
translated: If conceptual consciousness apprehends its object, then how could it be conceptual, since it experiences the entity of the object?

original: 'on te shes pa'i rnam pa la don gyi rnam par sgro 'dogs pas rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du brjod na ni /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa'i rnam pa la don gyi rnam par sgro 'dogs pas rtog pa dang bcas pa nyid du brjod na ni /
translated: But if you say that it is conceptual because it superimposes the aspect of the object on the aspect of consciousness,

original: 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa bor na sgro 'dogs pa'i sgra'i don yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa bor na sgro 'dogs pa'i sgra'i don yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then the object of a superimposing term that has abandoned the apprehended and apprehender does not exist.

original: 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa'i phyogs gnyis ni rtog pa med pa nyid du brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzin pa dang mi 'dzin pa'i phyogs gnyis ni rtog pa med pa nyid du brjod do zhe na /
translated: The two positions of apprehending and not apprehending are said to be nonconceptual.

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: mngon du mi byed pa'i rnam pa la zhen pa'i shes pa gang la yod pa de rtog pa'o zhes 'jig rten pa 'dod la /
analyzed: mngon du mi byed pa'i rnam pa la zhen pa'i shes pa gang la yod pa de rtog pa'o zhes 'jig rten pa 'dod la /
translated: The world asserts that consciousness that conceives the aspect of nonmanifestation is conceptual.

original: mngon du byed pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal shes pa gang la yod pa de ni mngon sum du brjod do //
analyzed: mngon du byed pa'i mngon pa'i nga rgyal shes pa gang la yod pa de ni mngon sum du brjod do //
translated: The one who has the pride of manifestation is said to be manifest.

original: don dam par ni rig pa thams cad rtog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par ni rig pa thams cad rtog pa med pa ste /
translated: In reality, all cognitions are non-conceptual.

original: rang rig pa nyid la rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid la rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because of the absence of conceptualization in self-awareness.

original: / gzhan yang bag chags kyi dbang gis sngar mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i shes pa 'ga' zhig don la skye ba de ni rtog pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: / gzhan yang bag chags kyi dbang gis sngar mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba'i shes pa 'ga' zhig don la skye ba de ni rtog pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: Moreover, some cognition that arises from the power of latent impressions, following what was previously seen, is conceptual.

original: mthong ba ni don dang 'brel nas skye ba can du 'jug cing nye ba'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'brang ba yin pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni don dang 'brel nas skye ba can du 'jug cing nye ba'i rang bzhin gyi rjes su 'brang ba yin pa'i phyir rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: Because seeing engages in arising in connection with the object, and follows the nature of the near object, it is non-conceptual.

original: bde ba'i rnam pa yang rang rig pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i rnam pa yang rang rig pa ste /
translated: The aspect of pleasure is also self-awareness.

original: rtog pa dang bral bas rtog pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral bas rtog pa med pa yin no //
translated: Because it is free from conceptualization, it is non-conceptual.

original: gang gi phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid brda byed par mi nus pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bde ba la sogs pa'i bdag nyid brda byed par mi nus pa'i phyir /
translated: Because pleasure, etc. cannot be indicated as having the nature of pleasure, etc.

original: bde ba la sogs pa de dag rang rig pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba la sogs pa de dag rang rig pa ste /
translated: Those pleasures, etc. are self-aware.

original: mngon par brjod pa dang rjes su 'brel pa rjod par byed pa'i sgra dang 'brel par yin no //
analyzed: mngon par brjod pa dang rjes su 'brel pa rjod par byed pa'i sgra dang 'brel par yin no //
translated: It is related to the sound that expresses it, which is related to the expression.

original: gzhan gyis smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis smras pa /
translated: Another says:

original: de dag gzhan rig byed min na //üîΩrang gi ngo bo ji ltar rig / don gcig rten can rnam shes kyis //
analyzed: de dag gzhan rig byed min na // rang gi ngo bo ji ltar rig / don gcig rten can rnam shes kyis //
translated: If they are not known by another,üîΩhow are they known by themselves?

original: rig pa yin zhes kha cig zer //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rig pa yin zhes kha cig zer // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Some say: They are known by consciousness that has the same object.

original: re zhig shes pa gang zhig gzhan gyi rig par byed pa des kyang ji srid rang gi ngo bo shes pa ma yin na yang bde ba la sogs pa de gzhan gyi rig par byed pa po ma yin @102b pas rang gi ngo bo ste bdag nyid kyi
analyzed: re zhig shes pa gang zhig gzhan gyi rig par byed pa des kyang ji srid rang gi ngo bo shes pa ma yin na yang bde ba la sogs pa de gzhan gyi rig par byed pa po ma yin @102b pas rang gi ngo bo ste bdag nyid kyi
translated: Here, first, if a consciousness that knows another does not know its own nature, then that consciousness does not know itself, like pleasure and so on.

original: rang bzhin ji ltar rig par 'gyur /
analyzed: rang bzhin ji ltar rig par 'gyur /
translated: How could it know its own nature, its own essence?

original: 'on te rig par bya ba yin pas bde ba la sogs pas rang rig pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rig par bya ba yin pas bde ba la sogs pas rang rig pa'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is known because it is an object of knowledge, then pleasure and so on would be reflexive awareness.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: rang rig pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pa ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because reflexive awareness is not established.

original: 'o na 'di ltar de dag rig pa yin pas shes pa gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa dag rig pa yin te /
analyzed: 'o na 'di ltar de dag rig pa yin pas shes pa gzhan gyi bde ba la sogs pa dag rig pa yin te /
translated: If you say that because they are known, the pleasure and so on of another consciousness are known,üîΩthen that is not so.

original: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: It is like a pot, etc.

original: de lta na 'o na ni bum pa la sogs pa nyid bzhin phyi rol gyi rnam pa can nyid bde ba la sogs pa snang bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na ni bum pa la sogs pa nyid bzhin phyi rol gyi rnam pa can nyid bde ba la sogs pa snang bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If that is so, then like pots, etc., external objects having the aspect of pleasure, etc. would appear.

original: don gcig la bdag la brten pa gang la yod pa'i shes pa des bde ba la sogs pa dag rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: don gcig la bdag la brten pa gang la yod pa'i shes pa des bde ba la sogs pa dag rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the consciousness that has the object of a single thing, which is the basis of the self, is aware of pleasure, etc.

original: de dag phyi rol du snang ba ma yin la /
analyzed: de dag phyi rol du snang ba ma yin la /
translated: Those are not external appearances.

original: bum pa la sogs pa ni don gcig la 'du ba'i shes pas shes par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa ni don gcig la 'du ba'i shes pas shes par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But pots, etc. are not objects of consciousness that are known by a consciousness that is the aggregation of a single thing.üîΩTherefore, they appear to be obstructed.

original: de bas na de dag chod par snang ba'o zhes bye brag pa kha cig zer ba 'di la lan btab pa /üîΩde dang de min dngos tshul can //
analyzed: de bas na de dag chod par snang ba'o zhes bye brag pa kha cig zer ba 'di la lan btab pa / de dang de min dngos tshul can //
translated: This is the response to the assertion of some Vaise~ika:üîΩThe cause of that which is not that thing

original: de dang de min dngos rgyus bskyed //
analyzed: de dang de min dngos rgyus bskyed //
translated: Generates that which is not that thing.

original: shes las tha dad min skyes rgyu //
analyzed: shes las tha dad min skyes rgyu //
translated: The cause of that which is not different from consciousness

original: bde sogs ci ste mi shes yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bde sogs ci ste mi shes yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: How can pleasure, etc. not be consciousness?

original: de'i dngos po'i tshul can ni s'a lu'i myu gu'o //
analyzed: de'i dngos po'i tshul can ni s'a lu'i myu gu'o //
translated: That which is the mode of existence of that thing is the sprout of rice.

original: de rnams de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bskyed pa ste /üîΩs'a lu'i myu gu'i rgyu sa bon la sogs pa las skyes pa ni s'a lu'i myu gu yin la /
analyzed: de rnams de dang de ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis bskyed pa ste / s'a lu'i myu gu'i rgyu sa bon la sogs pa las skyes pa ni s'a lu'i myu gu yin la /
translated: They are produced from causes that are and are not of the same nature as themselves.üîΩA rice sprout is produced from a rice seed, etc., which are its causes.

original: nas kyi myu gu'i rgyu sa bon la sogs pa rnams las skyes pa ni nas kyi myu gu'o//
analyzed: nas kyi myu gu'i rgyu sa bon la sogs pa rnams las skyes pa ni nas kyi myu gu'o//
translated: A barley sprout is produced from a barley seed, etc., which are its causes.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad du 'bras bu tha dad par byed pa ni rgyu tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad du 'bras bu tha dad par byed pa ni rgyu tha dad pa yin te /
translated: Because a cause that is different from another cause produces an effect that is different from the first effect.

original: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa shes pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mig la sogs pa las skyes na /
analyzed: de'i phyir bde ba la sogs pa shes pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mig la sogs pa las skyes na /
translated: If pleasure, etc., is produced from the eye faculty, etc., which are not different from consciousness,

original: ci'i phyir mi shes pa yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir mi shes pa yin /
translated: why is it not consciousness?

original: 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is this:

original: rnam par shes pa las tha dad par bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa ma yin pa de bas na mngon sum ni tha dad par bsgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa las tha dad par bde ba la sogs pa 'dzin pa ma yin pa de bas na mngon sum ni tha dad par bsgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: Since pleasure, etc., is not apprehended as different from consciousness, direct perception does not establish that they are different.

original: 'on te rjes su dpag pas bde ba la sogs pa shes pa las tha dad par rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rjes su dpag pas bde ba la sogs pa shes pa las tha dad par rtogs so zhe na /
translated: But if you think that inference proves that pleasure, etc., is different from consciousness,üîΩwe reply:

original: gal te 'dir bde ba la sogs pa rgyu tha dad pa'i rtags bstan par nus na rjes su dpag par nus te /
analyzed: gal te 'dir bde ba la sogs pa rgyu tha dad pa'i rtags bstan par nus na rjes su dpag par nus te /
