translated: If it could be shown that pleasure, etc. have different causes, then they could be inferred to be different.

original: nges par 'bras bu tha dad pa ni rgyu tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'bras bu tha dad pa ni rgyu tha dad pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not so, because a different effect is not necessarily a different cause.

original: 'on te 'bras bu tha dad pas bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu tha dad par shes so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'bras bu tha dad pas bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu tha dad par shes so zhe na /
translated: But if you know that the causes of pleasure, etc. are different because their effects are different,

original: 'bras bu tha dad pa tsam ni rgyu tha dad par sgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pa tsam ni rgyu tha dad par sgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: then the mere difference of effect does not prove the difference of cause,

original: rgyu gcig las 'bras bu tha dad par mthong ba'i phyir thal ba dang du ba bzhin no //üîΩbde ba dang shes pa tha dad pa sgrub pa'i @103a * //
analyzed: rgyu gcig las 'bras bu tha dad par mthong ba'i phyir thal ba dang du ba bzhin no // bde ba dang shes pa tha dad pa sgrub pa'i @103a * //
translated: because one cause is seen to have different effects, like smoke and fire.üîΩThe difference of effect does not prove the difference of cause, because the difference of effect is not seen in pleasure and consciousness.

original: 'bras bu tha dad pa ma mthong ba de'i phyir rgyu tha dad pa nyid bde ba la sogs pa tha dad pa sgrub byed yin la rgyu tha dad pa ni med pa de bas na rgyu tha mi dad pa can dang ngo bo nyid tha mi dad pa
analyzed: 'bras bu tha dad pa ma mthong ba de'i phyir rgyu tha dad pa nyid bde ba la sogs pa tha dad pa sgrub byed yin la rgyu tha dad pa ni med pa de bas na rgyu tha mi dad pa can dang ngo bo nyid tha mi dad pa
translated: Therefore, the difference of cause is the proof of the difference of pleasure, etc. But there is no difference of cause, so they have the same cause and are not of different natures.

original: can du bde ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa med par shes par bya'o /
analyzed: can du bde ba la sogs pa rnam par shes pa las tha dad pa med par shes par bya'o /
translated: One should understand that pleasure, etc. are not different from consciousness.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Cognition

original: bam po bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu gnyis pa /
translated: Book Twelve

original: rgyu mtshungs pa can nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu mtshungs pa can nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that they are similar causes, it is said:üîΩOne‚Äôs own object, the sense faculty, and the mind,

original: rang gi don dang dbang po dang // sems pa ji ltar rang nus pas //
analyzed: rang gi don dang dbang po dang // sems pa ji ltar rang nus pas //
translated: according to their own capacity,

original: bde ba la sogs skye bar snang //
analyzed: bde ba la sogs skye bar snang //
translated: appear to produce pleasure, etc.

original: yid kyang de dang mtshungs pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yid kyang de dang mtshungs pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The mind is also similar to that.

original: rang gi don ni rang gi yul yid 'phrog pa yod cing /
analyzed: rang gi don ni rang gi yul yid 'phrog pa yod cing /
translated: One‚Äôs own object is the presence of one‚Äôs own captivating object.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po mya ngan la sogs pa'i dngos po mnyams pa dang / ji ltar rang rang skye ba'i nus pa can gyi sems pa bde ba la sogs pa skye bar snang ba dang / mig la sogs pas skyed pa'i yid de yang mtshungs pa yin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po mya ngan la sogs pa'i dngos po mnyams pa dang / ji ltar rang rang skye ba'i nus pa can gyi sems pa bde ba la sogs pa skye bar snang ba dang / mig la sogs pas skyed pa'i yid de yang mtshungs pa yin no //
translated: The sense faculties such as the eye are not impaired by things such as sorrow, and the mind that has the capacity to produce each of them appears to produce pleasure, etc. The mind produced by the eye, etc. is also similar.

original: de'i phyir rgyu tha dad pas tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu tha dad pas tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, they are not different due to different causes.

original: 'on te chos dang chos ma yin pa'i stobs kyis bde ba la sogs pa 'byung gi / rnam par shes pa rgyu mig la sogs pas skyed pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te chos dang chos ma yin pa'i stobs kyis bde ba la sogs pa 'byung gi / rnam par shes pa rgyu mig la sogs pas skyed pa yin na /
translated: and consciousness is produced by the eye, etc. as its cause,

original: de ji ltar rgyu tha dad pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar rgyu tha dad pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: how is it that the cause is not different?

original: de dag yod dang med pa na //üîΩla lar skye zhing mi skye ba'i //
analyzed: de dag yod dang med pa na // la lar skye zhing mi skye ba'i //
translated: If they exist or do not exist,

original: bde sogs sam ni blo snang ba //
analyzed: bde sogs sam ni blo snang ba //
translated: pleasure, etc. or the appearance of awarenessüîΩin some cases arises and in some cases does not arise.

original: des de las gzhan pa skyed min //üîΩzhes bya ba smras te /üîΩmig la sogs pa de dag yod na bde ba la sogs pa ni skye bar mi snang zhing /
analyzed: des de las gzhan pa skyed min // zhes bya ba smras te / mig la sogs pa de dag yod na bde ba la sogs pa ni skye bar mi snang zhing /
translated: Therefore, they are not produced from that.üîΩIf those eye, etc. exist, pleasure, etc. do not appear to arise.

original: mig la sogs pa med na ni bde ba la sogs pa skye bar mi snang ba yin la /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa med na ni bde ba la sogs pa skye bar mi snang ba yin la /
translated: If the eye, etc. do not exist, pleasure, etc. do not appear to arise.

original: mig gi blo yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mig gi blo yang ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the awareness of the eye, etc.

original: mig la sogs pa yod na bde ba la sogs pa'am blo skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa yod na bde ba la sogs pa'am blo skye ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that if the eye, etc. exist, pleasure, etc. or awareness arises.

original: des te de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rgyu de las gzhan pa'i rgyu las bde ba la sogs pa de dag mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: des te de'i phyir rnam par shes pa'i rgyu de las gzhan pa'i rgyu las bde ba la sogs pa de dag mi 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, those pleasures, etc. do not arise from a cause other than that cause of consciousness.

original: chos la sogs pa la bde ba skyed pa'i nus pa med de /
analyzed: chos la sogs pa la bde ba skyed pa'i nus pa med de /
translated: Pleasure is not produced from dharma, etc.,

original: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i sgrub pa thob pa nyid las chos la sogs pa'i bya ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i sgrub pa thob pa nyid las chos la sogs pa'i bya ba mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the activity of dharma, etc., does not occur from the mere presence of desire or aversion.

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu chos la sogs pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa'i rgyu chos la sogs pa nyid yin na /
translated: If dharma, etc., were the cause of pleasure, etc.,

original: phreng ba dang byug pa ster ba la sogs pa med par yang bde ba la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phreng ba dang byug pa ster ba la sogs pa med par yang bde ba la sogs pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: pleasure, etc., would occur even without the presence of the giving of garlands and ointments, etc.

original: 'on te byug pa 'bul ba la sogs pa bde ba'i sgrub pa yod na yang mya ngan gyis bslad na yid bde bar skye ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te byug pa 'bul ba la sogs pa bde ba'i sgrub pa yod na yang mya ngan gyis bslad na yid bde bar skye ba ma yin te /
translated: But even when there is the presence of the cause of pleasure, such as the giving of ointments, etc., if the mind is afflicted by sorrow, mental pleasure does not arise.

original: de'i phyir chos nyid bde ba'i rgyu yin gyi //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos nyid bde ba'i rgyu yin gyi //
translated: Therefore, the nature of dharma is the cause of pleasure,

original: phyi rol pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol pa ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: not the external object.

original: chos ma @103b yin pa nyid mya ngan la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin nam /
analyzed: chos ma @103b yin pa nyid mya ngan la sogs pa'i rgyu ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the nature of adharma the cause of sorrow, etc.?

original: de las sdug bsngal skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de las sdug bsngal skye ba yin no //
translated: From that, suffering arises.

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa med par chos la sogs pa rnams bde ba la sogs pa skye ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa med par chos la sogs pa rnams bde ba la sogs pa skye ba'i rgyu ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, pleasure, etc. are not the cause of the arising of dharma, etc.

original: yang na shes pa ni chos la sogs pa tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: yang na shes pa ni chos la sogs pa tha dad par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Or, how can consciousness be different from dharma, etc.?üîΩWe reply:

original: smras pa / de dag nyid kyi khyad par las//
analyzed: smras pa / de dag nyid kyi khyad par las//
translated: From the difference of those very things,

original: bde sdug la sogs tha dad de //
analyzed: bde sdug la sogs tha dad de //
translated: pleasure, pain, etc. are different.

original: dper na blo de nyid kyis ni //
analyzed: dper na blo de nyid kyis ni //
translated: For example, by that very cognition,

original: gsal dang mi gsal the tshom bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba ste /üîΩmig dang gzugs dang yid la byed pa de dag nyid nang gi khyad par las rtogs pa'i ngo bor mtshungs kyang /
analyzed: gsal dang mi gsal the tshom bzhin // zhes bya ba ste / mig dang gzugs dang yid la byed pa de dag nyid nang gi khyad par las rtogs pa'i ngo bor mtshungs kyang /
translated: like clarity, obscurity, and doubt.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i khyad par skye ste /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i khyad par skye ste /
translated: From the difference of those very things, eye, form, and attention, the nature of understanding is the same, but the difference of pleasure, pain, etc. arises.

original: dper na blo de nyid goms pa'i bye brag gis gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dang the tshom za ba'i khyad par bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na blo de nyid goms pa'i bye brag gis gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dang the tshom za ba'i khyad par bzhin no //
translated: For example, by that very cognition, the difference of clarity, obscurity, and doubt arises from the particularity of habituation.

original: shes rab la sogs pa'i chos blo las tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pa'i chos blo las tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Dharma, etc. are not different from cognition.

original: de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa blo'i bye brag yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du bde ba la sogs pa blo'i bye brag yin no //
translated: So too, the various cognitions of pleasure and so on are also different.

original: 'on te bde ba la sogs pa rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'on te bde ba la sogs pa rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin mod kyi /
translated: But if pleasure and so on are the nature of the cognition that apprehends them,

original: de lta na yang rang rig pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang rang rig pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: then they are not self-awareness.

original: 'o na ji ltar rjes su 'dzin pa dang gnod par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rjes su 'dzin pa dang gnod par byed par 'gyur /
translated: But how can they be experienced and harmful?

original: don gcig la 'du ba'i rnam par shes pas bde ba la sogs pa rig par bya ba rjes su 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: don gcig la 'du ba'i rnam par shes pas bde ba la sogs pa rig par bya ba rjes su 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The consciousness that unifies the single object experiences pleasure and so on.üîΩIn response, Aryadeva says:

original: smras pa / don gang nye bas blo dang ni //
analyzed: smras pa / don gang nye bas blo dang ni //
translated: The mind that is producedüîΩby the object that is present

original: bde sogs de dag skyed pa ni //üîΩde bor nas ni des bde sogs //
analyzed: bde sogs de dag skyed pa ni // de bor nas ni des bde sogs //
translated: experiences pleasure and so on.

original: ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: How can it experience them

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩshes pa gzhan gyis bde ba la sogs pa rig pa na shes pa de dbang po las skyes pa yin nam /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / shes pa gzhan gyis bde ba la sogs pa rig pa na shes pa de dbang po las skyes pa yin nam /
translated: when that object is absent?

original: 'on te shes pa gzhan zhig yin /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa gzhan zhig yin /
translated: When one consciousness experiences pleasure and so on, is that consciousness produced from a sense faculty or is it another consciousness?

original: gal te bde ba la sogs pa rig par byed pa dbang po las skyes pa nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te bde ba la sogs pa rig par byed pa dbang po las skyes pa nyid yin na ni /
translated: If the consciousness that experiences pleasure and so on is produced from a sense faculty,

original: phyi rol gyi don gang zhig nye bas bde ba la sogs par snang ba nyid de yang dbang po las skye ba yin na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gang zhig nye bas bde ba la sogs par snang ba nyid de yang dbang po las skye ba yin na /
translated: If pleasure, etc., are the appearance of an external object that is near, and if they arise from the sense faculty,

original: gzugs la sogs pa snang ba can gyi blo des don de bor nas bde ba la sogs pa ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa snang ba can gyi blo des don de bor nas bde ba la sogs pa ji ltar rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: how can the cognition that perceives form, etc., cognize pleasure, etc., since it is divorced from the object?

original: mig gis bde ba myong ba skyed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: mig gis bde ba myong ba skyed pa ma yin te /
translated: The eye does not generate the experience of pleasure,

original: gzugs mthong ba nyid du nges par byed pa'i phyir ro //

original: de ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin no //

original: de bas na bslad pa las sam /
analyzed: de bas na bslad pa las sam /

analyzed: goms pa'i dbang gis ma rig pa'i rab rib kyi ling tog dang bral na /

analyzed: dngos po med na de'i rang bzhin yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /

analyzed: stobs kyis sprul pa rtog med dang // gsal bar snang ba can du gsungs /

original: zhes @111a * //
analyzed: zhes @111a * //
translated: and to have the appearance of clarity.

original: bya ba la /
analyzed: bya ba la /
translated: Here,

analyzed: goms pa'i stobs kyis bden pa nyid gsal bar snang ba ma yin te / 'di ltar bye brag smra ba ni gtsang ba ste yang dag pa ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i ngo bo nyid can zad par sa dang chu la sogs pa goms pa'i stobs las skyes pa ni gsal ba'i rnam pa can dang gsal ba'i rnam pa can gyi

translated: Thus, VaibhƒÅ·π£hikas assert that yogis generate the meditative attainment of the base of infinite space and so on through the power of familiarity with the elimination of the entity of the mind that engages the impure, that is, the real, and that it has the aspect of clarity and the aspect of non-clarity.üîΩVaibhƒÅ·π£hikas assert that it is non-conceptual.

analyzed: mi bden pas ni sngon gyi shes pa la gnas pa shes pa phyi mas gsal bar byed nus pa yin no //

analyzed: 'o na gal te mi bden pa'i shes pa yang goms pa las skye na ni /

analyzed: ji ltar rnal 'byor pa'i shes pa tshad mar 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: smras pa / de la sngar dpyad dngos po bzhin //

analyzed: bsgoms byung mngon sum tshad mar 'dod //

analyzed: lhag ma nye bar bslad pa yin // zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: / shes pa gang la de gzung bar yod pa de nyid goms pa'i stobs las skyes pa'i shes pa mngon sum gyi tshad mar 'dod la /

analyzed: lhag ma zad par sa la sogs par snang @111b ba ni bslad pa yin no //
translated: The remainder, the appearance of the totality of earth and so on, is a distortion.

analyzed: 'o na gal te zad par sa la sogs pa rnal 'byor pas mthong na ci ste / mi bden par 'gyur zhe na /

analyzed: 'on kyang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi lta bur tshad ma dang ldan pa yin no //

analyzed: tshad mas dpyad na zad par sa la sogs pa gnas pa ma yin pa'i phyir /

original: mi bden pa yin no //
analyzed: mi bden pa yin no //

analyzed: 'o na gal te goms pa'i stobs kyis sprul pa'i shes pa gsal ba'i rnam pa can mngon sum gyi tshad ma yin na /

analyzed: 'di la mdo mdzad pas gsungs pa //

analyzed: rang rig la ni rtog pa yang //

analyzed: tshad mar 'dod kyi don la min //

analyzed: rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la ;

original: rtog pa yang rang rig par gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa yang rang rig par gsal ba yin te /

analyzed: 'di ltar rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid ni gsal ba'i rnam pa can te /

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir slob dpon gyis rang rig pa'i mngon sum gsungs pa /

analyzed: de nyid rnam 'grel mdzad pas bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir /

analyzed: de ni de la rtog pa ste //

original: rang gi ngo bo sgra don min //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo sgra don min //
translated: The intrinsic reality is not the meaning of a word;

analyzed: de phyir de la kun mngon sum // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: therefore, all that is direct perception.

translated: That consciousness which is the consciousness of the object of knowledge which is apprehended by the consciousness that is cut off by the word that expresses it is a thought which is directed to that object of knowledge by the word.

analyzed: shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo nyid rtog pa cig shes ni sgra'i yul ma yin zhing /

analyzed: shes pa de'i rang gi ngo bo la sgra sbyor ba med pa'i phyir shes pa ma lus pa mngon sum yin no //

original: mi gsal ba'i shes pa ni rang gi ngo bo spangs pa las yin na /
analyzed: mi gsal ba'i shes pa ni rang gi ngo bo spangs pa las yin na /
translated: If an unclear consciousness is due to the abandonment of its intrinsic reality,üîΩthen

analyzed: rang gi ngo bo spong bar ji ltar 'gyur /

original: shes pas rang gi ngo bo spong bar mi nus te /
analyzed: shes pas rang gi ngo bo spong bar mi nus te /

original: de'i phyir gzugs dang reg bya sgro 'dogs pas kho bos sngar mthong ba de nyid @113b reg pa 'di yin no zhes bya bar bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas de rjes su 'gro bar rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzugs dang reg bya sgro 'dogs pas kho bos sngar mthong ba de nyid @113b reg pa 'di yin no zhes bya bar bum pa la sogs pa'i rdzas de rjes su 'gro bar rtogs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, by superimposing form and tactility, one understands that the substance, such as the pot, is continuous, thinking, ‚ÄúThat which I saw before is this which I now touch.‚Äù

original: mngon sum ste don mngon du byed pa las skye ba nyams bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ste don mngon du byed pa las skye ba nyams bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Direct perception, which arises from the actualization of the object, is lost.

original: de bas na 'khrul pa dang kun rdzob kyi shes pa ni dbang po las skyes pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na 'khrul pa dang kun rdzob kyi shes pa ni dbang po las skyes pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, in order to show that mistaken and conventional consciousnesses do not arise from the sense faculties,

original: dpe dang don gyi tshig yin no //
analyzed: dpe dang don gyi tshig yin no //
translated: he gives an example and a meaning.

original: 'o na rab rib dang bcas pa'o zhes ci'i phyir brjod de /
analyzed: 'o na rab rib dang bcas pa'o zhes ci'i phyir brjod de /
translated: But why is it said, ‚Äúwith an eye affected by cataract‚Äù?

original: rab rib kyis bcom pa'i snang ba ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'o zhes ci'i phyir zer ba de'i gzhung dgag pa'i phyir rab rib bcas zhes smos so zhe na /
analyzed: rab rib kyis bcom pa'i snang ba ni rtog pa dang bcas pa'o zhes ci'i phyir zer ba de'i gzhung dgag pa'i phyir rab rib bcas zhes smos so zhe na /
translated: To refute that treatise, I say ‚Äúafflicted by cataracts.‚Äù

original: gal te de ltar rab rib kyis bcom pa'i mthong ba rtog pa med na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar rab rib kyis bcom pa'i mthong ba rtog pa med na /
translated: If seeing afflicted by cataracts is non-conceptual,

original: de'i tshe rtog pa drang bral ba'i phyir de mngon sum thob par 'gyur snyam sems na /
analyzed: de'i tshe rtog pa drang bral ba'i phyir de mngon sum thob par 'gyur snyam sems na /
translated: then at that time, since it is free from conceptuality, it would be a form of direct perception.

original: rtog pa dang bral ba thams cad mngon sum ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba thams cad mngon sum ma yin te /
translated: But not all that is free from conceptuality is direct perception.

original: 'on kyang phyin ci log ma yin pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba mngon sum ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyin ci log ma yin pa'i rtog pa dang bral ba mngon sum ste /
translated: However, that which is free from non-mistaken conceptuality is direct perception.

original: 'di ltar dmigs kyis dgar ba'i yul brtags nas spyir btang ba la 'jug par byed ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar dmigs kyis dgar ba'i yul brtags nas spyir btang ba la 'jug par byed ngo //
translated: Thus, having examined the object specifically, one should engage in the general statement.

original: mngon sum gyi dmigs kyis dgar ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi dmigs kyis dgar ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the specific identification of direct perception?

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here it is said:

original: dmigs kyis dgar bzhi pa ste //
analyzed: dmigs kyis dgar bzhi pa ste //
translated: The fourth is the specific identification.

original: de yis nyer bcom las skyes bshad //
analyzed: de yis nyer bcom las skyes bshad //
translated: It is explained to arise from the object specifically identified.

original: de la rab rib 'ba' zhig ni //
analyzed: de la rab rib 'ba' zhig ni //
translated: Here, only cataracts

original: nyer bcom mtshon par byed pa yin //
analyzed: nyer bcom mtshon par byed pa yin //
translated: are what specifically identify the object.

original: zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la //
translated: Thus, it is said.üîΩüîΩ

original: de la mngon sum ltar snang ba de rnams kyi nang nas mngon sum ltar snang ba bzhi pa rab rib kyis mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral ba las dmigs kyis dgar ba ste /
analyzed: de la mngon sum ltar snang ba de rnams kyi nang nas mngon sum ltar snang ba bzhi pa rab rib kyis mngon sum ni rtog pa dang bral ba las dmigs kyis dgar ba ste /
translated: Here, from among the four that are like direct perception, the fourth, direct perception that is like a cataract, is distinguished from that which is free from conceptuality.

original: 'dis 'gyer bar byed pas so //
analyzed: 'dis 'gyer bar byed pas so //
translated: Because it is a cause of error.

original: dmigs kyis dgar ba des kyang mig nye bar bcom pa las skyes pa'i shes pa thams cad bshad pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs kyis dgar ba des kyang mig nye bar bcom pa las skyes pa'i shes pa thams cad bshad pa ste /
translated: And by that distinction, all consciousnesses arisen from eyes affected by cataracts are explained.

original: rab rib dang bcas pa der yang rab rib smos pa ni mig la yod pa'i gnod par byed pa nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab rib dang bcas pa der yang rab rib smos pa ni mig la yod pa'i gnod par byed pa nye bar mtshon pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And the mention of cataracts there is to illustrate the impairment that exists in the eyes.

original: mig nye bar bcom pa las skyes pa'i shes pa thams cad mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: mig nye bar bcom pa las skyes pa'i shes pa thams cad mngon sum ltar snang ba'o //
translated: Therefore all consciousnesses arisen from eyes affected by cataracts are like direct perception.

original: de yang kha cig yin gyi zhes //üîΩsngo dang zla gnyis la sogs blo'i //
analyzed: de yang kha cig yin gyi zhes // sngo dang zla gnyis la sogs blo'i //
translated: And some say that is not so.üîΩThe cause of the cognition of blue, two moons, and so on

original: rgyu ni dbang po yin zhes pa'i //
analyzed: rgyu ni dbang po yin zhes pa'i //
translated: is the sense faculty.

original: gzhung 'di dang ni de dag 'gal //
analyzed: gzhung 'di dang ni de dag 'gal //
translated: This scripture and those are contradictory.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di yid kyis mngon sum nyid de smig rgyu la sogs pa la chur shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis pa la sogs pa'i shes pa 'di yid kyis mngon sum nyid de smig rgyu la sogs pa la chur shes pa bzhin no //
translated: The cognition of a second moon and so on is a direct mental perception, like the cognition of water in a mirage.

original: de'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba tshig gi mi mthun pa'i dpe rab rib yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtog pa dang bral ba tshig gi mi mthun pa'i dpe rab rib yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the example of the eye disease is a nonhomologous example that is free from conceptual thought.

original: dmigs kyis 'ger  ba ni ma yin no zhes kha cig 'chad pa de dag slob dpon gyi gzhung dang @114a * //üîΩ'gal te / gal te'ang dbang po'i rig byed kyi //
analyzed: dmigs kyis 'ger  ba ni ma yin no zhes kha cig 'chad pa de dag slob dpon gyi gzhung dang @114a * // 'gal te / gal te'ang dbang po'i rig byed kyi //
translated: Some explain that it is not a specific example, but they contradict the master's text.üîΩIf the cause of sense consciousness

original: rgyu ni rdul phran yin na yang //
analyzed: rgyu ni rdul phran yin na yang //
translated: were the subtle particle,

original: der snang ba ni ma yin phyir //üîΩde yul ma yin dbang po bzhin //
analyzed: der snang ba ni ma yin phyir // de yul ma yin dbang po bzhin //
translated: it would not appear there

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: and it would not be an object, like the sense faculty.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rgyu dang snang ba bzhin du gzhan la yang gyur ba'i zla ba gnyis dang / mig la sogs pa yang snang ba dang rgyu yin pa de bas na de dag kyang yul yin par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab rgyu dang snang ba bzhin du gzhan la yang gyur ba'i zla ba gnyis dang / mig la sogs pa yang snang ba dang rgyu yin pa de bas na de dag kyang yul yin par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: The subtle particles of blue and so on are the cause and appearance of the second moon and so on, which are different from them and the eye and so on are the appearance and cause of the second moon and so on. Therefore they would also be objects.

original: zla ba gnyis su mthong ba yid nyid yin pa'i gzhung 'di dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //üîΩgal te brgyud pas rgyu yin la /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis su mthong ba yid nyid yin pa'i gzhung 'di dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro // gal te brgyud pas rgyu yin la /
translated: This would contradict the treatise statement, ‚ÄúThe appearance of two moons is the mind itself.‚Äù

original: dbang po shes pa'i spyod yul dag / dpyod par byed na 'di ru ni //üîΩyid kyi gnas skabs ji ltar yin //
analyzed: dbang po shes pa'i spyod yul dag / dpyod par byed na 'di ru ni // yid kyi gnas skabs ji ltar yin //
translated: If it is claimed that the eye is the indirect cause of the appearance of two moons,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: then how could the eye be the basis of the mental state?

original: gal te mig gis bden pa'i zla ba mthong la /
analyzed: gal te mig gis bden pa'i zla ba mthong la /
translated: If the eye sees the real moon,

original: de nas yid la zla ba gnyis snang ba'i phyir brgyud nas yid kyi rgyu mig yin gyi /
analyzed: de nas yid la zla ba gnyis snang ba'i phyir brgyud nas yid kyi rgyu mig yin gyi /
translated: then the mind is the indirect cause of the eye because the appearance of two moons appears to the mind.

original: mngon sum du yid dbang po las skyes pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: mngon sum du yid dbang po las skyes pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The mental faculty is not directly produced from the sense faculty.

original: 'dir smras pa /üîΩdbang po'i shes pa'i spyod yul dpyod par byed pa ni dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa / dbang po'i shes pa'i spyod yul dpyod par byed pa ni dbang po'i shes pa'i yul gang yin zhe na /
translated: Here it is said:

original: gang las dbang po'i shes pa mngon du skyed par byed pa ni de'i rnam pa can gyis yin nam /
analyzed: gang las dbang po'i shes pa mngon du skyed par byed pa ni de'i rnam pa can gyis yin nam /
translated: If the object of the sense consciousness is analyzed, is the object of the sense consciousness that which produces the sense consciousness or is it something else?

original: gzhan du yin zhes bya ba la phyi rol gyi don du smra bas lan gdab dgos na /
analyzed: gzhan du yin zhes bya ba la phyi rol gyi don du smra bas lan gdab dgos na /
translated: The proponents of external objects must give an answer to this.

original: de rnam pa can nyid kyis yul ma yin te /üîΩmi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de rnam pa can nyid kyis yul ma yin te / mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is not the object because it has the aspect of that consciousness.

original: rdul phra rab rnams la rag pa nyid med pa'i phyir dang / shes pa ni rags pa'i rnam pa can yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab rnams la rag pa nyid med pa'i phyir dang / shes pa ni rags pa'i rnam pa can yin no //
translated: It is impossible that it is the object because the subtle particles do not have the nature of being connected and consciousness has the aspect of the gross.

original: 'on te de'i rnam pa can ma yin pa'i shes pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de yul yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de'i rnam pa can ma yin pa'i shes pa'i rgyu gang yin pa de yul yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the cause of a consciousness that does not have the aspect of that object is the object,

original: de yang mi rung ste dbang po bzhin gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i rgyu yin yang yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang mi rung ste dbang po bzhin gzhan gyi rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i rgyu yin yang yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is also unacceptable because, like the sense faculty, it is the cause of a consciousness that has the aspect of another and it is not the object.

original: de la gal te brgyud nas sgyur slob dpon bzhed pa de'i tshe mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis gzhan la dbang po'i yul nyid du ma bstan par mi 'gyur ro //üîΩdes na 'di ni yid kyis skabs su dpyad par mi rigs te /
analyzed: de la gal te brgyud nas sgyur slob dpon bzhed pa de'i tshe mig la sogs pa'i rdul phra rab de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig gis gzhan la dbang po'i yul nyid du ma bstan par mi 'gyur ro // des na 'di ni yid kyis skabs su dpyad par mi rigs te /
translated: If you say that it is the object indirectly, then the master would not have said that the subtle particles of the eye sense faculty and so on are not taught to be the object of the sense faculties in the passage that states:

original: yid kyi yul med pa'i phyir de'i yul dpyad par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yid kyi yul med pa'i phyir de'i yul dpyad par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not logical to analyze this in the context of the mental faculty because the object of the mental faculty does not exist. It is not an object to be analyzed.

original: dbang po gcig yin gal te yang //
analyzed: dbang po gcig yin gal te yang //
translated: If it is one sense faculty,

original: dbang po yod med rjes 'brel can //
analyzed: dbang po yod med rjes 'brel can //
translated: then it is a consciousness that is related to the existence and nonexistence of sense faculties.

original: de mtshungs gal te 'gyur zhe na //
analyzed: de mtshungs gal te 'gyur zhe na //
translated: If it is similar to that,

original: de 'di ci yi phyir na 'gog / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: de 'di ci yi phyir na 'gog / ces bya ba la /
translated: why is it refuted?

original: gal te zla ba gnyis su mthong ba yod min na /
analyzed: gal te zla ba gnyis su mthong ba yod min na /
translated: If the appearance of two moons does not exist,

original: de ni dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa ci zhig yin /
analyzed: de ni dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa ci zhig yin /
translated: then what kind of consciousness arisen from a sense faculty is it?

original: 'on te dbang po rnams yod pa dang med pa'i @114b rjes su 'brel ba'i shes pa gang yin pa dbang po yod na yod la /
analyzed: 'on te dbang po rnams yod pa dang med pa'i @114b rjes su 'brel ba'i shes pa gang yin pa dbang po yod na yod la /
translated: If it is a consciousness that is related to the existence and nonexistence of the sense faculties, and it exists when the sense faculties exist,

original: de med na mi 'byung ba de dbang po las skyes pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung ba de dbang po las skyes pa'o zhe na /
translated: and it does not occur when they do not exist, then it is arisen from a sense faculty.

original: 'o na de dbang po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa dang zla ba gnyis su mthong ba mtshungs te /
analyzed: 'o na de dbang po yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa dang zla ba gnyis su mthong ba mtshungs te /
translated: Well, then, it is similar to the appearance of two moons in being related to the existence and nonexistence of the sense faculties.

original: des na dbang po las skyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na dbang po las skyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore it would be arisen from a sense faculty.

original: 'on te gang zhig dbang por gyur na 'gyur ba'i shes pa de dbang po las skyes pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gang zhig dbang por gyur na 'gyur ba'i shes pa de dbang po las skyes pa'o zhe na /
translated: But if it is a consciousness that would exist if it were a sense faculty, then it is arisen from a sense faculty.

original: de lta na ni dbang po'i 'gyur ba de dang mngon sum ltar snang ba 'di ci'i phyir /üîΩdbang po las skyes pa nyid de la 'gog par byed /
analyzed: de lta na ni dbang po'i 'gyur ba de dang mngon sum ltar snang ba 'di ci'i phyir / dbang po las skyes pa nyid de la 'gog par byed /
translated: If that is so, then why do you refute the fact that the transformation of the sense faculty and the appearance of direct perception arise from the sense faculty?üîΩBecause the sense faculty is the cause of the appearance of direct perception.

original: 'di ltar mig rab rib kyis bcom pa las zla ba la bslad pa'i blo skye ba'i phyir dbang po nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar mig rab rib kyis bcom pa las zla ba la bslad pa'i blo skye ba'i phyir dbang po nyid yin no //
translated: In this way, the sense faculty is the cause of the appearance of direct perception, because the cognition that is mistaken with respect to the moon is produced from the eye that is damaged by cataracts.

original: de'i phyir gal te dbang po las skyes pa yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'brel ba can yin pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir gal te dbang po las skyes pa yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su 'brel ba can yin pa'am /
translated: Therefore, if the existence or nonexistence of the arising from the sense faculty is related to the appearance of direct perception,

original: 'on te mig 'gyur ba las 'gyur ba nyid du 'dod pa de gnyi ga yang mngon sum ltar snang ba la yod do //
analyzed: 'on te mig 'gyur ba las 'gyur ba nyid du 'dod pa de gnyi ga yang mngon sum ltar snang ba la yod do //
translated: or if the transformation of the sense faculty is asserted to be the transformation of the appearance of direct perception, both of these exist in the appearance of direct perception.

original: 'dir yang / sprul la sogs pa 'khrul pa bzhin //
analyzed: 'dir yang / sprul la sogs pa 'khrul pa bzhin //
translated: Here, too, it is just as in the case of the illusion of a double moon and so on.

original: dbang po'i 'gyur ba yod na yang //
analyzed: dbang po'i 'gyur ba yod na yang //
translated: Even when there is a transformation of the sense faculty,

original: ldog 'gyur dbang po bslad pa ni //
analyzed: ldog 'gyur dbang po bslad pa ni //
translated: the transformation of the sense faculty that is mistaken

original: ldog na'ang ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ldog na'ang ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: will not cease even when it ceases.

original: de bzhin gzhan gyi rgyu la ni //
analyzed: de bzhin gzhan gyi rgyu la ni //
translated: In the same way, the other cause

original: res 'ga' brjod pa dag gis 'jog //
analyzed: res 'ga' brjod pa dag gis 'jog //
translated: is sometimes posited by statements.

original: mthong ba dran pa la ltos kyi //
analyzed: mthong ba dran pa la ltos kyi //
translated: Seeing depends on memory.

original: yongs su gsal bar snang ba min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su gsal bar snang ba min // zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is not a clear appearance.

original: gal te zla ba gnyis kyi blo yin yin na ni //
analyzed: gal te zla ba gnyis kyi blo yin yin na ni //
translated: In this regard, if it is the cognition of two moons,

original: de lta na rab rib la sogs pas dbang po bsgyur ba yod na yang zla ba gnyis kyi blo ldog par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na rab rib la sogs pas dbang po bsgyur ba yod na yang zla ba gnyis kyi blo ldog par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then even when the sense faculty is affected by cataracts and so on, the cognition of two moons would not cease.

original: dper na mig rab rib la sogs pas bsgyur bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: dper na mig rab rib la sogs pas bsgyur bar gyur pa na /
translated: For example, when the eye is affected by cataracts and so on,

original: thag pa la dpyad pas sprul du mthong ba ldog pa bzhin /
analyzed: thag pa la dpyad pas sprul du mthong ba ldog pa bzhin /
translated: the perception of a coiled rope as a snake ceases when it is investigated.

original: zla ba gnyis mthong ba ni bden pa'i zla ba brtags kyang ji srid rab rib yod na yod do //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis mthong ba ni bden pa'i zla ba brtags kyang ji srid rab rib yod na yod do //
translated: But the perception of two moons exists as long as the cataracts exist, even when the true moon is investigated.

original: gzhan yang dbang po bslad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang dbang po bslad pa ste /
translated: Moreover, the sense faculty is affected.

original: dbang po gyur pa yod na yang zla ba gnyis kyi blo mi ldog pa nyid de /
analyzed: dbang po gyur pa yod na yang zla ba gnyis kyi blo mi ldog pa nyid de /
translated: Even when the sense faculty is affected, the cognition of two moons does not cease.

original: dpyad pa med na sprul du 'khrul pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dpyad pa med na sprul du 'khrul pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the delusion of a coiled rope as a snake when there is no investigation.

original: de bzhin du res 'ga' gzhan gyi rgyud de rab rib med pa'i lus la brjod pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du res 'ga' gzhan gyi rgyud de rab rib med pa'i lus la brjod pa ste /
translated: Similarly, sometimes the continuum of another person, whose body is free from cataracts, is described as follows.

original: sgra dag gis zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i blo 'jog pa ste skyed par byed pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgra dag gis zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i blo 'jog pa ste skyed par byed pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: The words of the speaker cause the cognition of two moons and so on to be posited, that is, they cause it to arise.

original: sprul la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa bzhin nyid de /
analyzed: sprul la sogs pa'i 'khrul pa bzhin nyid de /
translated: This is just like the error of a rope being a snake.

original: 'di ltar rab rib la sogs pa'i dus na 'di ni sprul lo zhes smra ba'i sgra thos pa las mi gzhan la sprul gyi blo skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di ltar rab rib la sogs pa'i dus na 'di ni sprul lo zhes smra ba'i sgra thos pa las mi gzhan la sprul gyi blo skye bar 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: In the same way that when one hears the words ‚ÄúThis is a snake‚Äù at a time when one has an eye disease, the cognition of a snake arises in one who is not a child,

original: sngar mthong ba'i zla ba gnyis dran pa la zla ba gnyis kyi blo ltos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba'i zla ba gnyis dran pa la zla ba gnyis kyi blo ltos par 'gyur ro //
translated: in the same way, the cognition of two moons depends on the memory of the previously seen two moons.

original: dper na / @115a * //
analyzed: dper na / @115a * //
translated: For example,

original: thag pa la sprul gyi blo ni sngar mthong ba'i sprul dran pa la ltos pa can bzhin no //
analyzed: thag pa la sprul gyi blo ni sngar mthong ba'i sprul dran pa la ltos pa can bzhin no //
translated: the cognition of a snake in a rope depends on the memory of a previously seen snake.

original: gzhan yang zla ba gnyis kyi blo gal te yid yin na gsal bar snang bar mi 'gyur ro /
analyzed: gzhan yang zla ba gnyis kyi blo gal te yid yin na gsal bar snang bar mi 'gyur ro /
translated: Moreover, if the cognition of two moons is the mental faculty, it would not appear clearly.

original: sngar ni thag pa'i blo yang phyi rol na sngon por gsal bar snang ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: sngar ni thag pa'i blo yang phyi rol na sngon por gsal bar snang ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: Previously, was not the cognition of a rope also not clearly apparent as external blue?

original: smig rgyu la chu'i blo yang chung 'khrul pa dbang po las skyes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: smig rgyu la chu'i blo yang chung 'khrul pa dbang po las skyes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of water in a mirage is not born from a sense faculty.

original: gzhan yang rmi lam na snang ba yid la gsal ba yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang rmi lam na snang ba yid la gsal ba yang yin no zhe na /
translated: Moreover, the appearance in a dream is clear.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here we say:

original: thag pa'i sngon po nyid du mthong ba ni dbang po las skyes pa nyid de /
analyzed: thag pa'i sngon po nyid du mthong ba ni dbang po las skyes pa nyid de /
translated: The seeing of the blue of a rope is born from a sense faculty.

original: de yang mig la sogs pa gyur na 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de yang mig la sogs pa gyur na 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Moreover, when the eye, etc. are transformed, it is transformed.

original: sngon po gsal ba nyid ni smig rgyu la gsal bar snang na yang chur zhen pa dran pa las skyes pa ste /
analyzed: sngon po gsal ba nyid ni smig rgyu la gsal bar snang na yang chur zhen pa dran pa las skyes pa ste /
translated: The clarity of the blue, even though it appears clearly in a mirage, is born from the memory of the attachment to water.

original: dran pa med na chu'i rtog pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa med na chu'i rtog pa mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If there were no memory, the idea of water would not arise.

original: rmi lam na snang ba ni goms pa'i stobs las skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rmi lam na snang ba ni goms pa'i stobs las skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: The appearance in a dream is clear because it is born from the power of habit.

original: gsal ba nyid de /
analyzed: gsal ba nyid de /
translated: It is clear.

original: gsal bar gyur pa'i rmi lam gyi shes pa ni rtog pa med pas dbang po las skyes pa'i mngon sum ltar snang ba las khyad par med do //
analyzed: gsal bar gyur pa'i rmi lam gyi shes pa ni rtog pa med pas dbang po las skyes pa'i mngon sum ltar snang ba las khyad par med do //
translated: The dream consciousness that is clear is not different from the appearance born from a sense faculty, because it is nonconceptual, like a perception.

original: de yang kha cig yid kyi zhes //
analyzed: de yang kha cig yid kyi zhes //
translated: Some say that it is mental.

original: zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'dir rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid bzhed pa yin gyi yid tsam ni ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i gzhung 'dir rtog pa dang bcas pa'i yid bzhed pa yin gyi yid tsam ni ma yin no //
translated: In this passage, the mind that is accompanied by conceptualization is intended, not just the mind.

original: de bas na mngon sum ltar snang ba rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bas na mngon sum ltar snang ba rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Therefore, there are two kinds of apparent direct perception:

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa med par bslad pa'o //
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa dang rtog pa med par bslad pa'o //
translated: that which is accompanied by conceptualization and that which is unaccompanied by conceptualization.

original: de la rtog pa med pa'i mngon sum ltar snang ba gang yin pa ni gsal bar snang ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de la rtog pa med pa'i mngon sum ltar snang ba gang yin pa ni gsal bar snang ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Among them, that which is unaccompanied by conceptualization is the cause of clear appearance.

original: dbang po dang goms pa'i don rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: dbang po dang goms pa'i don rnam pa gnyis kho na ste /
translated: There are only two kinds of objects of the senses and of habit:

original: de lta na /
analyzed: de lta na /
translated: If that is so,

original: gnyid log ba'am sad pa na /
analyzed: gnyid log ba'am sad pa na /
translated: then whether one is asleep or awake,

original: gsal bar snang ba can blo gang //
analyzed: gsal bar snang ba can blo gang //
translated: whatever cognition has clear appearance

original: de ni rtog med gnyi gar yang //
analyzed: de ni rtog med gnyi gar yang //
translated: is unaccompanied by conceptualization in both cases.

original: de ltar min na rtog pa yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ltar min na rtog pa yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it were not so, it would be conceptual.

original: yang na ci rtog pa med pa'i shes pa dang rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa ci zhig yin te /
analyzed: yang na ci rtog pa med pa'i shes pa dang rtog pa dang bcas pa'i shes pa ci zhig yin te /
translated: What is a cognition that is unaccompanied by conceptualization and what is a cognition that is accompanied by conceptualization?

original: gang gi phyir yul nyams su myong ba'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yul nyams su myong ba'i shes pa'i mtshan nyid yin na /
translated: Because it is the characteristic of cognition to experience an object,

original: de yang thams cad la mtshungs pa'o zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: de yang thams cad la mtshungs pa'o zhe na smras pa /
translated: If you say that this is the same for all, then we reply:

original: skyes bu gnyid log pa'am sad pa'i tshe blo gsal bar snang ba gang yin pa de nyid rtog pa med pa ste nye ba tsam zhig snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu gnyid log pa'am sad pa'i tshe blo gsal bar snang ba gang yin pa de nyid rtog pa med pa ste nye ba tsam zhig snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When a person is asleep or awake, whatever appears to the clear mind is non-conceptual, because it appears as mere proximity.

original: log pa'am sad pa gnyi gar yang de lta ma yin na ste /
analyzed: log pa'am sad pa gnyi gar yang de lta ma yin na ste /
translated: But it is not so in both cases, when one is asleep or awake.

original: blo mig sal bar snang ba can yin na rtog pa ste /
analyzed: blo mig sal bar snang ba can yin na rtog pa ste /
translated: If it appears to the clear mind, it is conceptual,

original: snga phyir sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snga phyir sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it superimposes earlier and later moments.

original: de'i phyir yid dam dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa la gnas par nyams su myong ba rtog pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir yid dam dbang po las skyes pa'i shes pa la gnas par nyams su myong ba rtog pa med pa ste /
translated: Therefore, in the case of a consciousness arisen from the mental faculty or the sense faculties, the experience of the object is non-conceptual.

original: rtog pa med pa ji snyed pa'i shes pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes @115b bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rtog pa med pa ji snyed pa'i shes pa tshad ma ma yin no zhes @115b bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach that a non-conceptual consciousness is not a valid knowledge, it is said:

original: de phyir de rtog med na yang //
analyzed: de phyir de rtog med na yang //
translated: Therefore, even though it is non-conceptual,

original: tshad ma nyid du bkag pa ste //
analyzed: tshad ma nyid du bkag pa ste //
translated: it is refuted as a valid knowledge.

original: slu ba'i phyir de'i don du'ang //üîΩmngon sum ltar snang bzhi ru bshad //
analyzed: slu ba'i phyir de'i don du'ang // mngon sum ltar snang bzhi ru bshad //
translated: Because it is deceptive,

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: it is explained as a fourfold type of seeming direct perception.

original: zla ba gnyis su snang ba de rtog pa med na yang tshad ma nyid du bkag pa yin te /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis su snang ba de rtog pa med na yang tshad ma nyid du bkag pa yin te /
translated: Although the appearance of two moons is not a conceptual consciousness, it is refuted as a valid cognition,

original: don byed pa la slu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don byed pa la slu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is deceptive with regard to its object.

original: mi slu ba'i shes pa ni tshad ma yin te /
analyzed: mi slu ba'i shes pa ni tshad ma yin te /
translated: A nondeceptive consciousness is a valid cognition.

original: des na gal te rtog pa dang bral ba tshad ma yin na de'i tshe zla ba gnyis su mthong ba yang tshad mar 'gyur ro zhes gang zer ba de gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gal te rtog pa dang bral ba tshad ma yin na de'i tshe zla ba gnyis su mthong ba yang tshad mar 'gyur ro zhes gang zer ba de gsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is clear that you are saying that if a nonconceptual consciousness is a valid cognition, then also seeing two moons would be a valid cognition.

original: de'i don du'ang ste zla ba gnyis su snang ba tshad ma ma yin par bstan pa'i don du slob dpon gyis mngon sum ltar snang ba gnyis su bshad do ;
analyzed: de'i don du'ang ste zla ba gnyis su snang ba tshad ma ma yin par bstan pa'i don du slob dpon gyis mngon sum ltar snang ba gnyis su bshad do ;
translated: The master [DignƒÅga] explained two types of apparent direct perception for the purpose of that, that is, in order to teach that the appearance of two moons is not a valid cognition.

original: / ai ta'i sgra'i rtogs pa'i sde rnam par bcad na logs su rab rib kyis bslad pa mtshon nas bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: / ai ta'i sgra'i rtogs pa'i sde rnam par bcad na logs su rab rib kyis bslad pa mtshon nas bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù eliminates the idea that it is only the one with eye disease that is being taught, since it is indicated by the word ‚Äúalso.‚Äù

original: de ltar ma yin na rab rib can logs su rab rib dang bcas pa'o zhes 'og tu ston par mi byed do //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na rab rib can logs su rab rib dang bcas pa'o zhes 'og tu ston par mi byed do //
translated: If it were not so, then it would not teach later that ‚Äúthe one with eye disease is the one with eye disease.‚Äù

original: de bas na mngon sum rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul par gyur na'o zhes khyad par du slob dpon bzhed par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mngon sum rtog pa dang bral zhing ma 'khrul par gyur na'o zhes khyad par du slob dpon bzhed par shes par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that the master [DignƒÅga] asserts a distinction, saying, ‚ÄúWhen direct perception is free from conceptuality and non-mistaken.‚Äù

original: mngon sum gyi tshad ma bshad zin to //
analyzed: mngon sum gyi tshad ma bshad zin to //
translated: Direct valid cognition has been explained.

original: tshad ma 'di'i 'bras bu ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: tshad ma 'di'i 'bras bu ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the result of this valid cognition?

original: gzhal bya rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhal bya rtogs pa'o //
translated: It is the understanding of the object of comprehension.

original: de skad du yang gzhal bya rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag lus pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad du yang gzhal bya rtogs pa ni tshad ma la rag lus pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said, ‚ÄúThe understanding of the object of comprehension depends on valid cognition.‚Äù

original: khong du chud pa'i shes pa nyid de ni 'bras bu ma yin nam /
analyzed: khong du chud pa'i shes pa nyid de ni 'bras bu ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the very understanding itself the result?

original: de ni tshad ma ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ni tshad ma ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is the valid cognition of that?

original: dbang po dang don phrad pa las skyes pa gtod par byed pa khyad par can gyi shes pa ni tshad ma'o zhes kha cig zer ro //
analyzed: dbang po dang don phrad pa las skyes pa gtod par byed pa khyad par can gyi shes pa ni tshad ma'o zhes kha cig zer ro //
translated: Some say, ‚ÄúThe valid cognition is the special consciousness that arises from the contact of sense faculty and object and directs [the mind].‚Äù

original: rtogs pa'i sgrub byed tshad ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i sgrub byed tshad ma yin gyi /
translated: The means of accomplishing understanding is valid cognition.

original: dbang po la sogs pa rtogs pa'i sgrub byed ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa rtogs pa'i sgrub byed ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the sense faculty, etc. the means of accomplishing understanding?

original: de ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar tshad mar 'gyur /
translated: How can that be valid cognition?

original: de la gzhan dag na re re zhig shes pa ni dbang po la sogs pa las skyes pa yin la /
analyzed: de la gzhan dag na re re zhig shes pa ni dbang po la sogs pa las skyes pa yin la /
translated: In response to this, some say: Cognition arises from the sense faculties and so on.

original: rtog pa yang de nyid las yin na /
analyzed: rtog pa yang de nyid las yin na /
translated: If conceptualization also arises from those,

original: sgrub byed gzhan gyis ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub byed gzhan gyis ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: what is the use of other proofs?

original: smras pa / bya ba dang sgrub byed ces pas //üîΩlas kun gyi ni sgrub byed ni //
analyzed: smras pa / bya ba dang sgrub byed ces pas // las kun gyi ni sgrub byed ni //
translated: In response to this, it is said:üîΩThe agent and the instrument

original: thams cad ma yin bya ba gang //
analyzed: thams cad ma yin bya ba gang //
translated: are not the instrument of all actions.üîΩWhatever is the agent

original: gang de de yi sgrub byed yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /üîΩbya ba yin pas dang sgrub byed yin zhes te /
analyzed: gang de de yi sgrub byed yin // zhes bya ba la / bya ba yin pas dang sgrub byed yin zhes te /
translated: is the instrument of that.

original: las thams cad kyi sgrub byed du thams cad yin par mi rigs //
analyzed: las thams cad kyi sgrub byed du thams cad yin par mi rigs //
translated: Here, the agent and the instrument are not the instrument of all actions.

original: gal te yang shes pa dbang po la sogs pa las mthong ba'i dbang po la sogs pa de nyid shes pa bskyed pa de'i sgrub byed yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang shes pa dbang po la sogs pa las mthong ba'i dbang po la sogs pa de nyid shes pa bskyed pa de'i sgrub byed yin te /
translated: If it is said that cognition arises from the sense faculties and so on, and that very seeing sense faculty and so on that produces cognition is the instrument of that,

original: rtogs pa'i ni ma yin no //üîΩdon khong du chud pa'i skye @116a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i ni ma yin no // don khong du chud pa'i skye @116a * //
translated: it is not the instrument of conceptualization.üîΩFor a person who understands the meaning,

original: bu blo'i me long la don rig pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bu blo'i me long la don rig pa yin gyi /
translated: the meaning is known in the mirror of the mind.

original: dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyi nus pa nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyi nus pa nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But the power of the faculties and so on is not experienced.

original: smras pa / de las nyams myong tsam du ni //
analyzed: smras pa / de las nyams myong tsam du ni //
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:üîΩThe self is the same as the experience

original: shes pa 'dra ba'i bdag nyid can //
analyzed: shes pa 'dra ba'i bdag nyid can //
translated: of consciousness.

original: bdag nyid der 'gyur na gang gis //
analyzed: bdag nyid der 'gyur na gang gis //
translated: If that is so, how can it be distinguished

original: las so so la rnam 'byed 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la ;üîΩde la gal te dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyi nang nas shes pa bdag nyid nyams su myong ba tsam du 'dra ba gang yin pa rtogs pa'i sgrub byed yin pa de'i tshe /üîΩde yang bdag yod pa can gyis 'dod pa'i yul bzhin du thams cad rtog pa dang rtag tu don thams cad shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: las so so la rnam 'byed 'gyur // zhes bya ba la ; de la gal te dbang po la sogs pa rnams kyi nang nas shes pa bdag nyid nyams su myong ba tsam du 'dra ba gang yin pa rtogs pa'i sgrub byed yin pa de'i tshe / de yang bdag yod pa can gyis 'dod pa'i yul bzhin du thams cad rtog pa dang rtag tu don thams cad shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: in relation to each action?

original: de la shes bya thams cad dang dus thams cad 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la shes bya thams cad dang dus thams cad 'dra ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the self is the same as the experience of consciousness, which is similar to the faculties and so on, then, like the object desired by one who has a self, it would always be cognized because it is always the same in nature as all objects of cognition and all times.

original: yul so sor nges pa yang yod pa de bas na bdag nyid yul so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin de'i bdag nyid kyis 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: yul so sor nges pa yang yod pa de bas na bdag nyid yul so sor nges pa'i rang bzhin de'i bdag nyid kyis 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Since the object is also ascertained individually, therefore the self is the nature of the individual ascertainment of the object.

original: bdag nyid gang gis las so sor rnam par 'byed pa ste /üîΩ'di ni sngon po'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid gang gis las so sor rnam par 'byed pa ste / 'di ni sngon po'o //
translated: By what nature does it distinguish the individual actions?üîΩThis is blue.

original: 'di ni ser po'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ser po'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is yellow.

original: 'on te bdag shes bya thams cad la mtshungs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin yang nyan pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad mar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te bdag shes bya thams cad la mtshungs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin yang nyan pa la sogs pa'i 'jug pa ni mngon sum gyi tshad mar 'gyur te /
translated: But even if the self has the same nature with respect to all objects of knowledge, the engagement of hearing and so on is a direct valid knowledge,

original: de yang mngon sum gyi yul nges par ston pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: de yang mngon sum gyi yul nges par ston pa'o zhe na /
translated: and that also ascertains the object of direct perception.üîΩIn response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: smras pa / rgyu la tha dad yod na yang //
analyzed: smras pa / rgyu la tha dad yod na yang //
translated: Even if there is a difference in the cause,

original: 'di yi bdag nyid 'gyur ma yin//
analyzed: 'di yi bdag nyid 'gyur ma yin//
translated: its nature would not change.

original: las tha dad la tha dang med //üîΩtha dad pas nges byed ma yin //
analyzed: las tha dad la tha dang med // tha dad pas nges byed ma yin //
translated: There is no difference in the effect due to a difference in the cause.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: A difference is not ascertained by a difference.

original: rgyu dbang po la sogs pa la tha dad pa yod kyang /
analyzed: rgyu dbang po la sogs pa la tha dad pa yod kyang /
translated: Here, even if there is a difference in the cause, such as the sense faculty,

analyzed: 'di'i bdag nyid du thams cad du tha mi dad pa can tha dad pa'i sngon po la sogs pa'i las la tha dad pas nges par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not differentiated by the activity of the different blue, etc. , because it is not different from all of them in its own nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di'i bdag nyid du ma gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i bdag nyid du ma gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist in the nature of those.

original: bdag la tha dad pa yod kyang byed pa po'am go bar byed par 'gyur grang na de la bdag ni byed pa por 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag la tha dad pa yod kyang byed pa po'am go bar byed par 'gyur grang na de la bdag ni byed pa por 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Even if the self were different, it would not be the agent or the knower.

original: de rtag pa'i phyir dang don gyi rnam pa can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rtag pa'i phyir dang don gyi rnam pa can du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the agent because it is permanent and because it would follow that it would have the form of the object.

original: rnam pa med pa nyid yin na rang gi ngo bo nyid rigs par byed par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa nyid yin na rang gi ngo bo nyid rigs par byed par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it is without form, it would be the agent of its own nature,

original: don ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don ni ma yin te /
translated: but not of the object.

original: rtog pa tsam ni don thams cad la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pa tsam ni don thams cad la thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: 'on te shes par byed pas bdag nges par byed pa yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te shes par byed pas bdag nges par byed pa yin na ni /
translated: But if the self is ascertained by the knower,

analyzed: dbang po tha dad pa mi shes pa nyid ma yin nam /

analyzed: ji ltar shes par byed par 'gyur /

original: de phyir bdag tha dad gang las //
analyzed: de phyir bdag tha dad gang las //

original: 'di yi rtogs pa zhes bya 'di //
analyzed: 'di yi rtogs pa zhes bya 'di //

original: @116b bya ba'i las 'di nges pa yin //
analyzed: @116b bya ba'i las 'di nges pa yin //
translated: This is the activity of that.

original: de'i sgrub byed de grub pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrub byed de grub pa'o //
translated: The proof of that is the establishment of that.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩgang gi phyir bdag nyid du ma gyur pa'i tha dad pa nges par byed pa ma yin pa de'i phyir ro //üîΩbdag 'di ngo bo nyid kyis tha dad pa gang yin pa las sngon po la sogs pa 'di rtogs pa zhes byed pa dang 'di'i bya ba ste rtogs pa'i las sngon po la sogs pa nges pa yin te /

translated: In response to this, it is said:üîΩBecause that which is not the self is not ascertained as different, therefore, from what is different from the self, this is called ‚Äúits cognition.‚ÄùüîΩThis is the activity of that, that is, the activity of cognition. The object of cognition, such as blue, is ascertained.

original: rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bya ba de'i sgrub byed de bdag tha dad par sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bya ba de'i sgrub byed de bdag tha dad par sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: The proof of that is the establishment of that, the activity that has the nature of cognition. The self is established as different.

original: 'on te tha dad pa'i shes pa mngon sum ni rtogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa bdag ni don thams cad la thun mong ba'i phyir dang / rtag pa'i phyir 'jog par byed par ma gyur mod kyi de dang 'dra ba des ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa'i shes pa mngon sum ni rtogs pa'i sgrub par byed pa bdag ni don thams cad la thun mong ba'i phyir dang / rtag pa'i phyir 'jog par byed par ma gyur mod kyi de dang 'dra ba des ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: But if a different consciousness is the direct perceiver, then the proof of the object‚Äôs existence is the object itself, because the self is not the basis for positing the object, since it is common to all objects and is permanent. So what is the point of positing such a self?

original: smras pa / don gyi rnam pa ma gtogs par /
analyzed: smras pa / don gyi rnam pa ma gtogs par /
translated: Reply: Without the aspect of the object,

original: don dang de ru sbyor byed pa //üîΩshes pa gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: don dang de ru sbyor byed pa // shes pa gzhan gyi rang bzhin gyis //
translated: the consciousness that connects with the objectüîΩcannot be differentiated in any way

original: ji lta bur yang 'byed po min //üîΩde phyir gzhal bya rtogs pa yi //
analyzed: ji lta bur yang 'byed po min // de phyir gzhal bya rtogs pa yi //
translated: from the nature of another consciousness.üîΩTherefore the proof of the object‚Äôs existence

original: sgrub byed gzhal bya'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: sgrub byed gzhal bya'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: is the object itself.

original: 'di las gzhan pa'i sgrub pa yis //
analyzed: 'di las gzhan pa'i sgrub pa yis //
translated: Any other proof

original: de dang las su 'brel mi 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de dang las su 'brel mi 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: would not be related to the object.

original: gang gi phyir rig pa de dang don lhan cig sbyor bar byed pa ni don gyi rnam pa ma rtogs par gzhan gyi rang bzhin ni rtogs pa'i rnam pa nyid kyi tha dad par byed pa po ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rig pa de dang don lhan cig sbyor bar byed pa ni don gyi rnam pa ma rtogs par gzhan gyi rang bzhin ni rtogs pa'i rnam pa nyid kyi tha dad par byed pa po ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: The consciousness that connects with the object does not connect with the object without apprehending the aspect of the object. It is not the case that the aspect of the object is apprehended but the object is not apprehended.

original: gzhal bya'i rnam pa nyid gzhal bya rtogs pa'i sgrub byed yin te ;
analyzed: gzhal bya'i rnam pa nyid gzhal bya rtogs pa'i sgrub byed yin te ;
translated: The aspect of the object itself is the proof of the realization of the object.

original: ji ltar shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa bden pa de bzhin phyi nas 'chad par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar shes pa rnam pa dang bcas pa bden pa de bzhin phyi nas 'chad par byed do //
translated: Just as consciousness is true when it has an aspect, so it will be explained later.

original: rnam pa las gzhan pa'i sgrub byed yod kyang de dang las su lhan cig rig pa'i 'brel pa 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa las gzhan pa'i sgrub byed yod kyang de dang las su lhan cig rig pa'i 'brel pa 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if there were a proof other than the aspect, it would not be established as related to the awareness of the object together with the aspect.

original: 'di'i 'di rig pa'o zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di'i 'di rig pa'o zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not possible to say ‚ÄúThis is the awareness of that.‚Äù

original: 'on te don mngon du byed pas nges par 'gyur na mngon du byed pa 'di ci yin te don gyi ngo bo nyid dam /üîΩ'on te rig pa yin /
analyzed: 'on te don mngon du byed pas nges par 'gyur na mngon du byed pa 'di ci yin te don gyi ngo bo nyid dam / 'on te rig pa yin /
translated: But if it is ascertained by the manifestation of the object, what is this manifestation? Is it the nature of the object or is it awareness?

original: gal te don mngon du byed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni ji ltar 'o na shes pa don mngon du byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te don mngon du byed pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na ni ji ltar 'o na shes pa don mngon du byed par 'gyur te /
translated: If it is the nature of the manifestation of the object, then how can consciousness manifest the object?

original: don de mngon du byed pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don de mngon du byed pa'i ngo bo nyid ni rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ro //

original: 'on te rig pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon du byed na /
analyzed: 'on te rig pa'i ngo bo nyid mngon du byed na /

analyzed: ro na ji ltar don mngon du byed de shes pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi 'gyur ro //

original: de bas na de'i rnam pa can nyid yul rig pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de'i rnam pa can nyid yul rig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the aspect of that is the awareness of the object.

original: 'o na gal te de'i rnam pa can nyid tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: 'o na gal te de'i rnam pa can nyid tshad ma yin la /
translated: If the aspect of that is valid knowledge,

original: rig pa 'bras bu yin na ni de ji ltar tshad ma dang 'bras bu tha dad pa med par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rig pa 'bras bu yin na ni de ji ltar tshad ma dang 'bras bu tha dad pa med par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: and awareness is the result, then how could they be undifferentiated as valid knowledge and result?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / de yang de'i bdag @117a * //
analyzed: smras pa / de yang de'i bdag @117a * //
translated: That is also its nature.

original: gyur nyid // des na 'bras bu don gzhan min //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gyur nyid // des na 'bras bu don gzhan min // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, the result is not a different object.

original: rtogs pa de yang de'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ste gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa de yang de'i rnam pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa ste gzhan ni ma yin no //

original: de'i phyir tshad ma don gyi rnam pa las don gzhan du gyur pa'i rig pa 'bras bur mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tshad ma don gyi rnam pa las don gzhan du gyur pa'i rig pa 'bras bur mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa las tha dad pa'i bde ba la sogs pa'i rnam pa don rig pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no awareness of an object that is different from the aspect of blue and so on, like the aspect of pleasure and so on.

original: sngon po'i rnam pa gcig la yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa du mar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam pa gcig la yang bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa du mar 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in a single aspect of blue, many aspects of pleasure and pain arise.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa nyid nang gi rtogs pa yin pas /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal gyi rnam pa nyid nang gi rtogs pa yin pas /
translated: Since the aspects of pleasure and pain are internal cognitions,

original: phyi rol rig pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs pa yang med do //
analyzed: phyi rol rig pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs pa yang med do //
translated: it is not understood that external objects are cognized.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar bde ba'i rnam pa can nyid nang gi rig pa yin pa de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar bde ba'i rnam pa can nyid nang gi rig pa yin pa de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa can nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, just as the aspect of pleasure is an internal cognition, in the same way, because it has the aspect of blue and so on,

original: phyi rol nyams su myong bas de'i rnam pa can ni tshad ma'o //
analyzed: phyi rol nyams su myong bas de'i rnam pa can ni tshad ma'o //
translated: the experience of external objects is valid cognition that has their aspects.

original: byed pa tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: byed pa tshad ma yin la /

original: byed pa ni byed pa po las tha dad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: byed pa ni byed pa po las tha dad pa ma yin nam /
translated: And is the activity different from the agent?

original: byed pa po'i byed pa la gnas nas gtso bo'i bya ba la phan 'dogs pa yin na /
analyzed: byed pa po'i byed pa la gnas nas gtso bo'i bya ba la phan 'dogs pa yin na /

original: shes pa las tha dad gzhal bya'i ngo bo nyid ma yin zhing /
analyzed: shes pa las tha dad gzhal bya'i ngo bo nyid ma yin zhing /
translated: If it is not the nature of the object of comprehension that is different from consciousness,

original: rtog pa'i bya ba tha dad pa yang ma yin na /
analyzed: rtog pa'i bya ba tha dad pa yang ma yin na /
translated: and the activity of conception is not different,

original: de ji ltar bya ba byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar bya ba byed pa'i dngos por 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How could that be the entity that performs the action?üîΩIn response, it is said:

analyzed: smras pa / don rtogs pa yi bdag nyid kyis // bdag nyid la der 'dzin pa de // byed pas rang gi las la ni ;
translated: The cognition that apprehends the aspectüîΩof the object as having the nature of that objectüîΩappears as if it were engaged

original: / byed dang bcas pa bzhin du snang //
analyzed: / byed dang bcas pa bzhin du snang //
translated: in its own action.

original: rang nyid byed po ma yin yang //
analyzed: rang nyid byed po ma yin yang //
translated: Although it is not the agent,üîΩit is posited as the self of that

original: de yi bdag gir de gzhag phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yi bdag gir de gzhag phyir // zhes bya ba la /
translated: because it is the basis of the self-experience of that.

original: don gyi rnam pa can de'i bdag nyid la 'dzin pa'i shes pa de ni /
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa can de'i bdag nyid la 'dzin pa'i shes pa de ni /
translated: The cognition that apprehends the aspect of the object as having the nature of that object

analyzed: don rtogs pa'i bdag nyid kyi byed pas sngon po la sogs pa rang gi las la byed pa dang bcas pa bzhin du snang ba'o //

analyzed: rnam pa de'i dbang gis don nges pa der rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir yin gyi /

analyzed: shes pa las rnam pa tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: sngon po rig pa'o snyam pa'i rtog pa sngon po'i byed pa po gzhan la rag las pa can nyid ma yin yang /

original: gal te byed pa de la gnas par shes te /
analyzed: gal te byed pa de la gnas par shes te /
translated: If you think that it is established as the agent,

analyzed: kho bos 'di rig pa'o snyam du nges par byed pa de'i phyir /

analyzed: zhe na pa'i dbang gis bya ba dang byed pa dang byed pa po'i ngo bo nyid du shes pa mi 'gal te /

original: rtog pa med pa nyams su myong ba ni sngon po'i ngo bo nyid can gyi shes par snang ba de bas na @117b sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa las tha dad pa'i rig pa med do //
analyzed: rtog pa med pa nyams su myong ba ni sngon po'i ngo bo nyid can gyi shes par snang ba de bas na @117b sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa las tha dad pa'i rig pa med do //

original: shes pas don la byed pa ni ma yin na /
analyzed: shes pas don la byed pa ni ma yin na /

analyzed: de ji ltar shes pas don 'dzin par 'gyur zhe na ;

analyzed: smras pa / dper na rgyu dang 'bras bu rnams //

analyzed: 'dra ba'i bdag nyid du 'byung phyir // bya ba ldan min yang 'jig rten //

analyzed: rgyu gzugs 'dzin zhes brjod pa bzhin //

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩdper na 'jig rten na 'bras bu dang rgyu pha ma 'dra ba'i tshul du 'byung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / dper na 'jig rten na 'bras bu dang rgyu pha ma 'dra ba'i tshul du 'byung ba'i phyir /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:üîΩFor example, in the world, even though the action of apprehending does not exist,

analyzed: 'dzin pa'i byed pa med pa yin yang gzugs 'dzin par brjod do //

analyzed: don gyi rnam pa can nyid sgrub byed yin no //

analyzed: de phyir mthong dang dbang 'brel dang // khyad par gyi blo de dag ni // bya ba la ni chod pa'i phyir //

analyzed: tshad ma nyid du mi 'dod do ;üîΩ/ zhes bya ba la /

analyzed: gtod par byed pa'i shes pa dpyod pa pas rigs la sogs pa yongs su gcod pa la tshad mar 'dod pa dang / dbang po dang 'brel ba gtod par byed pa'i shes pa ni yid ma yin zhing /

analyzed: khyad par gyi blo yang gzegs zen  la sogs pa khyad par can gyi shes pa tshad mar 'dod do //
translated: The special cognition is also the special cognition of Ka·πáƒÅda and so on, which is asserted to be valid.

analyzed: de dag gis gang gi phyir sgrub byed gzhan du las dang 'brel pa ma grub pa de nyid kyi phyir tshad mar rigs pa ma yin no //

analyzed: de ci'i phyir rnam par rtog par byed ce na /

analyzed: smras pa / bya ba la ni byed pa rnams //

analyzed: thams cad phan 'dogs byed mod kyi //

analyzed: gzhan gang tha dad byed po ste //

original: bya ba la sgrub par byed pa dam pa ste /

analyzed: 'di ltar dbang po tha dad pas mthong ba gsal ba dang mi gsal ba la sogs pa tha dad par myong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /

analyzed: kun gyi mtshungs pa'i rgyu yi phyir //

analyzed: de tha dad kyang tha dad med //

analyzed: de bas na chos tha dad pas dbang po rnams tha dad pa'i phyir /

analyzed: dbang po tha dad pa nyid kyis rig pa tha dad par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the difference in the object is due to the difference in the sense faculties,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: dbang po de mngon du phyogs pa'i chos tha dad pas tha dad pa yin na yang gang gi phyir /
analyzed: dbang po de mngon du phyogs pa'i chos tha dad pas tha dad pa yin na yang gang gi phyir /
translated: Even though the object is different due to the difference in the sense faculty that engages it,

original: tha dad med pa ste /
analyzed: tha dad med pa ste /
translated: it is not different.

original: rnam pa dang bral ba'i dbang po 'di sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i yul la mngon du phyogs pa 'di gang las yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa dang bral ba'i dbang po 'di sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa'i yul la mngon du phyogs pa 'di gang las yin te /
translated: Since this sense faculty is devoid of aspects, how could it engage blue, yellow, and so on?

original: ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: It could not!

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa med na sngon po'i yul la dbang po mngon du phyogs par shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa med na sngon po'i yul la dbang po mngon du phyogs par shes pa ma yin no //
translated: If blue and so on are devoid of aspects, it is not known that the sense faculty engages the object of blue.

original: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa rtogs pa sngar yod na /
analyzed: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa rtogs pa sngar yod na /
translated: But if the realization of blue and so on exists prior to the sense faculty,üîΩthen what is the point of engaging it?

original: 'o na mngon du phyogs pas ci zhig bya yang na dbang po la sogs pa de tha dad kyang don so so tha mi dad par rigs pa de don so sor nges pa nyid kyi sngon po 'di'i rig pa 'di yin na zhes ji ltar shes /
analyzed: 'o na mngon du phyogs pas ci zhig bya yang na dbang po la sogs pa de tha dad kyang don so so tha mi dad par rigs pa de don so sor nges pa nyid kyi sngon po 'di'i rig pa 'di yin na zhes ji ltar shes /
translated: Or if the sense faculty and so on are different, but the object is not different, then how do you know that the ascertainment of the object is the cognition of this blue and not that blue?

original: de bas na dbang po ni tha dad par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dbang po ni tha dad par byed pa ma yin no //
