translated: Therefore, the sense faculties do not cause differentiation.

original: des ni lhag ma bshad pa ste /
analyzed: des ni lhag ma bshad pa ste /
translated: The remaining proofs are explained by this:

original: khyad par gyi blo rnams la yang //
analyzed: khyad par gyi blo rnams la yang //
translated: The cognition of difference

original: de dngos med na tha dad med //
analyzed: de dngos med na tha dad med //
translated: does not exist without that.

original: de 'drar blo gzhan dag kyang 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de 'drar blo gzhan dag kyang 'gyur // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Other cognitions would be like that.üîΩThe sense faculties are not the proof.

original: dbang po rnams sgrub byed ma yin par bstan pa des ni lhag ma gtod par byed pa dang dbang po don phrad pa la sogs pa sgrub byed dam pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: dbang po rnams sgrub byed ma yin par bstan pa des ni lhag ma gtod par byed pa dang dbang po don phrad pa la sogs pa sgrub byed dam pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin te /
translated: The remaining proofs, such as the contact of the sense faculty and object, are not the supreme proof.

original: 'di ltar don gyi rnam pa can las 'das na phrad pa la sogs pa rtogs par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'di ltar don gyi rnam pa can las 'das na phrad pa la sogs pa rtogs par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If the form of the object is transcended, contact and so on are not cognized.

original: de ji ltar bya ba'i sgrub byed yin /
analyzed: de ji ltar bya ba'i sgrub byed yin /
translated: How can that be the proof of activity?

original: khyad par @118b gyi blo de'i rnam pa can med na /
analyzed: khyad par @118b gyi blo de'i rnam pa can med na /
translated: The cognition of difference does not exist without the form of that.

original: khyad par gyi blo zhes bya ba tha dad pa 'di grub par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: khyad par gyi blo zhes bya ba tha dad pa 'di grub par mi 'gyur te /
translated: This so-called cognition of difference, which is different, would not be established.

original: khyad par smos pa 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par smos pa 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa'o //
translated: The mention of difference is an illustration.

original: gtong par byed pa'i yang don gyi rnam pa can med na don la gtod par mi 'grub po //
analyzed: gtong par byed pa'i yang don gyi rnam pa can med na don la gtod par mi 'grub po //
translated: If there is no cognition that has the aspect of the object that is to be indicated, then the indication of the object is not established.

original: de bzhin du ste khyad par gyi blo bzhin blo gzhan /
analyzed: de bzhin du ste khyad par gyi blo bzhin blo gzhan /
translated: In the same way, the cognition of the qualifier is not different from the other cognition, that is, the cognition of the qualified.

original: khyad par can gyi blo la yang tha dad pa yod pa ma yin na khyad par dang khyad par can gyi blo de'i phyir bsgrub bya dang bsgrub bya'i dngos por 'gyur //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi blo la yang tha dad pa yod pa ma yin na khyad par dang khyad par can gyi blo de'i phyir bsgrub bya dang bsgrub bya'i dngos por 'gyur //
translated: If the cognition of the qualified and the cognition of the qualifier are not different, then the object to be established and the means of establishing it would be the same.

original: gzhan yang khyad par gyi blo khyad par gyi yul can yin zhing /
analyzed: gzhan yang khyad par gyi blo khyad par gyi yul can yin zhing /
translated: Moreover, the cognition of the qualifier would have a different object from the cognition of the qualified.

original: khyad par can gyi blo yang khyad par can gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed dag spyod yul tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: khyad par can gyi blo yang khyad par can gyi yul can yin pa'i phyir bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed dag spyod yul tha dad par thal bar 'gyur ro ;
translated: And because the cognition of the qualified would have a different object from the cognition of the qualifier, it follows that the object to be established and the means of establishing it would have different objects.

original: /'gyur mod ci ste zhe na /üîΩbya ba dang ni sgrub byed gnyis //
analyzed: /'gyur mod ci ste zhe na / bya ba dang ni sgrub byed gnyis //
translated: What is wrong with that?üîΩWe do not accept that the object to be established and the means of establishing it

original: yul tha dad pa'ang mi 'dod de //
analyzed: yul tha dad pa'ang mi 'dod de //
translated: have different objects.

original: don gcig yin na gnyis don med //
analyzed: don gcig yin na gnyis don med //
translated: If they have the same object, then both are pointless.

original: rim bzhin 'byung ba'ang yod ma yin //
analyzed: rim bzhin 'byung ba'ang yod ma yin //
translated: And they do not occur in sequence.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what he says.

original: pa la sha sta res bsnun na seng ldeng chod par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: pa la sha sta res bsnun na seng ldeng chod par 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: If you were to strike a palm tree with an axe, the axe would not cut through a teak tree.

original: bya ba dang sgrub byed dag gnyi ga la yang yul tha dad par khyed kyang 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba dang sgrub byed dag gnyi ga la yang yul tha dad par khyed kyang 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: You do not assert that the object of the action and the object of the instrument are different.

original: 'on te khyad par dang khyad par can gyi blo dag don gcig pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te khyad par dang khyad par can gyi blo dag don gcig pa yin na /
translated: But if the cognition of the qualifier and the cognition of the qualified have the same object,

original: de lta na ni khyad par dang khyad par can gyi blo dag gnyi ga yang don gcig pa nyid na shes pa gnyis don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni khyad par dang khyad par can gyi blo dag gnyi ga yang don gcig pa nyid na shes pa gnyis don med par 'gyur te /
translated: then the cognition of the qualifier and the cognition of the qualified would have the same object. In that case, it would be meaningless to have two cognitions,

original: shes pa gcig nyid kyis don yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan yang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi blo dag yul gcig na ni rim gyis skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa gcig nyid kyis don yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro // gzhan yang khyad par dang khyad par can gyi blo dag yul gcig na ni rim gyis skye bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: because the object would be completely ascertained by a single cognition.üîΩMoreover, if the cognition of the qualifier and the cognition of the qualified have the same object, they would not arise sequentially.

original: 'on te khyad par can gyi blo dag cig car skye ba de lta na ni khyad par dang khyad par can gyi blo cig car ba'i dngos po bsgrub bya sgrub byed kyi rang bzhin ma yin te ;
analyzed: 'on te khyad par can gyi blo dag cig car skye ba de lta na ni khyad par dang khyad par can gyi blo cig car ba'i dngos po bsgrub bya sgrub byed kyi rang bzhin ma yin te ;
translated: But if the cognition of the qualified arises simultaneously, then the cognition of the qualifier and the cognition of the qualified would not have the nature of the probandum and the probans, which arise simultaneously.

original: gnyi ga grub pa'i phyir //
analyzed: gnyi ga grub pa'i phyir //
translated: Because both are established.

original: cig car na yang bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: cig car na yang bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if they were simultaneous, there would be no object to be established and no means of establishment.

original: 'o na ji ltar khyed kyis yang rnam par shes pa'i cha la cig car du bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dngos por 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar khyed kyis yang rnam par shes pa'i cha la cig car du bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dngos por 'gyur te /
translated: Well then, how is it that you say that the object to be established and the means of establishment exist simultaneously in the aspect of consciousness?

original: gang gis rnam pa tshad ma yin zhing rtogs pa 'bras bur 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis rnam pa tshad ma yin zhing rtogs pa 'bras bur 'gyur zhe na /
translated: By what is the aspect valid knowledge and what is the result of understanding?üîΩWe say:

original: smras pa / blo 'chi //
analyzed: smras pa / blo 'chi //
translated: The mind is destroyed.

original: de yi rnam gzhag la brten nas //
analyzed: de yi rnam gzhag la brten nas //
translated: Based on the presentation of that,

original: sgrub byed sgrub par rnam par gnas //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sgrub byed sgrub par rnam par gnas // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The object to be established and the means of establishment are posited.

original: shes pa'i cha la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dngos po ste /
analyzed: shes pa'i cha la rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos pos bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dngos po ste /
translated: In the aspect of consciousness, the object to be established and the means of establishment exist as cause and effect.

original: 'on kyang blo de shes pa'i cha don gyi rnam pa rtogs pa can dag rig pa de'i yul nges pa can nyid du @119a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang blo de shes pa'i cha don gyi rnam pa rtogs pa can dag rig pa de'i yul nges pa can nyid du @119a * //
translated: However, that mind, which is the aspect of consciousness that is the realization of the aspect of the object, is the object of awareness.

original: rnam par gzhag pa la brten nas bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dngos po yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa la brten nas bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi dngos po yin gyi /
translated: Based on the presentation of that, the object to be established and the means of establishment exist.

original: phrad pa tshad ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phrad pa tshad ma ni ma yin no //
translated: But contact is not valid knowledge.

original: gang gi phyir //
analyzed: gang gi phyir //
translated: Because:

original: bdag nyid kun gyis 'brel na yang //
analyzed: bdag nyid kun gyis 'brel na yang //
translated: Even if there is a connection with all of the self,

original: chos 'ga' zhig gis rtogs 'gyur na //
analyzed: chos 'ga' zhig gis rtogs 'gyur na //
translated: if there is understanding through some phenomenon,

original: de ni nges par mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: de ni nges par mi 'gyur te //
translated: that is not ascertained,

original: 'brel bar bye brag med pa'i phyir //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'brel bar bye brag med pa'i phyir // zhes bya ba la /
translated: because there is no distinction in the connection.

original: gal te phrad pa tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: gal te phrad pa tshad ma yin la /
translated: If contact is a valid means of knowledge,

original: de'i don rtogs pa 'bras bu yin na /
analyzed: de'i don rtogs pa 'bras bu yin na /
translated: and the object of that, understanding, is the result,

original: phrad pa de yang drug tu tha dad de ldan pa dang / ldan pa dang 'phrod pa 'du pa dang / 'du ba dang / brten pa'i 'phrod pa 'du ba dang / ldan pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par can du gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phrad pa de yang drug tu tha dad de ldan pa dang / ldan pa dang 'phrod pa 'du pa dang / 'du ba dang / brten pa'i 'phrod pa 'du ba dang / ldan pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par can du gyur pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: then that contact is differentiated into six: possession, possession and conjunction, conjunction, conjunction that is the support, and that which is distinguished by the distinction of possession.

original: de la dbang po dang ba lang la sogs pa phrad pa ni ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbang po dang ba lang la sogs pa phrad pa ni ldan pa'o //
translated: Among those, the contact of the clear sense faculty and the cow, etc. is possession.

original: ba lang la brten pa'i dkar po la sogs pa'i yon tan ni ldan pa dang 'phrod pa 'du ba'o //
analyzed: ba lang la brten pa'i dkar po la sogs pa'i yon tan ni ldan pa dang 'phrod pa 'du ba'o //
translated: The qualities such as whiteness that are based on the cow are possession and conjunction.

original: dkar po la sogs pa'i yon tan la brten pa'i dkar po nyid la sogs pa'i spyi ni ldan pa la brten pa'i 'phrod pa 'du ba'o //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa'i yon tan la brten pa'i dkar po nyid la sogs pa'i spyi ni ldan pa la brten pa'i 'phrod pa 'du ba'o //
translated: The universals of whiteness, etc., based on the qualities of whiteness, etc., are the conjunctions of the conjoined.

original: rna ba'i nam mkha'i rang bzhin dang sgra ni 'phrod pa 'du ba'o //
analyzed: rna ba'i nam mkha'i rang bzhin dang sgra ni 'phrod pa 'du ba'o //
translated: The nature of space in the ear and sound are the conjunctions of the conjoined.

original: sgra nyid dang rten pa'i 'phrod pa 'du ba'o //
analyzed: sgra nyid dang rten pa'i 'phrod pa 'du ba'o //
translated: Sound itself and the conjunction of the conjoined are the conjunctions of the conjoined.

original: med pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: med pa dang ldan pa'i khyad par gyis khyad par du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The difference is due to the difference of the conjunctions of the conjoined and the conjunctions of the non-conjoined.

original: de la mig dang lhan cig rdzas bdag nyid thams cad kyis gzugs dang ro dang dri la sogs pa dang bcas par 'brel na yang ba lang la sogs pa'i chos 'gal zhig kho na dang ldan par rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de la mig dang lhan cig rdzas bdag nyid thams cad kyis gzugs dang ro dang dri la sogs pa dang bcas par 'brel na yang ba lang la sogs pa'i chos 'gal zhig kho na dang ldan par rtogs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the eye were related to all the substances simultaneously, then the cognition of the cow, etc., would be related to the properties of the cow, etc., and would be cognized as having only the properties of the cow, etc.,

original: ro la sogs pa'i chos dang ni ma yin no zhes nges pa 'dir mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ro la sogs pa'i chos dang ni ma yin no zhes nges pa 'dir mi 'gyur te /
translated: but not as having the properties of taste, etc.

original: mig dang lhan cig 'brel ba'i ldan pa dang / 'phrod pa 'du ba la sogs par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig dang lhan cig 'brel ba'i ldan pa dang / 'phrod pa 'du ba la sogs par bye brag med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This would not be the case, because there would be no difference between the conjunctions of the conjoined and the conjunctions of the non-conjoined in relation to the eye.

original: 'on te ro la sogs pa mig gi yul ma yin pa'i phyir mi 'dzin no zhe na /üîΩ'o na de nyid don gcig la 'du bar bye brag med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te ro la sogs pa mig gi yul ma yin pa'i phyir mi 'dzin no zhe na / 'o na de nyid don gcig la 'du bar bye brag med pa'i phyir /
translated: But if you say that the body is not perceived because the corpse, etc., are not objects of the eye,üîΩthen why is the body not the object of the eye, since it is not different from the elements which are the object of the eye?

original: 'di mig gi yul nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes bsam par bya'o //üîΩde bas na bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'brel na yang chos 'ga' zhig gis khyad par can la sogs pa rnams rtogs par 'gyur zhes zer ba ni /
analyzed: 'di mig gi yul nyid du ji ltar mi 'gyur zhes bsam par bya'o // de bas na bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'brel na yang chos 'ga' zhig gis khyad par can la sogs pa rnams rtogs par 'gyur zhes zer ba ni /
translated: Thus, you should consider that the body is not the object of the eye.

original: rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not reasonable to say that the body is perceived by the eye, even though it is related to the elements, because it has certain qualities, etc.

original: yang na gal te mig gi 'od phyi rol du 'phros pa ni don 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: yang na gal te mig gi 'od phyi rol du 'phros pa ni don 'dzin pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Moreover, if the light of the eye extends outward and is the cause of the perception of objects,

original: de ltar na bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'brel kyang de bzhin du ma lus pa'i gzugs snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag nyid thams cad kyis 'brel kyang de bzhin du ma lus pa'i gzugs snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then the entire body would be seen, since the light extends everywhere.

original: de bas na gsang gseng la sogs pa'i chos dang kha dog dang bar @119b mtshams la sogs pa thams cad mthong bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bas na gsang gseng la sogs pa'i chos dang kha dog dang bar @119b mtshams la sogs pa thams cad mthong bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, all things, such as the hidden parts of the body, color, space, etc., would be seen.

original: 'dus pa tsam tshogs pa'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dus pa tsam tshogs pa'i rnam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But the collection of the elements is not seen.

original: de'i phyir nye ba dang ring ba'i bye brag gis shing mthong ba la gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rnam pa phyi rol du snang ba can gyi lus nyid gsal ba'i rnam pa phyi rol du snang ba can gyi lus nyid gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i ngo
analyzed: de'i phyir nye ba dang ring ba'i bye brag gis shing mthong ba la gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i rnam pa phyi rol du snang ba can gyi lus nyid gsal ba'i rnam pa phyi rol du snang ba can gyi lus nyid gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i ngo
translated: Therefore, the body itself, which has the appearance of clarity and unclarity in seeing a tree due to the distinction of near and far, is the valid knowledge that has the nature of clarity and unclarity.

original: bo nyid can tshad ma'o zhes pa la bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bo nyid can tshad ma'o zhes pa la bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that,üîΩit is said:

original: smras pa / de dbyer med kyang tha dad 'di //
analyzed: smras pa / de dbyer med kyang tha dad 'di //
translated: Though that is inseparable, this difference

original: gang las de ni tshad ma nyid //
analyzed: gang las de ni tshad ma nyid //
translated: from that is the valid knowledge.

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: In that,

original: phrad pa de dbyer med kyang rtogs pa 'di gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i rnam pa gang las grub pa de nyid tshad ma nyid du 'thad do //
analyzed: phrad pa de dbyer med kyang rtogs pa 'di gsal ba dang mi gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i rnam pa gang las grub pa de nyid tshad ma nyid du 'thad do //
translated: though the contact is inseparable, the difference in the nature of clarity and unclarity of this realization is established from that.

original: sbyangs las yin na der snang ba /üîΩmed na der yang gzhag pa med /
analyzed: sbyangs las yin na der snang ba / med na der yang gzhag pa med /
translated: If it is from training, then the appearance of that

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: does not exist, and if it does not exist, then it is not posited as that.

original: 'on te rnam pa med pa'i shes pa yang 'dus kyang khyad par gyis don so sor nges pa tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa med pa'i shes pa yang 'dus kyang khyad par gyis don so sor nges pa tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if the cognition is without aspects, then even though the object is collected, the individual determination of the object is different because of the difference of the cognition.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not logical,

original: sbyangs pas de ltar gzhag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyangs pas de ltar gzhag pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no such establishment by training.

original: shes pa der snang ba med pa ste rnam pa med pa nyid yin na yang /
analyzed: shes pa der snang ba med pa ste rnam pa med pa nyid yin na yang /
translated: Even though the cognition does not appear as that, that is, is without aspects,

original: sbyangs pa nges pas nges pa'i de na mthong ba las skyes nas so sor nges pa dran par byed de /
analyzed: sbyangs pa nges pas nges pa'i de na mthong ba las skyes nas so sor nges pa dran par byed de /
translated: it is remembered as individually determined, because of the certainty of training.

original: rang nyid nges par gyur na'o //üîΩdon nges par mthong ba ni rnam pa med na grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang nyid nges par gyur na'o // don nges par mthong ba ni rnam pa med na grub pa ma yin te /
translated: It is remembered as determined.üîΩIf the seeing of the object is not determined, then the cognition is not established as without aspects.

original: nges par mthong ba med na yang 'du byed pa ma yin la /
analyzed: nges par mthong ba med na yang 'du byed pa ma yin la /
translated: And if the seeing is not determined, then the object is not collected.

original: de med na yang nges pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de med na yang nges pa ma yin no //
translated: And if that is not the case, then it is not determined.

original: gal te bya byed gcig yin par //
analyzed: gal te bya byed gcig yin par //
translated: If the object and the cognition are the same,

original: 'gal lo zhe na mi bden te /
analyzed: 'gal lo zhe na mi bden te /
translated: there is a contradiction.

original: chos tha dad par khas len phyir //üîΩdngos po tha dad med par 'dod //
analyzed: chos tha dad par khas len phyir // dngos po tha dad med par 'dod //
translated: That is not true, because we accept that the object and the cognition are different.

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: We maintain that the thing is not different from the object.

original: 'o na gal te shes pa'i rnam pa tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: 'o na gal te shes pa'i rnam pa tshad ma yin la /
translated: But if the aspect of consciousness is valid knowledge,

original: don rtogs pa 'bras bu yin na ni //
analyzed: don rtogs pa 'bras bu yin na ni //
translated: and the realization of the object is the result,

original: de lta na yang bya ba dang byed pa de dag gcig par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na yang bya ba dang byed pa de dag gcig par 'gyur na /
translated: then the action and the agent would be the same.

original: de ni 'gal ba ste /
analyzed: de ni 'gal ba ste /
translated: That is contradictory,

original: zor ba nyid gcod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: zor ba nyid gcod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because the sword itself is not what is cut.

original: de ni mi bden te /
analyzed: de ni mi bden te /
translated: That is not correct.

original: shes pa tha dad pa med pa'i chos rnam pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes pa tha dad pa med pa'i chos rnam pa la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the different aspects and so on of consciousness are not different things.

original: rnam pa med pa las log pa ni rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes dang / ma rtogs pa las log pa ni rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid de dngos po ste /
analyzed: rnam pa med pa las log pa ni rnam pa dang bcas pa'i shes dang / ma rtogs pa las log pa ni rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid de dngos po ste /
translated: The opposite of the absence of aspects is consciousness with aspects, and the opposite of nonrealization is the essence of realization, which is a thing.

original: shes pa'i mtshan nyid du tha mi dad par 'dod do //
analyzed: shes pa'i mtshan nyid du tha mi dad par 'dod do //
translated: The definition of consciousness is asserted to be undifferentiated.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa med na sngon po nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa med na sngon po nyams su myong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: If there were no aspects such as blue, blue would not be experienced,

original: nyams su myong bar yang sngon po la sogs pa med pa'i phyir sngon po'i nyid dang shes pa ni gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: nyams su myong bar yang sngon po la sogs pa med pa'i phyir sngon po'i nyid dang shes pa ni gcig pa nyid do //
translated: because the experience of blue and so on is blue itself. Consciousness and blue are the same.

original: bya ba dang byed pa dag dngos po nyid kyi tha dad par mthong @120a * //
analyzed: bya ba dang byed pa dag dngos po nyid kyi tha dad par mthong @120a * //
translated: Action and agent are seen to be different things.üîΩ

original: bam yin nam /
analyzed: bam yin nam /
translated: Don‚Äôt you see that action and the agent are different in terms of their real entities?

original: zor ba dang gcod pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: zor ba dang gcod pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: Like a sword and the one who cuts with it?

original: smras pa / bya ba byed par gnas pa ni //
analyzed: smras pa / bya ba byed par gnas pa ni //
translated: Action and the agent

original: thams cad de lha'i rnam pa can //
analyzed: thams cad de lha'i rnam pa can //
translated: are all like that, having the aspect of a god.

original: dngos rnams tha dad 'dod pa la //
analyzed: dngos rnams tha dad 'dod pa la //
translated: In the case of the assertion that things are different,

original: sgro 'dogs pa yis 'jug phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa yis 'jug phyir ro //
translated: they are posited through superimposition.

original: zhes bya ba ni /üîΩgcod pa'i bya ba dang zor ba la sogs pa'i byed pa por gnas par 'jog pa de lta bu'i rnam pa thams cad ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi chos tha dad pas gzhag pa ste /üîΩzor ba la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams tha dad par 'dod pa la bya ba dang byed pa'i rnam pa gzhag pa ni dngos po nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni / gcod pa'i bya ba dang zor ba la sogs pa'i byed pa por gnas par 'jog pa de lta bu'i rnam pa thams cad ldog pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi chos tha dad pas gzhag pa ste / zor ba la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams tha dad par 'dod pa la bya ba dang byed pa'i rnam pa gzhag pa ni dngos po nyid ma yin te /
translated: This is the response.üîΩThe action of cutting and the agent of cutting, such as a sword, are posited as existing through the reason of a different attribute that is the cause of the reversal of all aspects like that.

original: rtog pas sgro btags nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtog pas sgro btags nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the case of the assertion that things such as a sword are different, the action and the agent are not posited in terms of real entities because they are engaged through conceptual superimposition.

original: 'di ltar sngar bcad par ma mthong ba'i shing zor ba'i kha dang 'jog pas bcad par mthong bas bya ba tha dad par brtags te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngar bcad par ma mthong ba'i shing zor ba'i kha dang 'jog pas bcad par mthong bas bya ba tha dad par brtags te /
translated: Thus, since the cutting is seen by the axe and the placing, which were not seen as the cutting before, the action is imagined to be different.

original: ngo shes pa'i dbang gis snga phyi gcig par shes pa de ni tshad mar brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo shes pa'i dbang gis snga phyi gcig par shes pa de ni tshad mar brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: The cognition of the identity of the prior and subsequent through the power of recognition is not described as valid knowledge.

original: de'i phyir sngar gyi shing yang gzhan yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngar gyi shing yang gzhan yin la /
translated: Therefore, the prior tree is different.

original: zor ba la sogs pa dang 'jog pa yang gzhan nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: zor ba la sogs pa dang 'jog pa yang gzhan nyid yin gyi /
translated: The axe and so on and the placing are also different.

original: de la bya ba ma gtogs pa dmigs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de la bya ba ma gtogs pa dmigs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir /
translated: Because the action is not observed apart from them,

original: bya ba 'di ni rtog pas gzhag pa nyid de /
analyzed: bya ba 'di ni rtog pas gzhag pa nyid de /
translated: this action is posited by thought alone.

original: des na bya ba dang byed pa por rnam par 'jog cing sgro 'dogs par byed do //
analyzed: des na bya ba dang byed pa por rnam par 'jog cing sgro 'dogs par byed do //
translated: Therefore it is posited as an action and an agent and is imputed.

original: de bzhin du rnam par rig pa las tha dad par brtag pa bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par rig pa las tha dad par brtag pa bya ste /
translated: In the same way, the representations should be investigated as different.

original: rnam pa ni rig pa thams cad la khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rigs ni rnam pa thams cad la khyab par byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa ni rig pa thams cad la khyab par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir dang / rigs ni rnam pa thams cad la khyab par byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the aspect does not pervade all consciousnesses and the type does pervade all aspects.

original: tha dad pa yin te don dam par snang bzhin pa'i rnam pa nyid rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin te don dam par snang bzhin pa'i rnam pa nyid rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: They are different, because the aspect that appears as the object is the awareness.

original: tshad ma las 'bras bu tha mi dad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: tshad ma las 'bras bu tha mi dad pa kho na yin no //
translated: The result is not different from the valid cognition.

original: de skad du yang slob dpon gyi bya ba dang bcas par rtogs pa'i phyir tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: de skad du yang slob dpon gyi bya ba dang bcas par rtogs pa'i phyir tshad ma yin la /
translated: Thus, it is said that because it is the cognition that is accompanied by the activity of the master, it is valid cognition.

original: rigs pa nyid ni 'bras bu yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rigs pa nyid ni 'bras bu yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: And the result is just the reasoning.

original: yang na rang rig pa ni 'dir 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: yang na rang rig pa ni 'dir 'bras bu ste /
translated: Or, the result here is the reflexive awareness.

original: gnyi ga'i shes pa'i yang rang rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i shes pa'i yang rang rig pa nyid 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The reflexive awareness of both the cognition and the object is the result.

original: don rig par 'bras bu 'thad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: don rig par 'bras bu 'thad pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it tenable that the result is the awareness of the object?

original: 'jig rten pa don 'dod cing gnyer ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa don 'dod cing gnyer ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because worldly people desire and pursue objects.

original: 'jig rten don du gnyer ba can nyid du ma mthong ste /üîΩgang gi tshe don ma mthong ba de'i tshe don ma mthong ba don du gnyer ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten don du gnyer ba can nyid du ma mthong ste / gang gi tshe don ma mthong ba de'i tshe don ma mthong ba don du gnyer ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We do not see that worldly people pursue objects.üîΩWhen they do not see the object, it is impossible for them to pursue the unseen object.

original: ma mthong yang don du gnyer ba thos pa na 'byung ba ma mthong ngam zhe na /
analyzed: ma mthong yang don du gnyer ba thos pa na 'byung ba ma mthong ngam zhe na /
translated: But when they do not see the object, they pursue it when they hear about it.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: thos pa ni brgyud nas mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thos pa ni brgyud nas mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because hearing is seeing indirectly.

original: 'on te ser po la sogs pa'i don @120b rig pa nyid na /
analyzed: 'on te ser po la sogs pa'i don @120b rig pa nyid na /
translated: But if the object, such as yellow, is known,

original: don mi rig par de ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: don mi rig par de ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then how can it be said that the object is not known?

original: 'di la dris pa /
analyzed: 'di la dris pa /
translated: Here, we ask:

original: don rig gang yin mngon sum du //
analyzed: don rig gang yin mngon sum du //
translated: What is the knowledge of the object?

original: so so myong ba gang yin 'di'o //
analyzed: so so myong ba gang yin 'di'o //
translated: It is the individual experience.

original: don rig pa de gang gis yin //
analyzed: don rig pa de gang gis yin //
translated: What is the knowledge of the object?

original: de 'dra yin na 'khrul par 'gyur //
analyzed: de 'dra yin na 'khrul par 'gyur //
translated: If it were like that, it would be mistaken.

original: zhes bya ba la phyi rol gyi don dang 'brel pa can gyi don rig pa gang yin pa de ;
analyzed: zhes bya ba la phyi rol gyi don dang 'brel pa can gyi don rig pa gang yin pa de ;
translated: Here, what is the knowledge of the object that is related to the external object?

original: ci rnam pa med pa yin //
analyzed: ci rnam pa med pa yin //
translated: Is it without an aspect?

original: 'on te rnam pa dang bcas pa yin //
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa dang bcas pa yin //
translated: Or is it with an aspect?

original: rnam pa la ma gtogs pa'i don rig pa med do zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: rnam pa la ma gtogs pa'i don rig pa med do zhes bshad zin to //
translated: It has been explained that there is no knowledge of the object apart from the aspect.

original: 'on kyang gang gi tshe rig pa 'di don ni rnam pa can du mngon sum gyis nyams su myong bas don rig pa de yod na ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang gi tshe rig pa 'di don ni rnam pa can du mngon sum gyis nyams su myong bas don rig pa de yod na ni /
translated: However, when this knowledge of the object is experienced by direct perception as having an aspect, if that knowledge of the object exists,

original: rig pa 'di ni mngon sum yin la /
analyzed: rig pa 'di ni mngon sum yin la /
translated: then this knowledge is direct perception.

original: rig pa de yang don dang 'brel ba can du rgyu gang gis shes //
analyzed: rig pa de yang don dang 'brel ba can du rgyu gang gis shes //
translated: And by what cause is that knowledge known to be related to the object?

original: de dag gis 'di skad du ston te /
analyzed: de dag gis 'di skad du ston te /
translated: They teach this:

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rig pa ni shes pa nyid don rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshig tsam yin gyi /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa rig pa ni shes pa nyid don rig pa'o zhes bya ba ni tshig tsam yin gyi /
translated: The cognition of the aspect of blue and so on is consciousness itself, and it is the cognition of the object.

original: don rig pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don rig pa ni ma yin no //
translated: This is mere verbiage; it is not the cognition of the object.

original: 'on te 'dra ba las don rig par grub pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te 'dra ba las don rig par grub pa ste /
translated: But if it is established that the cognition of the object is similar to it,

original: don gyi phyi rol pa med par de'i rnam pa can med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: don gyi phyi rol pa med par de'i rnam pa can med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: then the cognition of the object is not external, because it does not have the aspect of that.

original: de dang 'dra ba las 'khrul par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba las 'khrul par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: But it is mistaken because it is similar to it.

original: rab rib can gyi skra shad dang sbrang ma la sogs pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi don med kyang skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab rib can gyi skra shad dang sbrang ma la sogs pa rnams ni phyi rol gyi don med kyang skra shad 'dzings pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even though there is no external object, such as the hair, flies, and so on, of one with diseased vision, the aspect of the hair, flies, and so on, exists.

original: de ji ltar de dang dang 'dra ba las don rig par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar de dang dang 'dra ba las don rig par 'gyur /
translated: How can it be that the cognition of the object is similar to it?

original: 'on te 'di myong de gang las //
analyzed: 'on te 'di myong de gang las //
translated: But if it is experienced,

original: de nyid 'di ni dpyad par bya //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de nyid 'di ni dpyad par bya // zhes bya ba la /
translated: then that itself should be investigated.

original: gal te don med na de'i tshe shes pa 'di'i nyams su myong ba de yul gang las yin /
analyzed: gal te don med na de'i tshe shes pa 'di'i nyams su myong ba de yul gang las yin /
translated: If the object does not exist, then from what object is the experience of this consciousness?

original: nyams su myong ba ni nyams su myong ba gyur ba'i don gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni nyams su myong ba gyur ba'i don gyi rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the experience of the object is the cause of the experience.

original: don med na de yang med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: don med na de yang med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the object does not exist, the experience would not exist.

original: 'o na ji ltar rab rib can gyis zla ba gnyis su myong bar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rab rib can gyis zla ba gnyis su myong bar 'gyur /
translated: But how is it that one with cataracts experiences two moons?

original: 'on te 'gal zhig nyams su myong ba'i don nges par rtogs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te 'gal zhig nyams su myong ba'i don nges par rtogs so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the object of the experience is ascertained,

original: 'on te de nyid nyams su myong ba'i don la gnas pa'i 'di ni dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on te de nyid nyams su myong ba'i don la gnas pa'i 'di ni dpyad par bya ste /
translated: then we must investigate whether the object of the experience exists.

original: don ma mthong bar ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i don la gnas pa yin /
analyzed: don ma mthong bar ji ltar nyams su myong ba'i don la gnas pa yin /
translated: How can the object of the experience exist if the object is not seen?

original: 'on te don las skyes pa'i phyir don nyams su myong ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te don las skyes pa'i phyir don nyams su myong ba'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the object of the experience is the object itself because it arises from the object,

original: 'o na mig kyang rig par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na mig kyang rig par 'gyur te /
translated: then the eye would be the object of the experience,

original: de las nyams su myong ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las nyams su myong ba skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the experience arises from the eye.

original: 'on te mig gi rnam pa can shes pa ma yin pas phyi rol gyi don de'i rnam pa can du brtag go zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mig gi rnam pa can shes pa ma yin pas phyi rol gyi don de'i rnam pa can du brtag go zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the object is not the form of the eye consciousness, but the external object that has that form,

original: mig nyid de'i rnam pa can du brtag par bya ba ma yin nam /üîΩ'on te phyi rol gyi rnam @121a * //
analyzed: mig nyid de'i rnam pa can du brtag par bya ba ma yin nam / 'on te phyi rol gyi rnam @121a * //
translated: Is it not the eye itself that is to be investigated as having that aspect?

original: pas phyi rol gyi don brtag go zhe na /
analyzed: pas phyi rol gyi don brtag go zhe na /
translated: Or, is it that external objects are investigated by means of external aspects?

original: de lta na ni me long gi ngos la bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan yod pas phyi rol pa nyid du bzhin brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na ni me long gi ngos la bzhin gyi gzugs brnyan yod pas phyi rol pa nyid du bzhin brtag par bya'o //
translated: If that were so, then since the reflection of a face exists on the surface of a mirror, the face itself would be investigated as being external.

original: de bas na thams cad bdag nyid la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na thams cad bdag nyid la gnas pa ste /
translated: Therefore, everything exists in itself,

original: byad kyi bzhin du gzugs brnyan gyi chos su snang ba'o zhes bya bar 'thad pa yin no /
analyzed: byad kyi bzhin du gzugs brnyan gyi chos su snang ba'o zhes bya bar 'thad pa yin no /
translated: and it is tenable that the reflection appears as a phenomenon that is like a face in a mirror.

original: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
analyzed: // / tshad ma rnam 'grel gyi 'grel pa /
translated: Commentary on Valid Knowledge

original: bam po bcu bzhi pa /
analyzed: bam po bcu bzhi pa /
translated: Fourteenth Chapter

original: de ltar na re zhig 'dri ba 'khrul pa yin pas don rnam par 'jog pa ma yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig 'dri ba 'khrul pa yin pas don rnam par 'jog pa ma yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught that since the question is mistaken, it does not posit an object,

original: da ni 'dra ba med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni 'dra ba med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: now, in order to demonstrate that it is without similarity,üîΩit is said:

original: smras pa / rdul phran de dag gang gis na //üîΩrags par snang dang 'dra bar 'gyur ;
analyzed: smras pa / rdul phran de dag gang gis na // rags par snang dang 'dra bar 'gyur ;
translated: By what means do those atoms

original: / zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la /
translated: become similar to the appearance of the coarse?

original: gang la rags par snang ba'i shes pa de la phra ba'i rdul phra rab de dag 'dra bar byed par tsha dam gang gis go ba yin te /
analyzed: gang la rags par snang ba'i shes pa de la phra ba'i rdul phra rab de dag 'dra bar byed par tsha dam gang gis go ba yin te /
translated: How could the cognition to which the subtle partless particles appear as gross be understood as the same?

original: ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It could not be, is the meaning.

original: rags pa dang phra ba'i rnam pa dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rags pa dang phra ba'i rnam pa dag 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aspects of gross and subtle are contradictory.

original: yan lag can gyi 'dra ba yang med do zhes le'u gnyis par bstan to //
analyzed: yan lag can gyi 'dra ba yang med do zhes le'u gnyis par bstan to //
translated: And it has been demonstrated in the second chapter that there is no similarity of the whole.

original: 'on te don sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang shes pa 'dra ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te don sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dang shes pa 'dra ba'o zhe na /
translated: But if the aspect of the object, such as blue, is the same as the cognition,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: it is not so.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ma rtogs par dbyibs med pa'i phyir dang / dbyibs ma rtogs par yang sngon po la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa ma rtogs par dbyibs med pa'i phyir dang / dbyibs ma rtogs par yang sngon po la sogs pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because without the realization of the aspect of blue, etc., there is no shape, and without the realization of shape, there is no blue, etc.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid shes pa yin na rags pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid shes pa yin na rags pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the cognition of the nature of blue, etc., it would be gross.üîΩIn order to summarize,

original: nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: it says:

original: de ni de yi don dngos med //
analyzed: de ni de yi don dngos med //
translated: That is not the real object.

original: yod na 'khrul pa can du 'gyur //
analyzed: yod na 'khrul pa can du 'gyur //
translated: If it were, it would be mistaken.

original: de myong ba yi ngo bo ni //
analyzed: de myong ba yi ngo bo ni //
translated: The nature of the experience of that

original: sgrub par byed par nus ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: sgrub par byed par nus ma yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: is not capable of being established.

original: de'i phyir de ni shes pa de la don gyi ngo bo nyid med de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni shes pa de la don gyi ngo bo nyid med de /
translated: Thus, that object does not exist in that cognition.

original: don gyi ngo bo nyid de yod na yang de 'khrul pa can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo nyid de yod na yang de 'khrul pa can du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the nature of the object did exist, it would be mistaken.

original: skra shad dang sbrang ma la sogs pa la de'i don myong ba'i dngos po de rab tu bsgrub par mi rigs te /
analyzed: skra shad dang sbrang ma la sogs pa la de'i don myong ba'i dngos po de rab tu bsgrub par mi rigs te /
translated: It is not reasonable to establish the entity of the experience of that object in the form of floating hair, bees, and so on,

original: 'khrul pa nyid kyi don gzhan sgrub pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid kyi don gzhan sgrub pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a mistake does not establish another object.

original: 'on te 'dra ba tsam gyis don sgrub par byed pa ma yin te skra shad la sogs pas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te 'dra ba tsam gyis don sgrub par byed pa ma yin te skra shad la sogs pas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the object is established by mere similarity, it is not established because of the mistake of floating hair, and so on.

original: shes pa skyed pa'i phyir don rig na yang mig kyang 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa skyed pa'i phyir don rig na yang mig kyang 'dzin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the object is known because it produces consciousness, it follows that the eye would also be apprehended.

original: 'on kyang de'i rnam pa can dang de las skyes pa'i shes pas don rig go zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i rnam pa can dang de las skyes pa'i shes pas don rig go zhe na smras pa /
translated: But if it is said that the object is known by the consciousness that has its aspect and arises from it, then it is said:

original: de 'dra ba dang de las skyes //
analyzed: de 'dra ba dang de las skyes //
translated: That similarity and arising

original: gal te myong ba'i mtshan nyid na //
analyzed: gal te myong ba'i mtshan nyid na //
translated: If the characteristic of experience is

original: don mtshungs can gyi shes pa ni //
analyzed: don mtshungs can gyi shes pa ni //
translated: that a consciousness having a similar object

original: mtshungs @121b pa de ma thag myong 'gyur //
analyzed: mtshungs @121b pa de ma thag myong 'gyur //
translated: experiences the similar one immediately preceding it,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: then the following would be true.

original: gal te don de las skyes pa dang de'i rnam pa can nyid don rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te don de las skyes pa dang de'i rnam pa can nyid don rig pa'i mtshan nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If the characteristic of the object-awareness is that it arises from the object and has the aspect of the object, then the immediately preceding consciousness that has a similar object would be the object-awareness.

original: de lta na ni gang la don mtshungs pa yod pa'i shes pa de ma thag pa de shes pa phyi mas rig par 'gyur ro //üîΩgang gi tshe snga ma ni sngon po'i rnam pa can yin la /
analyzed: de lta na ni gang la don mtshungs pa yod pa'i shes pa de ma thag pa de shes pa phyi mas rig par 'gyur ro // gang gi tshe snga ma ni sngon po'i rnam pa can yin la /
translated: In that case, the subsequent consciousness would be aware of the prior consciousness.

original: phyi nas kyang sngon po'i rnam pa can du skyes pa de'i tshe snga ma dang 'dra ba'i phyir dang rgyu yin pa'i phyir yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi nas kyang sngon po'i rnam pa can du skyes pa de'i tshe snga ma dang 'dra ba'i phyir dang rgyu yin pa'i phyir yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: When the prior consciousness has the aspect of blue, and the subsequent consciousness also arises having the aspect of blue, then the prior consciousness would be the object of the subsequent consciousness, because it is similar to it and is its cause.

original: 'on te gang las rnam par skyes pa de shes pa'i yul yin la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa'i rnam pa can de nyid du shes pa phyi ma mi skye ste /
analyzed: 'on te gang las rnam par skyes pa de shes pa'i yul yin la mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i shes pa'i rnam pa gang yin pa'i rnam pa can de nyid du shes pa phyi ma mi skye ste /
translated: But if the object of a consciousness is that from which it arises, then the subsequent consciousness would not arise having the aspect of the object, because it has the aspect of the immediately preceding consciousness.

original: sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i rjes la ser po'i rnam par snang ba skye pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i rjes la ser po'i rnam par snang ba skye pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because a consciousness that has the aspect of blue is followed by the appearance of the aspect of yellow.

original: 'di la smras pa goms pa'i dbang gis gsal bar snang ba can gyi shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de mthong ba ni sngar goms pa'i shes pa yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di la smras pa goms pa'i dbang gis gsal bar snang ba can gyi shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de mthong ba ni sngar goms pa'i shes pa yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: To this we reply: The object of a consciousness that arises with a clear appearance due to the power of habituation is the previously habituated consciousness.

original: ji ltar de'i de ma thag par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i de ma thag par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can that be its antecedent?

original: rigs mtshungs pa'i shes pa gzhan gyi bar du gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mtshungs pa'i shes pa gzhan gyi bar du gnas pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no other consciousness of a similar type that intervenes.

original: 'on te sngar goms pa'i shes pa rigs mi mthun pa'i shes pas chod pa ji ltar dus phyis gsal bar snang ba can gyi shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur zhing gang gis na yul du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sngar goms pa'i shes pa rigs mi mthun pa'i shes pas chod pa ji ltar dus phyis gsal bar snang ba can gyi shes pa'i rgyur 'gyur zhing gang gis na yul du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But if the previously habituated consciousness is interrupted by a consciousness of a different type, how can it be the cause of a later consciousness that has a clear appearance, and by what means can it be its object?

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: de ma thag pa tsam gyi rgyu nyid ma yin te //
analyzed: de ma thag pa tsam gyi rgyu nyid ma yin te //
translated: It is not merely the antecedent condition.

original: 'jigs rten gsum yang phan tshun du rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs rten gsum yang phan tshun du rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because then the three worlds would be the cause of each other.

original: 'on kyang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pas kha cig kho na de ma thag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pas kha cig kho na de ma thag pa'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: However, because it conforms to the subsequent and the reversed, it is only some that become the immediately preceding condition.

original: yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa yang goms pa'i shes pa phyis gsal bar snang ba yod de /
analyzed: yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa yang goms pa'i shes pa phyis gsal bar snang ba yod de /
translated: Also, there is the appearance of clarity later on through the knowledge of familiarity with existence and nonexistence.

original: 'di ltar sngar goms pa'i rjes su mthun par phyi mar 'byung ba'i don snang ba'i phyir chod pa goms pa'i shes pa yang rigs mi mthun pa'i shes pas chod pas dus phyis kyi gsal bar snang ba'i rgyu ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sngar goms pa'i rjes su mthun par phyi mar 'byung ba'i don snang ba'i phyir chod pa goms pa'i shes pa yang rigs mi mthun pa'i shes pas chod pas dus phyis kyi gsal bar snang ba'i rgyu ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, because the object that arises later on accords with the previous familiarity, the object appears clearly. Therefore, how could the knowledge of familiarity not be the cause of the clear appearance later on, since it is separated by a knowledge of a different type?

original: phyin ci log tu mthong ba'i yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyin ci log tu mthong ba'i yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: It would become an object that is seen in a distorted way.

original: yang na goms pa'i stobs kyis rtogs pa'i rnam pa gsal bar snang pa'i rgyu yin pa de'i phyir gsal ba'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir don rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yang na goms pa'i stobs kyis rtogs pa'i rnam pa gsal bar snang pa'i rgyu yin pa de'i phyir gsal ba'i rnam pa can yin pa'i phyir don rig pa ma yin no //
translated: Or, because the cause of the clear appearance of the aspect of realization is the power of familiarity, it is not the knowledge of the object because it has a clear aspect.

original: goms pa'i stobs nyid kyis gsal bar snang ba thams cad don gyi rnam pa can te /
analyzed: goms pa'i stobs nyid kyis gsal bar snang ba thams cad don gyi rnam pa can te /
translated: All clear appearances through the power of familiarity are the aspect of the object.

original: bden pa'i rnam pa can bzhin no //üîΩyang dag pa ma yin pa'i 'dod pas bslad pa'i bud med mthong bzhin don @122a * //
analyzed: bden pa'i rnam pa can bzhin no // yang dag pa ma yin pa'i 'dod pas bslad pa'i bud med mthong bzhin don @122a * //
translated: Like the appearance of true existence.üîΩIt is not reasonable to posit the meaning of what is seen

original: rnam par gzhag par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: as being adulterated by incorrect desire.

original: 'di mthong 'di thos zhes bya ba'i //
analyzed: 'di mthong 'di thos zhes bya ba'i //
translated: The cognition ‚ÄúI see this, I hear that‚Äù

original: blo ni gang du nges pa de //
analyzed: blo ni gang du nges pa de //
translated: is ascertained in relation to something.

original: des myong yin na de nyid ni //
analyzed: des myong yin na de nyid ni //
translated: If it experiences that, then that

original: gang gis de yi mthong 'dod pa //
analyzed: gang gis de yi mthong 'dod pa //
translated: is what desires to see.üîΩThe proximity of the appearance and the seeing

original: snang dang mthong ba de dag gi / nye ba nyid ni dpyad par bya //
analyzed: snang dang mthong ba de dag gi / nye ba nyid ni dpyad par bya //
translated: should be investigated.

original: nye ba nyid du dpyad byas na //üîΩde dag 'brel pa la brten nas //
analyzed: nye ba nyid du dpyad byas na // de dag 'brel pa la brten nas //
translated: Having investigated proximity,

original: lta ba po yi las 'di yin //
analyzed: lta ba po yi las 'di yin //
translated: the activity of the seer is based on the connection.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'di ni gzugs sdu gu mthong ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni gzugs sdu gu mthong ba'o //
translated: This is the seeing of a beautiful form.

original: 'di ni legs par gsungs pa thos pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid ni /
analyzed: 'di ni legs par gsungs pa thos pa'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid ni /
translated: This is the hearing of the well-spoken.üîΩThe cognition that ascertains the object of knowledge, form and sound, arises in that way.

original: gang la gzugs dang sgra'i shes bya nges par byed pa'i blo skye ba de ni nyams su myong ba mthong ba dang thos pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: gang la gzugs dang sgra'i shes bya nges par byed pa'i blo skye ba de ni nyams su myong ba mthong ba dang thos pa'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: That is the experience. It has the nature of seeing and hearing.

original: gzugs dang sgra 'brel pa can de mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs dang sgra 'brel pa can de mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen ma yin te /
translated: The form that is related to sound is not the immediately preceding condition of that sound,

original: de la zhen pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la zhen pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: because there is no attachment to it.

original: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las skyes par mthong bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs pa de ma thag pa'i rkyen las skyes par mthong bar nges pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no certainty that one sees that sound is produced from the immediately preceding condition.

original: snang ba dang mthong ba de dag nye ba nyid de 'brel pa ni dpyad par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: snang ba dang mthong ba de dag nye ba nyid de 'brel pa ni dpyad par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the appearance and the seeing are related to each other, and that this relationship is not to be analyzed?

original: gtan tshigs gang gis de de'i mthong ba por 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs gang gis de de'i mthong ba por 'dod pa'o //
translated: What is the reason for asserting that it is the seer of that?

original: 'di'i dgongs pa 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di'i dgongs pa 'di yin te /
translated: This is the intended meaning.

original: mthong ba las don rig pa ma yin la /
analyzed: mthong ba las don rig pa ma yin la /
translated: It is not that one knows the object from seeing.

original: de'i rjes su 'brel pa cang yi zhen pas don rtogs par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brel pa cang yi zhen pas don rtogs par ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to understand the object through the subsequent attachment to it.

original: 'di ltar mngon sum du don las skyes pa'i mthong bas ni don rnam par 'jog pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mngon sum du don las skyes pa'i mthong bas ni don rnam par 'jog pa yin na /
translated: In this way, the object is established by the seeing that arises from the object.

original: de'i rjes su 'brel pa'i nges par ji ltar rnam par gzhag par bya /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brel pa'i nges par ji ltar rnam par gzhag par bya /
translated: How can the certainty that is related to that be established?

original: mthong ba dang snang ba de dag 'brel pa la brten nas lta ba po'i nges pa 'di yin na /
analyzed: mthong ba dang snang ba de dag 'brel pa la brten nas lta ba po'i nges pa 'di yin na /
translated: But if the ascertainment of the seer is based on the connection between seeing and the appearance,

original: gang gi tshe don snang ba dang mthong bdag 'brel pa nyid mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: gang gi tshe don snang ba dang mthong bdag 'brel pa nyid mi 'grub ste /
translated: then at the time that the connection between the appearance of the object and seeing is not established,

original: don mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don mi mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the object is not seen,

original: de'i tshe ji ltar nyams su ma myong ba'i nges par 'gyur /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar nyams su ma myong ba'i nges par 'gyur /
translated: then how could there be an ascertainment of what is not experienced?

original: 'on te don yin no zhes nges pa yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te don yin no zhes nges pa yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that there is an ascertainment that the object exists,

original: ma yin te don byed pa'i 'bras bus don nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te don byed pa'i 'bras bus don nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: that is not so, because the object is ascertained by the effect of the object‚Äôs function.

original: don byed pa de yang shes pa gzhan kho na ste /
analyzed: don byed pa de yang shes pa gzhan kho na ste /
translated: And that function of the object is just another cognition.

original: de bas na phyi rol nges pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na phyi rol nges pa ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the external object is not ascertained.

original: de bas na don rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na don rnam par gzhag pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the object is not established.

original: 'on te myong ba 'di gang la zhes pa de la lan btab pa //
analyzed: 'on te myong ba 'di gang la zhes pa de la lan btab pa //
translated: But if you reply, ‚ÄúThis experience is of what?‚Äù

original: de myong ba ni de bdag nyid //
analyzed: de myong ba ni de bdag nyid //
translated: The experience of that is its own nature.

original: de ni gzhan gang gi yang min //üîΩmngon sum so sor myong nyid kyang //
analyzed: de ni gzhan gang gi yang min // mngon sum so sor myong nyid kyang //
translated: It is not the experience of anything else.üîΩThe experience of direct perception is also

original: de yang de yi bdag nyid yin //
analyzed: de yang de yi bdag nyid yin //
translated: the experience of its own nature.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what is said.

original: shes pa de'i nyams su myong ba ni bdag nyid yin na /
analyzed: shes pa de'i nyams su myong ba ni bdag nyid yin na /
translated: If the experience of that cognition is itself,

original: de'i nyams su myong ba gang la zhes dri bar rigs pa @122b ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i nyams su myong ba gang la zhes dri bar rigs pa @122b ma yin te /
translated: it is not proper to ask, ‚ÄúThe experience of what?‚Äù

original: ji ltar don gang la yin zhes dris pa de la yang lan ni rten yin no zhes gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar don gang la yin zhes dris pa de la yang lan ni rten yin no zhes gdab par bya'o //
translated: Just as when it is asked, ‚ÄúWith respect to what object?‚Äù the answer is, ‚ÄúThe basis.‚Äù

original: rten de yang gang la yin zhe na /
analyzed: rten de yang gang la yin zhe na /
translated: And if it is asked, ‚ÄúWhat is that basis?‚Äù

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid la'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid la'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: it should be said, ‚ÄúIts own nature.‚Äù

original: de ltar na don nyams su myong ba yang rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa nyid du mthong na /
analyzed: de ltar na don nyams su myong ba yang rang gi ngo bo nyid la gnas pa nyid du mthong na /
translated: Thus, if the experience of the object is seen to be grounded in its own nature,

original: gzhi btsal te ci zhig bya /
analyzed: gzhi btsal te ci zhig bya /
translated: what is the use of searching for a basis?

original: gang yang don med na don gyi myong ba zhes bya ba drug par mi 'gyur ro zhes brtsad pa de gsal ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang yang don med na don gyi myong ba zhes bya ba drug par mi 'gyur ro zhes brtsad pa de gsal ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Also, in response to the objection, ‚ÄúIf the object does not exist, the so-called experience of the object would not take the sixth case,‚Äù in order to clarify this, it is said:

original: nyams su myong ba de ni don dang 'brel pa can gzhan gang gi yang ma yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba de ni don dang 'brel pa can gzhan gang gi yang ma yin no //
translated: That experience is not related to any other object.

original: 'on kyang ji ltar mngon sum gyis rig pa'i don gsal bar nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ltar mngon sum gyis rig pa'i don gsal bar nus pa ma yin te /
translated: However, just as the object that is known by perception is not able to illuminate itself,

original: 'di ltar skye bo thams cad kyis sngon po mthong ba ni phyi rol pa'i gzung ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar skye bo thams cad kyis sngon po mthong ba ni phyi rol pa'i gzung ba ni ma yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is taught that all people see blue, but it is not the external object that is apprehended by non-Buddhists.

original: sngon po'i rnam pa nyid kyang mngon sum gyi rig par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam pa nyid kyang mngon sum gyi rig par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The aspect of blue itself is the object of direct perception,

original: don gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: but not another object.

original: de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa 'di mngon sum gyis so sor rig par bya ba yin pas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa 'di mngon sum gyis so sor rig par bya ba yin pas na /
translated: Therefore, since this blue, etc. is the object of direct perception,

original: mngon sum ni rang rig pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin no //
analyzed: mngon sum ni rang rig pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin no //
translated: direct perception is only of the nature of self-awareness.

original: sngon po'i nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'i drug pa yang rtogs pas sgro btags pa nyid de /
analyzed: sngon po'i nyams su myong ba zhes bya ba'i drug pa yang rtogs pas sgro btags pa nyid de /
translated: The sixth case, called ‚Äúthe experience of blue,‚Äù is also a superimposition by thought.

original: dper na mchi gu'i lus bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mchi gu'i lus bzhin no //
translated: It is like the body of a lump of clay.

original: 'on te myong bar bya ba'i phyir don tha dad pa 'jal ba'i skabs su shes pa'i bdag nyid do zhes zer ba ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te myong bar bya ba'i phyir don tha dad pa 'jal ba'i skabs su shes pa'i bdag nyid do zhes zer ba ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But if it is said that in the context of cognizing a different object for the sake of experience, it is of the nature of consciousness, that is illogical.

original: don ni nyams su myang ba'i yul du yod pa de ni nyams su myong ba ni don gyi yul can no zhe na /
analyzed: don ni nyams su myang ba'i yul du yod pa de ni nyams su myong ba ni don gyi yul can no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that the object that exists as the object of experience is the experiencer, and the experiencer is the subject that has the object,

original: smras pa / blo yis myong bya gzhan med de //
analyzed: smras pa / blo yis myong bya gzhan med de //
translated: Objection: There is no other object of experience than the mind.

original: de myong ba yang gzhan med na //
analyzed: de myong ba yang gzhan med na //
translated: If that is not experienced by another,

original: de la 'ang brtsad pa mtshungs pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la 'ang brtsad pa mtshungs pa'i phyir //
translated: then the same argument applies to that.

original: de phyir de ni rang nyid gsal //
analyzed: de phyir de ni rang nyid gsal //
translated: Therefore, it is self-illuminating.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In response, Aryadeva says:

original: de bas na nyams su myong ba de yis myong bar bya ba'i don gzhan ni med de /
analyzed: de bas na nyams su myong ba de yis myong bar bya ba'i don gzhan ni med de /
translated: There is no other object of experience than that experience.

original: nyams su myong ba rnam pa med pas don dang 'brel pa mi rung ngo zhes bstan to //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba rnam pa med pas don dang 'brel pa mi rung ngo zhes bstan to //
translated: Since experience is without aspects, it is not possible for it to be related to an object.

original: 'on te nyams su myong ba de'i rig par byed pa myong ba gzhan yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te nyams su myong ba de'i rig par byed pa myong ba gzhan yod do zhe na /
translated: If you think that another experience causes the experience of that experience,

original: myong ba de'i rig par byed pa'i myong gzhan ba ni med de /
analyzed: myong ba de'i rig par byed pa'i myong gzhan ba ni med de /
translated: then the experience of that experience is not caused by another experience.

original: myong ba de'i 'dzin par byed pa'i myong ba la yang brtsad pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myong ba de'i 'dzin par byed pa'i myong ba la yang brtsad pa mtshungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The same argument applies to the experience that grasps that experience.

original: nyams su myong ba ni ngo bo nyid la thim pa yin na /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni ngo bo nyid la thim pa yin na /
translated: If experience dissolves into its own nature,

original: ji ltar gzhan gyis rig par byed par 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyis rig par byed par 'gyur /
translated: how can it be caused by another?

original: mngon sum du byed pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kho na yin pa de yang tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: mngon sum du byed pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid kho na yin pa de yang tha dad pa yin na /
translated: If the object and consciousness were different,

original: phan tshun rjes su 'jug pas shes pa dag gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun rjes su 'jug pas shes pa dag gcig pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then since they would mutually engage each other, it would follow that consciousness would be one and the same.

original: de bas @123a * //
analyzed: de bas @123a * //
translated: Therefore,

original: na don dang shes pa ni gzhan gyis rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: na don dang shes pa ni gzhan gyis rig pa ma yin te /
translated: the object and consciousness are not cognized by another.

original: de'i phyir shes pa de ni rang nyid kho nas gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa de ni rang nyid kho nas gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, that consciousness is itself illuminated.

original: 'o na gal te thams cad rang rig pa nyid yin na de lta na ni rang gi ngo bo nyid myong bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te thams cad rang rig pa nyid yin na de lta na ni rang gi ngo bo nyid myong bar 'gyur na /
translated: But if everything is reflexive awareness, then in that case, since its own nature would be experienced,

original: sngon po nyams su myong ba'o zhes ji ltar tha snyad 'dogs te /
analyzed: sngon po nyams su myong ba'o zhes ji ltar tha snyad 'dogs te /
translated: how could one make the conventional statement, ‚ÄúI experience blue‚Äù?

original: sngon po nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sngon po nyams su ma myong ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because blue is not experienced.üîΩIn response, Aryadeva says:

original: smras pa / de yi sngo sogs ngo bo ni //
analyzed: smras pa / de yi sngo sogs ngo bo ni //
translated: The nature of blue and so on

original: rang bzhin yin te nyams su myong de'ang //
analyzed: rang bzhin yin te nyams su myong de'ang //
translated: is its essence, and that is experienced.

original: rang gi ngo bo myong bar gyur pa'i nga //üîΩsngo sogs myong bar grags pa nyid //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo myong bar gyur pa'i nga // sngo sogs myong bar grags pa nyid //
translated: That which experiences its own nature

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: is renowned as the experience of blue and so on.

original: shes pa de'i nyams su myong ba 'di ni sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: shes pa de'i nyams su myong ba 'di ni sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: The experience of that consciousness is the entity of blue, etc.

original: sngon po la sogs pa de yang nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa de yang nyams su myong ba'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: And that blue, etc. is the nature of experience,

original: myong ba dag la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myong ba dag la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not exist apart from experience.

original: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo nyid yin yang sngon po la sogs pa myong bar grags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi ngo bo nyid yin yang sngon po la sogs pa myong bar grags pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, although it is its own nature, it is known as the experience of blue, etc.

original: sngon po tha dad par rig pas sngon po myong bar brjod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po tha dad par rig pas sngon po myong bar brjod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not said that blue is experienced because it is cognized as different from it,

original: sngon po dang myong ba dag tha dad mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po dang myong ba dag tha dad mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because blue and experience are not apprehended as different.

original: des na sngon po ni rang rig pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na sngon po ni rang rig pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, blue is self-awareness.

original: 'o na sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi blo ji ltar bdag nyid gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na sngon po'i rnam pa can gyi blo ji ltar bdag nyid gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: But how can a cognition having the aspect of blue illuminate itself?

original: rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir 'o //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir 'o //
translated: Because it is contradictory for something to act upon itself.

original: ral gri'i so de nyid kyis rang nyid gcod pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: ral gri'i so de nyid kyis rang nyid gcod pa ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt it the case that the edge of a sword does not cut itself?

original: gzhan yang sngon po la sogs pa sgron ma la sogs pas gsal ba yin na /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngon po la sogs pa sgron ma la sogs pas gsal ba yin na /
translated: Moreover, if blue and so on are illuminated by a lamp and so on,

original: ji ltar rang rig par bya ba yin zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / gsal byed rang gi ngo bo yis //
analyzed: ji ltar rang rig par bya ba yin zhe na / smras pa / gsal byed rang gi ngo bo yis //
translated: how are they to be known by themselves?üîΩIn response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:üîΩThey are illuminated by the essence of that which illuminates them,

original: gsal ba yin te bdag nyid phyir //
analyzed: gsal ba yin te bdag nyid phyir //
translated: because they are of the nature of that.

original: ji ltar gsal bar mngon 'dod pa //
analyzed: ji ltar gsal bar mngon 'dod pa //
translated: Just as it is asserted that they are illuminated,

original: de ltar blo bdag rig can yin //
analyzed: de ltar blo bdag rig can yin //
translated: in the same way the mind is aware of itself.

original: zhes bya ba la /üîΩji ltar gsal ba'i sgron ma snang bar gyur pa de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te /üîΩgsal ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / ji ltar gsal ba'i sgron ma snang bar gyur pa de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te / gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir /
translated: In response NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains:

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis gsal bar mngon par 'dod pa de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid can gyi gsal ba'i bdag nyid rig pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis gsal bar mngon par 'dod pa de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid can gyi gsal ba'i bdag nyid rig pa yin te /
translated: Just as it is asserted that a lamp that is illuminated is of the nature of illumination because it is the essence of illumination, in the same way, blue and so on are of the nature of illumination because they are of the nature of blue and so on.

original: rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal bar yang tshad ma gang gis shes pa yin /
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid la byed pa 'gal bar yang tshad ma gang gis shes pa yin /
translated: By what valid knowledge is it known that it is contradictory for something to act on itself?

original: ral gri'i so'i dpe tsam gyis ni don 'grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ral gri'i so'i dpe tsam gyis ni don 'grub pa ma yin te /
translated: The mere example of a sword does not establish the point.

original: dpe ni sgrub byed ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpe ni sgrub byed ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because an example is not a proof.

original: gal te ral gri'i so de'i dpe yis rang la byed pa 'gal bar ston pa de lta na ni /
analyzed: gal te ral gri'i so de'i dpe yis rang la byed pa 'gal bar ston pa de lta na ni /
translated: If you say that the example of the edge of a sword shows that it is contradictory for something to act on itself,

original: rang nyid gsal ba'i sgron ma yang yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang nyid gsal ba'i sgron ma yang yod pa'i phyir /
translated: then, because a lamp is a self-illuminating entity,

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i blo yang rang rig par 'gyur ro//
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i blo yang rang rig par 'gyur ro//
translated: the cognition of blue and so on would be reflexive awareness.

original: @123b 'on te sgron mas bum pa gsal ba bzhin la /üîΩsgron ma rang nyid mig gis 'dzin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: @123b 'on te sgron mas bum pa gsal ba bzhin la / sgron ma rang nyid mig gis 'dzin pa de'i phyir /
translated: But if you say that, like a lamp illuminates a pot,üîΩthe eye sees the lamp itself,

original: sgron ma bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: sgron ma bdag nyid gsal bar byed pa ma yin na /
translated: and therefore the lamp is not a self-illuminating entity,

original: ji ltar dper 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dper 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can it be an example?

original: 'o na sgron ma'i dus na mthong bar gyur pa'i bum pa ji ltar sgron mas mngon par gsal bar bya ba yin /
analyzed: 'o na sgron ma'i dus na mthong bar gyur pa'i bum pa ji ltar sgron mas mngon par gsal bar bya ba yin /
translated: But if you say that the pot that is seen at the time of the lamp is what is illuminated by the lamp,

original: sgron ma'i sngon du ma mthong ba phyis mthong bar gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sgron ma'i sngon du ma mthong ba phyis mthong bar gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: because the pot was not seen before the lamp and later it is seen,

original: sgron mas gsal bar bya ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: sgron mas gsal bar bya ba'o zhe na /
translated: the pot is what is illuminated by the lamp.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: bum pa gsal bzhin pa'i lus can de nyid kyi tshe skyes pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bum pa gsal bzhin pa'i lus can de nyid kyi tshe skyes pa'i phyir /
translated: Because the pot that is seen at the time of the lamp is produced at that time,

original: sngon gyi dus su ni tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi dus su ni tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not seen at an earlier time.

original: de bas na bum pa dang sgron ma lhan cig dmigs pas gsal bar bya ba dang gsal bar byed pa'i dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na bum pa dang sgron ma lhan cig dmigs pas gsal bar bya ba dang gsal bar byed pa'i dngos po ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, since a pot and a lamp are not simultaneously observed, they are not things that illuminate or are illuminated.

original: sngon po dang ser po dag bzhin no //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po dag bzhin no //
translated: They are like blue and yellow.

original: 'on te sgron ma mig gis gsal lo zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sgron ma mig gis gsal lo zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the lamp illuminates the eye,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: that is not so.

original: mig dang dus mnyam pas gsal bar byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mig dang dus mnyam pas gsal bar byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is impossible for the lamp to illuminate the eye simultaneously with the eye.

original: 'on te sgron ma la mngon du phyogs pa'i mig gsal bar byed pa'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sgron ma la mngon du phyogs pa'i mig gsal bar byed pa'o zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the lamp illuminates the eye that faces it,

original: mngon du phyogs pa zhes bya ba de ci zhig yin te /
analyzed: mngon du phyogs pa zhes bya ba de ci zhig yin te /
translated: what is this ‚Äúfacing‚Äù?

original: rang gi ngo bo nyid yin nam /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo nyid yin nam /
translated: Is it the essence of the eye?
