original: gal te ngo bo nyid yin pa de'i tshe mig kyang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa nyid de gang gi yang gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid yin pa de'i tshe mig kyang rang gi ngo bo la gnas pa nyid de gang gi yang gsal bar byed pa ma yin no //
translated: If it is the essence of the eye, then the eye is just abiding in its own essence and does not illuminate anything.

original: 'on te mngon par phyogs pa tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te mngon par phyogs pa tha dad pa yin na /
translated: But if facing is different from the eye,

original: de lta na yang de rang gi ngo bo nyid la thim pa'i phyir gang gi yang bya ba ma yin no//
analyzed: de lta na yang de rang gi ngo bo nyid la thim pa'i phyir gang gi yang bya ba ma yin no//
translated: then since it is absorbed in its own essence, it does not perform any function.

original: de'i phyir sngon po dang sgron ma la sogs pa rnams rang gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon po dang sgron ma la sogs pa rnams rang gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid de /
translated: Therefore, blue, a lamp, and so on are intrinsically self-illuminating.

original: khyad par ni khyad par can gyi dngos por 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par ni khyad par can gyi dngos por 'brel pa'o //
translated: A qualifier is related to a thing that is qualified.

original: des ni de nyid kyi bdag nyid kyis skyed pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: des ni de nyid kyi bdag nyid kyis skyed pa'i phyir 'gal ba yin te /
translated: Since it is generated by that very nature, it is contradictory.

original: rang la byed pa 'gal bar de la rigs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: rang la byed pa 'gal bar de la rigs par 'gyur na /
translated: If it is logical that an action is contradictory with respect to itself,

original: rang rig pa ni de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kho na yin na /
analyzed: rang rig pa ni de'i rang gi ngo bo nyid kho na yin na /
translated: then if reflexive awareness is the very nature of that,

original: ji ltar bdag nyid dang 'gal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag nyid dang 'gal bar 'gyur /
translated: how could it be contradictory with respect to itself?

original: de bas ser po la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid myong ba'o zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas ser po la sogs pa ni rang gi ngo bo nyid myong ba'o zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is established that yellow and so on are the experience of one‚Äôs own nature.üîΩMoreover:

original: gzhan yang / des ni don gzhan rig na yang //üîΩrig bya rig byed dag mi 'thad //
analyzed: gzhan yang / des ni don gzhan rig na yang // rig bya rig byed dag mi 'thad //
translated: Even if it cognizes other objects,

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: the object of cognition and cognition are untenable.

original: blo de yis phyi rol gyi don gzhan rig na ni /
analyzed: blo de yis phyi rol gyi don gzhan rig na ni /
translated: If that mind cognizes other external objects,

original: rig bya dang rig par byed pa 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rig bya dang rig par byed pa 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: the object of cognition and the cognition are untenable.

original: 'di ltar gal te blo rang nyid gsal na de'i tshe blo'i dus na phyi rol gyi don gsal ba'am /üîΩmi gsal bar 'gyur grang na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te blo rang nyid gsal na de'i tshe blo'i dus na phyi rol gyi don gsal ba'am / mi gsal bar 'gyur grang na /
translated: As such, if the mind itself is clear, then at the time of the mind, the external object would be clear or unclear.

original: blo'i dus na don gsal bar gyur pa de ni ji ltar blo 'dis gsal bar brjod par bya ste /üîΩde'i tshe blo dang sngon po la sogs pa la tha dad @124a * //
analyzed: blo'i dus na don gsal bar gyur pa de ni ji ltar blo 'dis gsal bar brjod par bya ste / de'i tshe blo dang sngon po la sogs pa la tha dad @124a * //
translated: If the object is clear at the time of the mind, how could it be said that this mind makes it clear?

original: pa ci yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa ci yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because at that time the mind and blue and so on are not different in the slightest.

original: khyad par med par yang gal te blos sngon po gsal bar byed na /
analyzed: khyad par med par yang gal te blos sngon po gsal bar byed na /
translated: If the mind makes blue clear without being different from it,

original: sngon po nyid blo'i gsal bar byed par ci ste mi 'gyur /
analyzed: sngon po nyid blo'i gsal bar byed par ci ste mi 'gyur /
translated: why does it not make blue itself clear?

original: 'on te sngon po mi gsal bar 'gyur ba yin pa de lta na gang du sngon po'i rang gi ngo bo la gnas par snang ba de ji ltar sngon po tha dad pa'i shes pa'i rig par bya bar brjod de /
analyzed: 'on te sngon po mi gsal bar 'gyur ba yin pa de lta na gang du sngon po'i rang gi ngo bo la gnas par snang ba de ji ltar sngon po tha dad pa'i shes pa'i rig par bya bar brjod de /
translated: If blue is not clear, then how could that which appears to abide in the essence of blue be said to be the object of a consciousness that is different from blue?

original: gsal ba ni gsal ba'i ngo bo ma rtogs par de la ltos pa'i gsal ba rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba ni gsal ba'i ngo bo ma rtogs par de la ltos pa'i gsal ba rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because if the clear is not understood to be the essence of the clear, the clear that depends on it is not understood.

original: 'on te sngon por snang ba de bzhin du mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'on te sngon por snang ba de bzhin du mi 'thad pa'i phyir /
translated: But if it is not tenable that the appearance as blue is just that,

original: 'dzin par shes so zhe na /
analyzed: 'dzin par shes so zhe na /
translated: then it is the apprehending consciousness.

original: 'o na sngon por gsal ba blo yin nam /
analyzed: 'o na sngon por gsal ba blo yin nam /
translated: But is the clarity of blue the mind?

original: 'on te sngon po yin grang na /
analyzed: 'on te sngon po yin grang na /
translated: Or is it blue?

original: gal te gsal ba de blo yin na /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba de blo yin na /
translated: If the clarity is the mind,

original: 'on ni shes pa nyid sngon por 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on ni shes pa nyid sngon por 'gyur te /
translated: then consciousness itself would be blue,

original: rang gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gsal ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the nature of clarity.

original: 'on te sngon po yin na /
analyzed: 'on te sngon po yin na /
translated: But if it is blue,

original: 'o na ni de rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni de rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: then it would not be cognized,

original: sngon po gsal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po gsal ba ma yin no //
translated: because blue is not clarity.

original: snang ba lkog tu gyur pa yin na sngon por snang ba'o zhes brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: snang ba lkog tu gyur pa yin na sngon por snang ba'o zhes brjod par mi nus te /
translated: If the appearance is hidden, it cannot be said to be the appearance of blue.

original: des na sngon po la sogs pa rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas so //
analyzed: des na sngon po la sogs pa rang rig pa'i ngo bo nyid du gnas so //
translated: Therefore, blue and so on exist as the nature of reflexive awareness.

original: 'o na gal te rang rig pa nyid thams cad yin na /
analyzed: 'o na gal te rang rig pa nyid thams cad yin na /
translated: But if reflexive awareness is everything,

original: ji ltar bdag gis 'di shes so zhes gsungs ba dang 'dzin par snang zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gis 'di shes so zhes gsungs ba dang 'dzin par snang zhe na /
translated: how can it be said that ‚ÄúI know this‚Äù and that there is an appearance of apprehending?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / rig bya rig byed rnam can med //
analyzed: smras pa / rig bya rig byed rnam can med //
translated: There is no object of awareness and an act of awareness.

original: ji ltar 'khrul par mthong gyur pa //
analyzed: ji ltar 'khrul par mthong gyur pa //
translated: How is it that the confused see it?

original: rnam par phye ba'i mtshan nyid ni //
analyzed: rnam par phye ba'i mtshan nyid ni //
translated: The defining characteristic of the differentiation

original: gzung 'dzin rnam par bslad pa yin //
analyzed: gzung 'dzin rnam par bslad pa yin //
translated: Is the pollution of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: de ltar rnam gzhag byas pa 'di //üîΩgang tshe ska sogs shes tha dad //üîΩde tshe gzung dang 'dzin pa yin //
analyzed: de ltar rnam gzhag byas pa 'di // gang tshe ska sogs shes tha dad // de tshe gzung dang 'dzin pa yin //
translated: This presentation

original: mtshan nyid can las brtsad pa min //
analyzed: mtshan nyid can las brtsad pa min //
translated: Is not a dispute about the characteristicüîΩOf the one who is aware and the one who is made aware.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: In this verse,

original: gang la rig par bya ba dang rig par byed pa yod pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rig byed de ni ji ltar de rnam pa gang zhig gis skye bo 'khrul pa rnams kyis mthong bar gyur pa'i rnam pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang la rig par bya ba dang rig par byed pa yod pa ma yin pa'i rnam par rig byed de ni ji ltar de rnam pa gang zhig gis skye bo 'khrul pa rnams kyis mthong bar gyur pa'i rnam pa de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The representation that does not exist as the object of awareness and the agent of awareness, how is it that the confused people see it? In order to teach that very aspect,

original: tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid de tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pas bslad pa'i shes pa gang la yod pa de ni /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid de tha dad pa'i ngo bo nyid gzung ba dang 'dzin pas bslad pa'i shes pa gang la yod pa de ni /
translated: The defining characteristic of the differentiation, the different natures, is the consciousness that has the pollution of the apprehended and the apprehender.

original: de ltar de rnam pa de yis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par gzhag par byas pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rig byed de /
analyzed: de ltar de rnam pa de yis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo nyid du rnam par gzhag par byas pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rig byed de /
translated: Thus, that which is posited as the nature of the apprehended and apprehender by that aspect is the representation.

original: gang gi tshe ste gang du skra shad la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin yod pa ma yin pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can du snang ba /
analyzed: gang gi tshe ste gang du skra shad la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin yod pa ma yin pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i rnam pa can du snang ba /
translated: When, i.e., where, there is the appearance of the aspect of the apprehended and apprehender that does not exist, like the cognition of falling hair, etc.,

original: de'i tshe ste de ru gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can du nges par de la @124b brtsad bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe ste de ru gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i mtshan nyid can du nges par de la @124b brtsad bar mi bya'o //
translated: then, i.e., there, one should not dispute that it is ascertained as having the character of the apprehended and apprehender.

original: de ni 'di skad du ston te /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du ston te /
translated: This is what is being taught.

original: rtog pa med pas mthong ba la gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa med pas mthong ba la gzung ba dang 'dzin par snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: The appearance of the apprehended and apprehender is not in seeing that is without conceptuality,

original: rang gi ngo bo kho na myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo kho na myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the experience of its own nature alone.

original: rnam par rtog pa snang ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po skra shad la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa snang ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po skra shad la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The appearance of conceptuality is like the entity of the apprehended and apprehender, falling hair, etc.

original: de'i phyir bden pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bden pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not true.

original: 'o na te skra shad dang sbrang bu la sogs pa la gnod pa can snang bas /
analyzed: 'o na te skra shad dang sbrang bu la sogs pa la gnod pa can snang bas /
translated: But in the case of the appearance of a floating hair, a fly, and so on, there is a fault.

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa tha dad pa med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa tha dad pa med pa yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the distinction between subject and object does not exist.

original: sngon po la sogs pa 'di la ni gnod pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa 'di la ni gnod pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: But in the case of blue and so on, there is no fault.

original: yod pa nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: yod pa nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, they exist.

original: rtog pa med pas nyams su myong ba las rang rgyud pa'i sngon po la sogs pa dang bde ba la sogs pa la rnam pa can nyid myong ba ni rtog pas gzhag pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por yod pa nyid la gnod pa can yin
analyzed: rtog pa med pas nyams su myong ba las rang rgyud pa'i sngon po la sogs pa dang bde ba la sogs pa la rnam pa can nyid myong ba ni rtog pas gzhag pa'i phyir gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos por yod pa nyid la gnod pa can yin
translated: The experience of blue and so on and pleasure and so on that is intrinsic to the experience that is free from thought is posited by thought. Therefore it is a fault that the existence of the distinction between subject and object is not undermined.

original: no / 'di ltar dngul gyi shes pas mthong ba'i don phyin ci log tu zhen pa'i gnod pa can nya phyis kyi shes pa yin no //
analyzed: no / 'di ltar dngul gyi shes pas mthong ba'i don phyin ci log tu zhen pa'i gnod pa can nya phyis kyi shes pa yin no //
translated: The consciousness of silver is the consciousness of nacre that is the fault of the mistaken adherence to the object seen.

original: 'dir yang rtog pas gzhag pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po phyin ci log dngos po gnyis rig pa de'i phyir tha dad pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dir yang rtog pas gzhag pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po phyin ci log dngos po gnyis rig pa de'i phyir tha dad pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Here, because of the awareness of the two unreal things, the apprehended and apprehender, posited by thought, there is no separate apprehended and apprehender.

original: shes pa tha dad pa la dmigs pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa tha dad pa la dmigs pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not that consciousness is the object of a separate consciousness.

original: de'i phyir shes pa thams cad dmigs pa med pa can nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa thams cad dmigs pa med pa can nyid do //
translated: Therefore, all consciousnesses are without an object.

original: de las gzhan rig med pa'i phyir//
analyzed: de las gzhan rig med pa'i phyir//
translated: Because there is no awareness other than that,

original: rang rig 'bras bu yin par 'dod //üîΩces bya ba ni /
analyzed: rang rig 'bras bu yin par 'dod // ces bya ba ni /
translated: self-awareness is asserted to be the effect.

original: shes pa de las gzhan pa'i phyi rol rig pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: shes pa de las gzhan pa'i phyi rol rig pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because there is no external awareness other than that consciousness.

original: rang rig pa 'bras bur rigs te /
analyzed: rang rig pa 'bras bur rigs te /
translated: Therefore, self-awareness is suitable as the effect.

original: tha dad par rig pa'i gnas pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang mthong ba med pa'i don rig pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad par rig pa'i gnas pa dang bral ba'i phyir dang mthong ba med pa'i don rig pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: Because it is free from the state of being an awareness of a different object and free from being an awareness of an object not seen.

original: 'di la brtsad pa /
analyzed: 'di la brtsad pa /
translated: Here, someone objects:

original: gal te phyi rol myong gyur na//
analyzed: gal te phyi rol myong gyur na//
translated: If there is experience of an external object,

original: nyes pa cer 'gyur ci yang med //
analyzed: nyes pa cer 'gyur ci yang med //
translated: what is the problem?

original: phyi rol don de myong gyur pa //
analyzed: phyi rol don de myong gyur pa //
translated: If there is experience of an external object,

original: 'di nyid kyis ji bstan par 'gyur //üîΩzhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyis ji bstan par 'gyur // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This very experience of external objects teaches what?

original: de la gal te phyi rol gyi don nyams su myong bar gyur pa 'dis nyes pa ci zhig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la gal te phyi rol gyi don nyams su myong bar gyur pa 'dis nyes pa ci zhig tu 'gyur te /
translated: Here, if the experience of external objects is accepted, what fault is there?

original: gang gis phyi rol myong ba med pas phyi rol rig pa med do zhes ngal bar byed de /
analyzed: gang gis phyi rol myong ba med pas phyi rol rig pa med do zhes ngal bar byed de /
translated: Since there is no experience of external objects, why do you tire yourself out saying that external objects do not exist?

original: ji ltar 'jig rten pas tha snyad btags pa de ltar yod pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten pas tha snyad btags pa de ltar yod pa'o //
translated: External objects exist in the way that they are designated by worldly conventions.

original: 'jig rten na dmigs pa'i tha snyad yod pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: 'jig rten na dmigs pa'i tha snyad yod pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since the convention of the apprehension of external objects exists in the world,

original: de med pa ma yin pas mthong ba'i tha snyad ji snyed pa yod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de med pa ma yin pas mthong ba'i tha snyad ji snyed pa yod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: external objects are not nonexistent. Therefore, as many conventions of seeing as there are, exist.

original: 'on kyang phyi rol gyi don de myong bar gyur ba 'di nyid kyis ci zhig bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi rol gyi don de myong bar gyur ba 'di nyid kyis ci zhig bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: However, this very experience of external objects teaches what?

original: @125a * // 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don myong bar gyur pa na /üîΩci myong ba shes pas gzhag pas yin nam /
analyzed: @125a * // 'di ltar phyi rol gyi don myong bar gyur pa na / ci myong ba shes pas gzhag pas yin nam /
translated: Thus, when external objects are experienced,

original: don gyis bzhag pas yin /
analyzed: don gyis bzhag pas yin /
translated: is it posited as an experience because it is posited by consciousness?üîΩOr is it posited by the object?

original: de la gal te nyams su myong ba shes pas bzhag pas don myong ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la gal te nyams su myong ba shes pas bzhag pas don myong ba yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that since experience is posited by consciousness, the object is experienced,üîΩ

original: de'i phyir 'di skad du /üîΩgal te blo de'i rnam can na //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di skad du / gal te blo de'i rnam can na //
translated: If you say that the object is experienced because it is posited by consciousness that experiences it, then why is this?üîΩIf the object exists

original: rnam pa'i khyad par can de yod //
analyzed: rnam pa'i khyad par can de yod //
translated: in the aspect of that consciousness,

original: de ni phyi'am gzhan las zhes //
analyzed: de ni phyi'am gzhan las zhes //
translated: then is it external or is it other?

original: dpyad pa 'di ni mi 'os sam //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: dpyad pa 'di ni mi 'os sam // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: This analysis is appropriate.

original: gal te blo de'i rnam pa can gyi blo de yod na ni rnam pa'i khyad par can snang na don du 'gyur ro //üîΩ'on kyang blo de phyi rol gyi don las skye'am /
analyzed: gal te blo de'i rnam pa can gyi blo de yod na ni rnam pa'i khyad par can snang na don du 'gyur ro // 'on kyang blo de phyi rol gyi don las skye'am /
translated: If the object exists in the aspect of that consciousness, then it is the object when it appears in the aspect of that consciousness.

original: gzhan goms pa'i bag chags las yin zhes dpyad par 'os pa yin no //üîΩ'o na gal te phyi rol gyi rnam pa can gyi blo yin pa de ltar na phyi rol yod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan goms pa'i bag chags las yin zhes dpyad par 'os pa yin no // 'o na gal te phyi rol gyi rnam pa can gyi blo yin pa de ltar na phyi rol yod par 'gyur te /
translated: But is that consciousness produced from an external object or is it other, produced from habitual tendencies? This analysis is appropriate.

original: de med na de'i rnam pa can rig pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de med na de'i rnam pa can rig pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If it is a consciousness that has an external aspect, then the external object exists, because if it does not exist, it is not tenable that it has that aspect.

original: 'di nyid dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This should be analyzed.

original: phyi rol gyi rnam pa can bya ba ci'i phyir 'thad de /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rnam pa can bya ba ci'i phyir 'thad de /
translated: Why is it tenable that it has external aspects?

original: phyi rol rig pa med par de'i rnam pa can gyi rig pa mi 'grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyi rol rig pa med par de'i rnam pa can gyi rig pa mi 'grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is it not the case that the cognition that has the aspect of that does not occur without the perception of the external object?

original: de'i phyir phyi rol mthong ba bzhin du khas blang bar bya na /
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol mthong ba bzhin du khas blang bar bya na /
translated: Therefore, just as external objects are perceived, it must be accepted that the aspect of the external object is perceived.

original: de la yang phyi rol mthong ba gzhan de'i rnam pa can nyid yin pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la yang phyi rol mthong ba gzhan de'i rnam pa can nyid yin pas thug pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But in that case, since the aspect of the external object is perceived, there would be an infinite regress.

original: 'on te rnam pa med pa'i mig gis mthong ba'i don yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te rnam pa med pa'i mig gis mthong ba'i don yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the object that is seen by the eye that lacks an aspect exists,

original: de la yang smras pa /
analyzed: de la yang smras pa /
translated: we reply:

original: mthong ba'i khyad par dang bral ba //
analyzed: mthong ba'i khyad par dang bral ba //
translated: Without the distinction of seeing,

original: mi 'dzin de 'dzin na 'dzin phyir //
analyzed: mi 'dzin de 'dzin na 'dzin phyir //
translated: it is not apprehended. If it is apprehended, it is apprehended because it is seen.

original: mthong ba sngon por snang ba yin //
analyzed: mthong ba sngon por snang ba yin //
translated: Seeing is the appearance of blue.

original: phyi rol yan gar don yod min //üîΩzhes bya ba la //
analyzed: phyi rol yan gar don yod min //üîΩzhes bya ba la //
translated: The external object alone does not exist.

original: mthong ba nyid kyi khyad par de dang bral bar sngon po mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du sngon po dang bral ba'i mthong ba mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / sngon po de 'dzin pa na mthong ba yang sngon po'i bdag nyid can du 'dzin pa'i phyir dang de bzhin du sngon por mthong ba de 'dzin pa na sngon por mthong ba'i bdag nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba nyid kyi khyad par de dang bral bar sngon po mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du sngon po dang bral ba'i mthong ba mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / sngon po de 'dzin pa na mthong ba yang sngon po'i bdag nyid can du 'dzin pa'i phyir dang de bzhin du sngon por mthong ba de 'dzin pa na sngon por mthong ba'i bdag nyid du 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: And when blue is apprehended, seeing is also apprehended as having the nature of blue, and likewise, when the seeing of blue is apprehended, the seeing of blue is apprehended as having the nature of the seeing of blue.

original: mthong ba ni sngon por snang ba can yin gyi /
analyzed: mthong ba ni sngon por snang ba can yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, seeing has the appearance of blue.

original: rnam pa med pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa med pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not without an aspect.

original: de bzhin du sngon por mthong ba ni phyi rol pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon por mthong ba ni phyi rol pa ma yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Likewise, the seeing of blue is not external. Therefore,

original: mthong ba las tha dad pa'i don med de //
analyzed: mthong ba las tha dad pa'i don med de //
translated: an object that is separate from seeing does not exist.

original: 'di ltar gang ji ltar mthong ba de de bzhin du khas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang ji ltar mthong ba de de bzhin du khas blang bar bya ste /
translated: Thus, whatever is seen must be accepted as it is seen.

original: dper na sngon po ser pos dben pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon po ser pos dben pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, blue is empty of yellow.

original: mthong ba'i khongs su chud pa nyid sngon por snang gi //
analyzed: mthong ba'i khongs su chud pa nyid sngon por snang gi //
translated: It is included in the seen, and it appears as blue.

original: tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not different from that.

original: de'i phyir phyi rol par @125b khas blang bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol par @125b khas blang bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be accepted as external.

original: 'on te mthong ba ni nang na snang ba yin la /
analyzed: 'on te mthong ba ni nang na snang ba yin la /
translated: But if you say that the seeing is the appearance within,

original: phyi rol na sngon por snang ba don de dang nye ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: phyi rol na sngon por snang ba don de dang nye ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: and the blue appearance is the external object that is near to it, that is not so.

original: gzhan yod pas sngon por snang bar mi rung ngo zhes bstan to //
analyzed: gzhan yod pas sngon por snang bar mi rung ngo zhes bstan to //
translated: It has been shown that it is not suitable for the blue appearance to be the external object because of the existence of something else.

original: gzhan yod par gyur kyang dong zhan mngon du byed par mi rigs te /
analyzed: gzhan yod par gyur kyang dong zhan mngon du byed par mi rigs te /
translated: Even if the external object exists, it is not suitable to be the object of perception.

original: don de rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don de rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis lkog tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that object is hidden by its own nature.

original: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis lkog tu gyur pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te sngon po la sogs pa rang gi ngo bo nyid kyis lkog tu gyur pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that blue, etc. are not hidden by their own nature,

original: de lta na ni rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na ni rtogs pa'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then it would be the nature of understanding.

original: lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa med na /
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa ma yin pa med na /
translated: Because if there is no hiddenness,

original: rtogs pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtogs pa nyams su myong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: there would be the experience of understanding.

original: de bas na sngon po'i shes pa rang gsal ba'i rang bzhin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
analyzed: de bas na sngon po'i shes pa rang gsal ba'i rang bzhin no zhes bya bar gnas so //
translated: Therefore, it is established that the consciousness of blue is the nature of self-clarity.

original: 'o na gal te mthong ba las tha dad pa'i don med na sngon po dang ser po la sogs par snang ba gang las tha dad pa yin /
analyzed: 'o na gal te mthong ba las tha dad pa'i don med na sngon po dang ser po la sogs par snang ba gang las tha dad pa yin /
translated: If the object is not different from seeing, then from what is the appearance of blue, yellow, and so on different?

original: 'on te mig nyid kyis mthong ba tha dad par byed de /
analyzed: 'on te mig nyid kyis mthong ba tha dad par byed de /
translated: Or does the eye itself make the difference?

original: skra shad la sogs pa bzhin yin na /
analyzed: skra shad la sogs pa bzhin yin na /
translated: Like the appearance of floating hairs and so on,

original: gcig gi ngo bo nyid du mthong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig gi ngo bo nyid du mthong bar 'gyur te /
translated: it would be seen as a single entity.

original: dper na rab rib kyis bslad pa'i mig nam mkha' la skra shad du snang ba 'jog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rab rib kyis bslad pa'i mig nam mkha' la skra shad du snang ba 'jog pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the appearance of floating hairs in the sky for someone with diseased vision.

original: sngon po la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dag pa'i mig gi shes pa'i snang ba yin pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid dag pa'i mig gi shes pa'i snang ba yin pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since blue and so on are the appearance of eye consciousness, which is the nature of various entities,

original: don sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid shes pa tha dad par byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: don sna tshogs pa'i ngo bo nyid shes pa tha dad par byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: it is the various entities of the object that make the difference in consciousness.üîΩIn response to that, it is said:

original: smras pa / de phyir 'ga' zhig la la ni //
analyzed: smras pa / de phyir 'ga' zhig la la ni //
translated: Therefore, some are awakened

original: nang gi bag chags sad par byed //
analyzed: nang gi bag chags sad par byed //
translated: by inner latent tendencies.

original: de phyir blo ni rnam nges kyi //
analyzed: de phyir blo ni rnam nges kyi //
translated: Therefore, the mind is not dependent

original: phyi rol don la ltos ma yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyi rol don la ltos ma yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: On external objects.

original: sngon po mthong ba skyes pa la 'ga' zhig yul la sogs pa nang gi bag chags sad par byed pa 'ga' zhig gis yin te /
analyzed: sngon po mthong ba skyes pa la 'ga' zhig yul la sogs pa nang gi bag chags sad par byed pa 'ga' zhig gis yin te /
translated: In the arising of the perception of blue, there is some cause that awakens the internal latent potentialities.

original: bag chags sad par byed pa de las yul dang dus kyi rnam pa nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: bag chags sad par byed pa de las yul dang dus kyi rnam pa nges pa yin gyi /
translated: From that cause that awakens the latent potentialities, there is the ascertainment of the aspect of the object and the time.

original: phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don la ltos pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not dependent on an external object.

original: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa yang bag chags sad pa'i bye brag gis yul dang dus nges pa can gyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod chags la sogs pa yang bag chags sad pa'i bye brag gis yul dang dus nges pa can gyi rnam pa ste /
translated: In the same way, desire and so on are also the ascertainment of the aspect of the object and the time by the awakening of the latent potentialities.

original: ji ltar yang mi bden par snang ba'i rtog pas sngar gyi yul spyod pa'i dran pa yul so so nges pa'i cha nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar yang mi bden par snang ba'i rtog pas sngar gyi yul spyod pa'i dran pa yul so so nges pa'i cha nyid yin gyi /
translated: But just as the appearance of the object is not real, the memory of the previous object is the aspect of the ascertainment of the individual object by the conceptual consciousness.

original: don la ltos pa can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don la ltos pa can ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not dependent on an object.

original: rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa rgyu nges pa de bzhin du bag chags tha dad pas sngon po la sogs pa rig pa sad pa'i tshe na yang nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rmi lam la sogs pa'i shes pa rgyu nges pa de bzhin du bag chags tha dad pas sngon po la sogs pa rig pa sad pa'i tshe na yang nges pa yin gyi /
translated: Just as the consciousness of dreams, etc., is determined by its cause, so also when one is awake, the cognition of blue, etc., is determined by the different latent impressions.

original: phyi rol gyi don dang 'brel pa'i shes pa ni gang du yang mthong ba ma yin no//
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don dang 'brel pa'i shes pa ni gang du yang mthong ba ma yin no//
translated: But a consciousness related to an external object is not seen anywhere.

original: @126a * // de bas na shes pa'i rnam pa mthong ba las don du rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: @126a * // de bas na shes pa'i rnam pa mthong ba las don du rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, one does not cognize an object from seeing the aspect of consciousness.

original: nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to summarize, he says:

original: de phyir tshul gnyis can gcig yod //
analyzed: de phyir tshul gnyis can gcig yod //
translated: Therefore, there is one with two modes.üîΩThis one with two modes,

original: gang zhig de ltar nyams myong dang // dran pa'i rnam pa can 'di gnyis //
analyzed: gang zhig de ltar nyams myong dang // dran pa'i rnam pa can 'di gnyis //
translated: Which has the aspect of experience and memory,

original: nyams su myong ba 'bras bu yin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba 'bras bu yin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Is the result of experience.

original: sngon po'i rnam pa dang rtogs pa'i rnam pa'i tshul gnyis pa can gyi shes pa gcig nyid do //
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam pa dang rtogs pa'i rnam pa'i tshul gnyis pa can gyi shes pa gcig nyid do //
translated: There is one consciousness that has the two modes of the aspect of blue and the aspect of the cognition of blue.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gang zhig las de ltar sngon po'i rang bzhin dang / rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyams su myong bar gyur ba dang / dran par gyur pa de las sngon po dang rtogs pa'i rnam pa gnyis can gyi shes pa nyams su myong ba 'di ni 'bras bu yin te don nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gang zhig las de ltar sngon po'i rang bzhin dang / rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyams su myong bar gyur ba dang / dran par gyur pa de las sngon po dang rtogs pa'i rnam pa gnyis can gyi shes pa nyams su myong ba 'di ni 'bras bu yin te don nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Whatever is experienced as the nature of blue and the nature of cognition, and is remembered, is the effect of that, because the experience of the object does not exist.

original: phyi rol rig pas nyams su myong bar rtogs par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: phyi rol rig pas nyams su myong bar rtogs par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it understood that it is experienced by the awareness of the external object?

original: ji ltar rang rig pa yin zhe na /üîΩsmras pa / gang tshe 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa'am //
analyzed: ji ltar rang rig pa yin zhe na / smras pa / gang tshe 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa'am //
translated: How is it reflexive awareness?üîΩIn response, it is said:

original: de dngos grub na gzhan dag ni //
analyzed: de dngos grub na gzhan dag ni //
translated: When the object is established as desirable or undesirable,

original: rnam rig rgyu yi yul dag kyang //
analyzed: rnam rig rgyu yi yul dag kyang //
translated: and the other is the object that is the cause of awareness,

original: de yis de ltar myong ba yin //üîΩzhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de yis de ltar myong ba yin // zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is experienced in that way.

original: gang gi tshe rgyu las 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos por grub pa na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe rgyu las 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi dngos por grub pa na /
translated: When the object is established as having the nature of the desirable, the undesirable, and so on,

original: 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa'i don gzhan gang zhig rnam par rig pa'i rgyu yul yin te /

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

analyzed: shes pa'i cha sngon po'i rnam pa la don du rnam par zhen pa'i phyir ro //

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: don 'dod pa'am mi 'dod pa ste yid du 'ong ba'i rnam pa'am yid du mi 'ong ba'i rnam par rig par 'gyur ro //

analyzed: ji ltar nyams su myong ba nyid //
